title: Restoration Project Manager
description:
Reports To: Operations Manager"A mind built for excellence. A spirit built for service." What does a Restoration Project Manager (RPM) with Paul Davis Toronto / York Region
  • Celebrate completion of projects with a team of skilled tradespeople, homeowners grateful to be back in their homes, and your Paul Davis team members
  • Improve your community by serving others
  • Continuously learn about improving results and setting proper expectations of others
  • Learn new things daily about construction and building homes
  • Have fun and be part of a growing business!
RPM's work with owners and sub-contractors after traumatic events such as a fire or flood to clean up and repair damage to residential and commercial property. As a RPM, you will manage the renovation, as well as control and communicate the budget effectively. This means you will spend a good deal of time in the field to see your projects get completed properly.Why The Team Needs You? Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We will need you to build foundational relationships based on trust, actively listen, and find ways to manage a team to complete projects successfully. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results.Why Join The Team? We are an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. Built upon principles of customer service, dynamic decision-making and leadership, we have the tools to continue our rapid growth. Our team puts emphasis into living our Vision, Mission and Values to be more than just a service provider – our Restoration Project Managers are on the front lines of restoring their communities by leading others to complete construction projects on budget and up to the industry standard. You will have the autonomy after training to control your schedule and continually seek learning opportunities that will improve your skill set.Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results. Team Compensation and Benefits:
  • Ongoing Leadership Development Program and industry events
  • One on One mentorship
  • Three months of structured training to learn the Paul Davis Way
  • Access to Paul Davis University and regular training opportunities
  • Cell phone provided by company
  • Vehicle allowance
  • PTO and sick days with flexible schedule
  • Base commission on projects completed. Our current RPM's yearly pay range from $60,000 to $1100,000 depending on their production. No limit to earning potential.
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):
  • Ability to lead and develop team
  • Career emphasis on learning and continuing education
  • Sound planning and organizational skills
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience
Construction project management experience is welcomed if willing to learn a new process. If limited experience but you meet all qualifications, we will invest in your training. Role on the Team (Job Functions):
  • Meet operational objectives of: Sales, Gross Margin, Brand Experience
  • Track metrics during bi-weekly GS&R
  • Confirm budget and work orders before start of project.
  • Ensure compliance with standards and regulations.
  • Participate in local community events.
  • Build relationships with key customers – direct and B2B.
  • Seek partnerships to improve performance with vendors and tradesman.
 Skills Desired of Team Member:
  • Self-motivated to get results
  • Loves working with clients and tradesman
  • Effectively schedules ahead while maintaining flexibility
  • Thrives under high performance environments
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Is succinct and professional with written communication
  • Loves to work hard
  • Enjoys taking care of others
 Are you Paul Davis?Before You Can Take the Field: Working Conditions and Physical Requirements: The physical environment requires the employee to work all types of both indoor and outdoor conditions. Frequently required to use personal protective equipment, having ability to stand or walk, occasionally bending, squatting, climbing stairs and lifting up to 50 pounds.Paul Davis is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Senior Project Manager (FT)
description:
ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg is an industry leader, remediating properties damaged by water, fire, mould, etc. We are currently seeking experienced Project Managers. We offer a competitive salary, company vehicle or allowance, company-paid benefits, and the opportunity for ongoing professional training.  Salary includes base salary plus commissions.

Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with property-owner and their insurance company throughout the project
  • Manage all stages of claims including job quality inspections
  • Meet or exceed all project expectations and deadlines
  • Manage multiple projects at a time
  • Provide clear and detailed work orders to remediation and construction teams
  • Prepare job estimates for insurance adjusters
  • Problem-solve through challenging job issues. No job is the same.
  • Generate and maintain relationships with insurance adjusters
  • Participate in week-long on-call rotation approx. every 5 weeks

Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of remediation and reconstruction for water, fire, mould, vandalism, wind etc.
  • Minimum 3 years industry and insurance-related experience 
  • Knowledge of building and related codes and safety standards
  • knowledge of MS Office, Xactimate, Xactanalysis
  • Ability to adapt to and learn new technologies and devices
  • Driven to offer exceptional customer service
  • Motivated to build long-lasting relationships
  • Strong ability to lead and motivate others
  • Valid driver’s license and criminal record search certificate

Assets:
  • Water Remediation Technician certificate
  • Fire and Smoke Restoration Technician certificate
  • Trauma Technician certificate
  • Knowledge of Symbility Estimating Software
  • Secondary Education in construction management


Salary commensurate with experience and motivation.  





    About ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg:

    As a top Emergency Restoration company in Manitoba, we specialize in the remediation and rebuild of properties damaged by water, fire, title claims, mould, plus much more.

title: Concrete Restoration Foreman
description:
Vector is a global leader in preserving concrete and masonry structures and facilities. With over 50 years of industry experience, our innovative, cost-effective concrete repair and cathodic protection technologies are developed and installed by our dedicated Concrete Preservation Alliance professionals who are committed to the highest standards of safety and service. The Concrete Preservation Alliance consists of Vector Construction, Vector Corrosion Technologies, VCS and NDT Corporation. If you're looking to make an impact, our company is the perfect place and has a large portfolio of projects for you to be part of! Explore the possibilities with Vector Corrosion Technologies today!

We are currently seeking experienced Concrete Restoration Foremen to join our elite team of concrete restoration specialists. Our Foremen oversee the day to day field operations for each assigned project. You will be responsible for providing a supportive and hands-on leadership approach by working alongside their teams performing a variety of construction-related tasks that include the restoration and protection of concrete structures, application of Vector’s corrosion mitigation processes, and assisting with other duties specific to a project. The right individual for this position will demonstrate a high level of energy and leadership skills.

Key Accountabilities:
  • This individual will be responsible for supporting and fostering Vector’s safety program and behavior-based safety culture at all times.
  • Will be responsible for coordinating tasks and allocating jobs according to project requirements.
  • Will be responsible for developing and managing site logistics plans.
  • Will have the ability to enable a team to grow and succeed through effective feedback, instruction, and encouragement.

Requirements:
  • Successful candidates will be required to register with the Construction and Specialized Workers Union Local 506  after 2 weeks of employment. 
  • Must have the ability to safely operate necessary tools and equipment with good manual dexterity for their intended purposes. Necessary training will be provided.
  • 5+ years related work experience an asset but not necessary; industrial concrete experience is preferred.
  • Heavy lifting is required.
  • Must be willing to regularly travel to complete out of town projects when required
  • Some weekend, evening, and/or night shift work may be required.

Benefits Include:
  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Life Insurance, Group health and dental benefits
  • Training and development opportunities within the company

A Workplace Where You Can Grow:
Vector creates an environment that fosters continuous growth and learning – both professionally and personally. Our training & development, safety programs, and workplace environment create a positive family-feeling, employee-first culture, that helps us deliver the highest standard of work in the concrete restoration industry.

Vector Corrosion Technologies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Trade Consultant
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
RH at its core is about taste, and we believe the idea of scaling taste is large and far reaching.

The RH brand attracts the best designers, artisans, manufacturers and talent in our industry, scaling and rendering their work more valuable across our integrated platform, enabling us to curate the most compelling collection of luxury home furnishings in the world. We are moving the brand beyond curating and selling products to conceptualizing and selling spaces by building an ecosystem of products, places, services and spaces that elevates and establishes the RH brand as a global thought leader, taste and place maker.

At RH we believe deeply that the \"right\" people are our greatest asset. We value people with high energy, who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart, creative and have a point of view. People who see the answer in every problem, versus those who see the problem in every answer. People who are driven, determined and won't take \"no\" for an answer. We value team players, people who are more concerned with what's right, rather than who's right.

RH is seeking a Trade Consultant with an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for building a thriving trade business. This role is expected to deliver first-class service to our client and our teams, creating a luxury experience.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Live Our Vision, Values and Beliefs every day
  • Represent the RH brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism
  • Work in partnership with the Residential Trade Leader to grow the interior design trade business
  • Qualify and educate potential design and trade clientele through consultations, site visits, assisting with design development, internal coordination of services and product installations
  • Provide product expertise and elevated service
  • Maintain a strong interest in the luxury and design industry and support the visual and Quality standards within the Gallery

OUR REQUIREMENTS
  • Experience in a high-end interior design showroom
  • Strategic, highly organized and results-oriented
  • Commitment to Quality with exceptional attention to detail
  • Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for building a thriving trade business
  • Proficiency with Mac Operating System, Microsoft Office and Google Applications

OUR PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
  • Must have clean driving record (MVR) and current driver's license
  • Ability to travel locally or out of state
  • Ability to lift and mobilize small to medium items, up to 25 lbs. while utilizing appropriate equipment and safety techniques
  • Ability to maneuver effectively around Gallery floor, stock room and office
  • Position entails prolonged standing, twisting, stooping, kneeling, squatting, bending and climbing
ABOUT US
RH is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by federal or state law or local ordinance.

title: Junior Geomorphologist/Stream Restoration Scientist
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

We have a specialized geomorphology team that uses a science-based, interdisciplinary approach based on detailed knowledge of riverine and coastal geomorphology, process sedimentology, hydraulics, and geomatics. Our tailored services include geomorphological characterization, creek and shoreline restoration, geomatics, fluvial and coastal hazard assessments, and hydraulic and morphological modelling, to protect, maintain, restore, and improve fluvial and coastal systems.

We are currently seeking a Junior level Geomorphologist/Restoration Technician to join this hardworking and growing group. The position is suitable for a Geoscientist-in-Training (GIT) or Engineer-in-Training (EIT). The successful candidate will be a self-motivating individual with strong analytical, computational, and problem-solving abilities. Come grow with us... and join a great team!

Responsibilities:

  • Analysis and presentation of technical information and reports
  • Undertake corridor and crossing studies in order to identify risk from natural hazards
  • Provide support to stream restoration projects based on channel processes
  • Undertake field data collection exercises, as required, including data synthesis
  • Work with various forms of spatial information, including digital topographic data and aerial imagery
  • Assist in the completion of monitoring studies
  • Coordinate construction implementation of channel restoration designs
  • Travel as required for various field programs

Skills, Proficiencies and Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate or graduate degree in a Physical Geography, Geomorphology, River Engineering, Fluid Mechanics, or equivalent education
  • Ability to work towards acquiring a Professional Geoscientist (P.Geo.) accreditation in Geomorphology or Professional Engineering (P.Eng.) license in the Province of Ontario
  • Demonstrated scientific skills in a range of areas including field data collection, river mechanics, sediment transport, geomorphic processes, and hydraulics
  • Experience in related aspects of water resources including environmental geoscience, biogeography, aquatic and ecological sciences is considered an asset
  • Working familiarity in digital cartography (GIS), airphoto interpretation/manipulation, and field surveys (total station, RTK) will be considered an asset
  • Strong communication skills with the proven track record to present clearly, and promote understanding through effective verbal, written and listening skills
  • Possess strong digital literacy: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
  • AutoCAD or hydraulic model software experience would be an asset
  • Valid G driver’s license

Covid Vaccine Position Statement

In response to the evolving Covid-19 pandemic and recent client requirements, GHD has implemented a policy requiring its employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.  It is a requirement of this position that you be vaccinated against Covid-19 and you will be required to disclose your vaccine status and show proof of vaccination prior to commencement of employment.  GHD will consider reasonable accommodation requests in the event you are unable to be vaccinated on the basis of a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

title: Lead Cleaning/Contents Technician
description:
ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg remediates properties damaged by water, fire, mould, etc. We are looking for experienced Cleaning/Contents Technicians to clean properties and customer contents, often damaged by smoke or water. We offer a competitive salary, a company-paid benefits package to qualifying employees, and the opportunity for ongoing professional training.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Lead a team to complete the tasks set out on work orders including but not limited to:
  • Packing of contents from damaged properties
  • Clean, sanitize and deodorize contents damaged by water, smoke, etc.
  • Clean residential and commercial properties damaged by water and fire, etc.
  • Record, track, and warehouse customer contents
  • Remediation & restoration of damaged properties
  • Participate in on-call rotation
 
 REQUIREMENTS:
  • 3+ years experience in the restoration industry
  • Experience leading a team
  • Commercial & residential cleaning experience
  • Post-construction & office cleaning experience
  • Ability to accurately record and track customers’ contents
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Criminal record search upon hire
  • Current valid driver’s license with clean driving record
  • Current IICRC – FSRT &/or CPT certificate
 
ASSETS:
  • IICRC certifications such as: OCT, WRT, CCT, UFT
  • Experience with contents tracking software such as Encircle or Assured Packout
  • Experience cleaning and sanitizing restoration equipment
  • Remediation and rebuild experience
  • First Aid Certification

 Pay based on experience.  Please attach resume when responding to ad.




    About ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg:

    As a top Emergency Restoration company in Manitoba, we specialize in the remediation and rebuild of properties damaged by water, fire, title claims, mould, plus much more.

title: Urban Forestry and Restoration Specialist
description:
Urban Forest Associates Inc. (UFORA) is an ecological consulting and contracting firm working to restore and maintain natural habitats in the Greater Toronto Area since 1993.

We are seeking experienced people for positions with the company starting in spring 2022. Some positions are seasonal while others could become permanent. There is one position to fill on the field crews, starting at $22.00/hr (40-hour work week at most times but longer in April to June). The crew will work mainly Monday to Friday 8 AM - 4:30 PM, as well as some evenings and weekends at times. Flexibility in work schedule will be required to accommodate volunteer work events on occasional weekends. The work is mainly outdoors in all weather. A moderate to high level of physical ability is required.

 

Major Responsibilities:  The successful candidates will work on a field crew to carry out work that improves the ecological health of all aspects of the urban forest.

Work will be a combination of the following duties:

· Controlling invasive plants using various methods.

· Planting native trees, shrubs, and herbaceous plants, both independently and with volunteers.

· Preparing sites for future restoration work using various methods.

· Caring for plants in the nursery.

· Maintaining planted material through watering, mulching, weeding, and pruning.

· Monitoring planted vegetation for survival success and maintenance needs.

· Leading volunteer community and school planting events.

· Assisting in arboricultural assessments of trees and conducting plant inventories.

· Cleaning up dumped materials in ravines.

· Installing erosion-control materials on slopes and riverbanks, and building trails.

· Collecting seed.

· Operating and maintaining various equipment including van, pick-up truck, brush cutter, chain saw, hand tools, water pump and other associated equipment.

· Keeping records of tasks performed including planting, maintenance, and monitoring activities.

· Performing other tasks related to the work as assigned.

 

Qualifications:

1. Experience in natural area management and/or related disciplines including ecological restoration, gardening, landscaping, landscape architecture, or forest regeneration techniques.

2. Post-secondary education in Ecology, Forestry, Arboriculture, Environmental Science or related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

3. Ability to identify native and non-native plants and plant communities of Southern Ontario, or ability to learn species identification.

4. Must possess a valid Ontario Driver's License, Class "G" or better.

5. Ability to work cooperatively with self-directed work groups and community volunteers.

6. Ability to perform manual labour and safely lift weights up to 30 kilograms.

7. Have or be willing to obtain an Ontario Pesticide Applicators License with a Forestry Exterminator designation for applying herbicide, and participate in a chainsaw safety course.

8. Valid First Aid and CPR certification would be an asset.

9. Excellent interpersonal skills including written and oral communication skills and report writing would be an asset.

10. Own vehicle is an asset but not necessary.

 

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Water Restoration Technician
description:
Reports To: Project Manager

What does a Mitigation Technician with Paul Davis do?

  • Serve others within your community in their time of need
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Work hard and take pride in completing projects (i.e. mitigating flood and fire damage)
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency while communicating through modern technology
Why Join The Team? 

Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, providing industry training and giving technicians the opportunity to become experts in the field through certifications and Paul Davis University.

Built upon principles of customer service, dynamic decision-making and leadership, we have the tools to continue our rapid growth. Our team puts emphasis into living our Vision, Mission and Values to be more than just a service provider – our Mitigation Technicians are on the front lines of restoring their communities by being first on site after disasters strike (i.e. floods, fires) and will be leading the mitigation effort to restore the property.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.

Why The Team Needs You? 

Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy.  Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people.  It is challenging to make customers happy when faced with a traumatic event but you will love being a technician if you take pride in your work and have fun while working with others. Team Compensation and Benefits:

  • Leadership Development - our company grows from the inside. If you are determined and motivated enough, ask about participation in our leadership development initiative to grow your career and explore new opportunities
  • Monthly cross-training opportunities to advance your career
  • Flex schedule - at Paul Davis we are committed to our team and their well-being. We have instituted the ability for flex hours that ensures team members get the time they need for personal matters while still being able to work full time.
  • Paid training
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Bonus program for performance
  • Referral program
  • Great culture and team dynamic
  • Hourly pay: $18.00 to $24.00/hour based on experience and certifications
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):

  • Desire to join a world-class team and contribute a positive attitude
  • Dedication to customer service
  • Fluent in English
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record
  • Have the ability to work nights/weekends and overtime, if needed
  • Ability to lift 75 LBS frequently
  • Desire to continually learn new things

title: Office Administrator
description:
Alberici subsidiary, BRC Group, is seeking an Office Administrator to provide administrative office support on a full time,  basis. This position is office based out of the Uxbridge office with occasional travel to the Burlington office 

BRC Group provides masonry, historic rehabilitation, and concrete formwork construction services throughout Ontario.

The Office Administrator is responsible for receiving all visitors and callers to the main office, coordinating all mail and deliveries and provide Safety and Operational support. Confidentiality, professionalism, diplomacy, and strong communication skills  are required. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following, however, other duties may be assigned.  Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

General Office and Administrative Support to include but not limited to:

  • Performs all administrative duties
  • Manages incoming calls
  • Answers or directs general inquiries from employees and the public relating to the organization in a helpful and courteous manner.
  • Manages sorting and delivery of incoming mail and courier packages.
  • Prepares outgoing mail, parcels and courier deliveries; track shipments as required.
  • Provides meeting services (such as video equipment, audio equipment, projectors, catering, clean up, etc.) as requested.
  • Ensures office equipment is maintained and in working order
  • Ensures kitchen is tidy and stocked.
  • Ensures reception area and meeting rooms are organized with a professional appearance.
  • Assist IT with requests as needed.
  • Oversight and management of project documentation.
  • Setup credit accounts with new vendors/ suppliers.
  • Order miscellaneous tools/material for projects.
  • Prints drawings and specifications for project sites
  • Coordinate travel bookings for employees.
  • Submit employee expense reports as required
  • Provide Safety administrative support (i.e. documentation, coordinate training, update training logs, etc.)
  • Collect and submit requalification documentation as required.
  • Submit “Form1000” or “Notice of Project” forms
  • Travel to sites within Southern Ontario as required.
  • Maintains office inventory.

Cost/Accounting/ Payroll Support to include but not limited to:

  • Process (code, forward, approve) invoices via Workflow
  • Payroll support – complete and submit weekly payroll time sheets
  • Submit monthly corporate card expense reports

Education, Experience, and Skills

Post- secondary status or post-secondary school education in Business Administration or Communications and a minimum of 1 to 3 years related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

 

 

**Accommodations will be made upon request throughout the Recruitment process**

*We thank all applicants, however only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview*

See job description

title: Client Services Associate
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
RH at its core is about taste, and we believe the idea of scaling taste is large and far reaching.

The RH brand attracts the best designers, artisans, manufacturers and talent in our industry, scaling and rendering their work more valuable across our integrated platform, enabling us to curate the most compelling collection of luxury home furnishings in the world. We are moving the brand beyond curating and selling products to conceptualizing and selling spaces by building an ecosystem of products, places, services and spaces that elevates and establishes the RH brand as a global thought leader, taste and place maker.

At RH we believe deeply that the \"right\" people are our greatest asset. We value people with high energy, who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart, creative and have a point of view. People who see the answer in every problem, versus those who see the problem in every answer. People who are driven, determined and won't take \"no\" for an answer. We value team players, people who are more concerned with what's right, rather than who's right.

Client Services Associates play an integral role in providing luxury service and assessing the needs of our clients. This is the ideal role for an innovator with a sense of personal style, polished appearance, refined taste and a discerning eye for luxury.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Live Our Vision, Values and Beliefs every day
  • Greet and welcome RH Clients and assist with any questions or concerns
  • Assist in connecting clients with the right Associates based on their purchase needs
  • Assist and communicate with clients in the Gallery, over the phone and through email
  • Provide an elevated level of client services support to Gallery Partners to resolve client concerns
  • Become well-versed on RH product and offerings
  • Create a luxury service experience in every interaction
  • Exhibit broad understanding of the organization

OUR REQUIREMENTS
  • Customer service experience within a design firm, high-end furniture showroom, or luxury retail setting preferred
  • Ability to recognize and respond to multiple priorities
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Commitment to quality, detail focused on all levels
  • People and relationship-driven
  • Commitment to quality, detail-focused on all levels
  • Proficiency with Mac Operating System, IOS devices, Microsoft Office and Google Applications

OUR PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
  • Ability to lift and mobilize small to medium items up to 30 lbs. while utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques
  • Ability to maneuver effectively around gallery floor, stock room and office
  • Position entails prolonged standing, twisting, stooping, kneeling, squatting, bending and climbing
ABOUT US
RH is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by federal or state law or local ordinance.

title: Remediation Technician
description:
ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg remediates properties damaged by water, fire, mould, etc. We are looking for experienced Remediation Technicians to join our team. We offer a competitive salary, a company-paid benefits package to qualifying employees, and the opportunity for ongoing professional training.
 
JOB DESCRIPTION
Work as a team member to complete the tasks set out on work orders including but not limited to:
  • Stabilize damaged properties in emergency situations
  • Clean up and demolition of affected building materials
  • Remediation of mould &/or asbestos containing materials
  • Packing out contents as needed
  • Clean residential and commercial properties damaged by water and fire, etc.
  • Participate in on-call rotation
 
REQUIREMENTS
  • Experience in the restoration industry
  • Experience working with mould & asbestos 
  • Construction & demolition knowledge 
  • Capable of carrying at least 50lbs
  • Willing to travel out of town for work when required
  • Criminal record search upon hire 
  • Current valid driver’s license
  • Current IICRC – WRT certificate
  • Ownership of basic hand tools
 
ASSETS
  • Ownership of cordless power tools
  • IICRC certifications such as: WRT, FSRT
  • Experience with contents tracking software such as Encircle or Assured Pack-out
  • Construction experience
  • First Aid Certification
 Pay based on experience.  Please attach resume when responding to ad.




    About ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg:

    As a top Emergency Restoration company in Manitoba, we specialize in the remediation and rebuild of properties damaged by water, fire, title claims, mould, plus much more.

title: Powerline Technician - Storm Restoration (Casual)
description:
Powerline Technician – Storm Restoration

Ontario

Spark Power is actively searching for multiple Powerline Technicians (Journeyperson Certified) to join our growing Storm Restoration team. Spark Power offers some of the most competitive rates in the industry, as well as multiple incentives to the employees of the Storm Restoration team. This role is a casual,on-call, as-needed role that requires travel throughout Ontario.

What you will be doing as a Powerline Technician on our Storm Restoration Team:

As part of the Storm Restoration team, you will perform a variety of tasks associated with installation, operation, repair and troubleshooting of distribution overhead, underground and/or transmission lines in accordance with IHSA standards and rules, across North America.

Spark Power has a fleet of uncommitted bucket trucks and RBDs fully stocked with the best and most advanced tooling available. Our storm restoration division is managed by our own Powerline Technicians, and we believe in outfitting our trucks and equipment with the best tooling available. Our fleet is meticulously maintained, and our trucks go through our internal fabrication shop to insure they are set up correctly, with proper storage for tooling and personal gear.

What we are looking for:

  • Certification as a Powerline Technician Journeyperson, including successful completion of MEARIE or IHSA Powerline Technician Training Program or equivalent
  • Be able to operate bucket trucks, radial boom derricks, hydraulic equipment and all other tools used in line maintenance and construction
  • Be familiar with and carry out live line work practices and techniques on the systems including stick work, and rubber glove techniques
  • Be able to respond to major power outages across Ontario. Ability to travel across Canada and the US is a bonus!

Other requirements:

  • Must have a valid Driver's License (DZ, AZ)
  • Must be able to provide a certificate of Powerline Technician qualification
  • Must have prior training in the following: Working at Heights, Pole Top and Bucket Rescue, Bucket Evacuation


Who is Spark?

  • We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.
  • We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.
  • We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US.

What we offer our employees:

  • Diverse and exciting industrial customer base
  • Continuous training and skills improvement
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Competitive wages plus incentive plan
  • Uniforms and PPE provided
  • Excellent benefit package
  • RRSP match program
  • Employee Share Ownership Program

….and much more

Spark Power Corp. is committed to fair and equitable recruiting practices in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA). Persons with disabilities are encouraged to come forward at any stage of the recruitment process to request accommodations, if needed.

title: Tile/Stone Restoration
description:
We’re growing and hiring a Hard Surfaces, tile, and stone, Technician to drive our COIT vehicle to assigned customer locations and perform scheduled cleaning, maintenance, restoring, etc., for natural stone and tile as required. The Technician is expected to maintain a high standard of customer service, offer additional cleaning services, and complete daily paperwork. 

This position is physically demanding requiring walking, lifting, bending, etc.  The equipment weighs approximately 50 pounds, must be unloaded from the vehicle, and carried to the worksite, including upstairs if required.

Responsibilities include:
  • Learn and keep updated on all company products and services.
  • Performs appropriate restoring applications such as cleaning, polishing, honing, etc. on natural stone and tile.
  • Identify different types of natural stone and tile and cleaning or restore treatments needed to achieve the desired results as per the customer.
  • Use appropriate products, wear safety equipment, and follow all safety procedures.
  • Ask customers for additional business and successfully sell add-on services and products.
  • Follow established policies and resolve customer complaints and challenging situations in a professional manner.
  • Operate and maintain company vehicles with good judgment, obeying all rules of the road. 
  • Maintain an acceptable driving record.
  • Complete route sheet daily and have all supporting documents in order.
  • Wear a clean company uniform and maintain personal grooming and appearance.
  • Perform all other duties as assigned.
 
Skills and Experience:
  • Driving record acceptable to the insurance carrier.
  • Physically able to lift equipment weighing approximately 50 pounds and carry as required.
  • Industry experience helpful, with knowledge of various types of tile, grout and stone preferred.
  • Basic mathematics skills.
  • Must be bondable and pass a background check.
  • Sales or customer service experience helpful.

title: Cleaning Technician
description:
What does a Cleaning Technician with Paul Davis do?

  • Be part of a team of hardworking individuals serving others within your community
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Take pride when your team completes mitigation projects 
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency while communicating through modern technology

Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. title: Property Adjuster
description:
Property Adjuster
Kelowna, BC, Canada Req #512

Monday, March 28, 2022

Westland Insurance Group Ltd has an exciting opportunity for a Property Field Adjuster working remotely and covering claims primarily in Kelowna, Vernon, and surrounding areas. This is a great opportunity and will be a home based position with daily travel required.

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Vehicle Allowance
  • Comprehensive medical and dental benefits
  • Diverse mix of staff and demonstrated work/life balance
  • Career growth opportunities and continuing education programs

The Opportunity:

As a Property Field Adjuster with Westland, you will be contributing to our goal of delivering an exceptional claims experience to our clients by meeting with them and assisting them through the claims process.

In this role you'll:

• Investigate commercial lines and personal lines property insurance claims with insureds, third parties and other related parties in order to obtain facts and information

• Review facts, policy coverages, expert reports and case law to make decisions on coverage, claim value and settlement

• Manage and direct Restoration Contractors to ensure best practices are being followed for property restoration, and that costs are in line with work required

• Responsible for data accuracy, issuance of payments to insureds, vendors and other related parties to a claim

• Manage and direct other claim related experts such as Engineers and Legal Counsel

• Responsible for providing exemplary client service and keeping all related parties informed of the claims process and status

Here's what you bring:

• 5+ years of multi-line adjusting experience, with 2+ years of field work in property claims adjudication

• Insurance Broker Level 2 license and/or CIP designation

• Valid Driver's License

• Community College or University Degree

• Strong background in residential and commercial property insurance

• Ability to work independently with excellent time management and organizational skills

• Effective written and verbal communication abilities

• Good knowledge of building construction and restoration practices

• Computer proficiency with an ability to adapt easily to new computer programs

Westland Insurance Group is one of the largest and fastest-growing independent property and casualty insurance brokers in Canada. With a national network of 195 locations and over 2,100 employees, the company continues to expand coast to coast. Westland's brokers provide expert advice to home, business, farm, life, and auto insurance clients. Since its founding in 1980, Westland has remained a family-owned company that is committed to supporting its local communities.

Westland Insurance Ltd. is an inclusive organization that values diversity in its workforce. We listen, champion equality and diversity, and create safe welcoming spaces where everyone has a voice and is free to be themselves. Westland Insurance Ltd. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@westlandinsurance.ca

Apply Now

title: Maintenance / General Handyman (PT)
description:
RETIRED TOO SOON? LIKE HANDMAN WORK? THIS COULD BE JUST THE P/T JOB FOR YOU! 

COIT Services is the industry leader in specialty in-home cleaning services. We have been in business for over 71 years, and are centrally located in North Burnaby, BC.

Job Details:
  • We are currently seeking a part-time maintenance person to do:
  • General handyman work, some assistance to the full-time mechanic in the maintenance of trucks and cleaning equipment.
  • Groundskeeping duties, some maintenance of the building, etc. on a part-time basis.
  • Ideally, we are looking for someone to work 24 hours weekly. 
  • A schedule of three 8 hour days a week, including Saturdays (no Sundays).
This is a great position for a semi-retired individual who wants to keep "a little busy", and work for a long-standing, reliable company with good ethics & integrity. 

Position reports to the Assistant General Manager.

title: Drywaller- Restoration Work
description:
Mostly insurance restoration repairs.

Skills Required:
  • Read blueprints and designs
  • Use a lift to place ceiling panels
  • Prepare panels by sawing, drilling, or cutting holes in panels for electrical outlets, air-conditioning units, and plumbing
  • Measure, cut, fit, and fasten panels.  Fasten drywall to walls or ceilings, fasten drywall panels to the inside framework of a building
  • Use trowels to spread compound, apply paper tape, smoothing away excess material
  • Cover nail and screw depressions with compound, apply second and third coats of compound, sand areas after each coat
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs
  • Must keep work area clean
  • Follow instructions
  • Work well within a team
  • Have a current BC driver's license, clean driver abstract

title: Contact Centre Agent
description:
Coit Services, the industry leader in Specialty Cleaning Services has been in business for over 71 years. Part of the reason for our success is the relationship we work hard to build with our valued customers. At COIT we guarantee our work, 100% to our customer satisfaction.

This pride in our workmanship and level of satisfied customers is important as it helps to build a happy and healthy client roster.

This is important for our Appointment Setters (Telemarketers) to know, because we do not cold call. We only call our current customer base to let them know about our current promotions, and to check in on their service schedules, to see if they need any work done.

No high pressure sales tactics, Just a warm call to say hello and offer a special deal.

We are offering 15-25 hours weekly per agent (evening shifts only - finishing by 830pm) and Saturdays between 10-4.

Preference will be given to the individuals who have call centre experience.

If this job sounds like a fit for you, apply now!

Job Type: Part-time, Permanent

title: Carpet Cleaner
description:
We’re growing and hiring a Carpet Cleaner to drive our COIT vehicle to assigned customer locations and perform carpet-cleaning services as required. The Technician is expected to maintain a high standard of customer service, offer additional cleaning services, and complete daily paperwork. 

This position is physically demanding requiring walking, lifting, bending, and repetitive pushing and pulling of the carpet-cleaning equipment.  The equipment weighs approximately 50 pounds, must be unloaded from the vehicle, and carried to the worksite, including upstairs if required.

Responsibilities include:
  • Learn and keep updated on all company products and services.
  • Use appropriate cleaning products, wear safety equipment, and follow all safety procedures.
  • Ask customers for additional business and successfully sell add-on services and products (upholstery cleaning; succession sales; wood floor services, etc.)
  • Follow established policies and resolve customer complaints and challenging situations in a professional manner.
  • Operate and maintain company vehicles with good judgment, obeying all rules of the road. 
  • Maintain an acceptable driving record.
  • Complete route sheet daily and have all supporting documents in order.
  • Wear a clean company uniform and maintain personal grooming and appearance.
  • Perform all other duties as assigned.
 
Skills and Experience:
  • Driving record acceptable to insurance carrier.
  • Physically able to lift equipment weighing approximately 50 pounds and carry as required.
  • Industry experience helpful, with knowledge of various types of carpet and upholstery, preferred.
  • Basic mathematics skills.
  • Must be bondable and pass a background check.
  • Sales or customer service experience helpful.

title: Water Resources Engineer/River Engineer
description:
At Matrix Solutions we collaborate across services, disciplines, and geographies to deliver responsive, locally connected, and scalable solutions customized to our clients’ projects and environmental challenges. Our integrated approach is supported by talented professionals and a project management model that encourages synergies, promotes service excellence, and provides cost and time savings.


WHO WE ARE

A Canadian‑owned environmental and engineering consulting company, with employees strategically located across the country from British Columbia to Ontario.


OUR MISSION

Our people fuel a solutions powerhouse, tailoring our work for clients and projects where environmental stewardship matters and where we can make a difference.


OUR VISION

To be a company where our people and clients can’t imagine working with anyone else.


OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION

Our team is made up of diverse people working collaboratively towards common goals. We value the contributions and perspectives of all employees and are committed to equity and diversity initiatives to create a feeling of belonging for all of our people. When we are inclusive and diverse in a way that reflects the broader world we serve, we are able to draw from a wider community of excellence within the regions we operate.


WHAT WE DO

We partner with clients and communities to solve challenges. It’s our job to power progress and shape a better future where our clients, people, communities, and environment thrive.


Are you looking to…

  • Make a real impact by helping build more resilient communities while protecting and restoring our natural environment.
  • See progression in your career by working on a broad range of complex multidisciplinary projects.
  • Be supported by community of experienced technical experts from other Matrix regions.
  • Partner with extensive, long-standing clients such as municipal governments, conservation authorities, academia, and private industry.
  • Join a well-respected environmental consulting company where the majority of employees are also shareholders.


As a Water Resources Engineer/River Engineer, you will join our Calgary, Alberta office as part of our Calgary Surface Water Engineering team. The successful applicant will be involved in a broad range of water resources projects with responsibilities as follows:

  • Provide technical input into stream restoration/stabilization projects based on channel processes and risk to critical infrastructure
  • Manage a variety of projects for a diverse group of clients, including: budget/cost control; schedule tracking; and client management
  • Provide project management and engineering support for surface water projects and designs, for both private and public clients. Projects may include hydraulic structures (e.g. outfalls, stormwater management facilities, weirs), bank protection, master drainage plans, flood assessment and mitigation.
  • Create conceptual, preliminary, and detailed design of surface water projects; this could include river engineering, stream restoration, eco-hydraulics, bioengineering, small hydraulic structures, bank protection, road crossings, pipeline crossings and mine-water management
  • Review and authorize design drawings associated with stream restoration/stabilization projects, including Issued For Tender/Construction drawing sets
  • Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team on river process-related projects including subwatershed studies and environmental assessments
  • Direct and support field data collection exercises as well as data synthesis/analysis; including site reconnaissance, surveying (e.g.: RTK, UAV) fluvial geomorphology assessments, construction supervision and field engineering
  • Provide technical support and mentoring to junior team members
  • Work with regulatory agencies and clients to address project-specific challenges
  • Obtain relevant provincial and federal regulatory approvals for construction projects
  • Prepare technical reports, specifications, and work plans
  • Support business development initiatives including drafting proposals
  • Build strong client relationships and liaise with stakeholders
  • Occasional travel within Alberta and BC to support projects or business development initiatives
  • Actively participate in Matrix strong Health and Safety culture


What We Are Looking For

  • 5 or more years of experience in water resources engineering or fluvial geomorphology specifically related to the design, construction, and project management of water resources projects, with a particular focus on projects related to river engineering.
  • Professional Engineer designation (or candidacy) is required
  • Bachelor’s degree in Water Resources/Environmental/Civil Engineering, or related field. A graduate degree would be considered an asset.
  • Experience with natural channel design, fish habitat restoration, surface water management, hydraulic/hydrologic and sediment transport models, bridges
  • Knowledge of current regulations and legislation
  • Ability to effectively manage projects of various sizes and complexity simultaneously
  • Experience in writing technical reports and proposals, and giving presentations to multi-stakeholder groups
  • Strong ability to convey complex concepts in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and written
  • Self-motivated individual, possessing strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Knowledge of hydrology, aquatic biology and engineering models (e.g. HEC-RAS) would be an asset
  • Experience with design and drafting software such as ArcGIS and AutoCAD would be an asset
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license with no restrictions and a clean driving record.


Why Choose Matrix


At Matrix you will be part of an amazing community of collaborative people who live our values and bring industry-leading technical expertise to their work every day. We offer a comprehensive compensation package, which includes RRSP matching, vacation + flex time, profit sharing, and opportunities to become a shareholder. We are also committed to flexible work hours and schedules, team-based work, and cross-training opportunities.


Click the Apply button.


Are you the one we're looking for? Please apply to us directly by May 31, 2022. As a note, we are not accepting third party agency applicants at this time.


Matrix is committed to providing a safe and productive work environment and to promoting the health, safety and well-being of our employees. In keeping with our Health & Safety Policy, individuals in safety sensitive positions are subject to pre-employment, pre-access (and in some client cases, random) alcohol & drug testing as well as drivers abstract reviews.


Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada with no restrictions.


We welcome and promote diversity and inclusion in our workplace and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Matrix provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities; including accommodation that takes into account an applicant’s accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources directly.


Please follow us on LinkedIn (Matrix Solutions Inc) for ongoing updates about our people and business.

For more information about Matrix Solutions, please visit our website at www.matrix-solutions.com and don’t forget to our bookmark our careers page.


While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: Mitigation Technician
company: Paul Davis of Thunder Bay, ON
description:
Reports To: Mitigation Manager

What does a Mitigation Technician with Paul Davis do?

  • Serve others within your community in their time of need
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Work hard and take pride in completing projects (i.e. mitigating flood and fire damage)
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency while communicating through modern technology
Why Join The Team? Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, providing industry training and giving technicians the opportunity to become experts in the field through certifications and Paul Davis University.

Built upon principles of customer service, dynamic decision-making and leadership, we have the tools to continue our rapid growth. Our team puts emphasis into living our Vision, Mission and Values to be more than just a service provider – our Mitigation Technicians are on the front lines of restoring their communities by being first on site after disasters strike (i.e. floods, fires) and will be leading the mitigation effort to restore the property.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.

Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.

Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.

Why The Team Needs You? Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. It is challenging to make customers happy when faced with a traumatic event but you will love being a technician if you take pride in your work and have fun while working with others.

 

Team Compensation and Benefits:

  • Leadership Development - our company grows from the inside. If you are determined and motivated enough, ask about participation in our leadership development initiative to grow your career and explore new opportunities
  • Monthly cross-training opportunities to advance your career
  • Paid training
  • Health insurance
  • Bonus program for performance
  • Referral program
  • Great culture and team dynamic
  • Hourly pay: $16.05 to $19.00/hour based on experience and certifications
 

Team Qualifications (Requirements):

  • Desire to join a world-class team and contribute a positive attitude
  • Dedication to customer service
  • Fluent in English
  • Clean criminal background check
  • Ability to pass a drug test
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record
  • Have the ability to work nights/weekends and overtime, if needed
  • Ability to lift 75 LBS frequently
  • Desire to continually learn new things
 

Role on the Team (Job Responsibilities):

  • High level performance of water mitigation, tarping, board up, mold remediation, asbestos/lead abatement and carpet cleaning/reinstallation services according to Paul Davis and industry specifications under the supervision of the Mitigation Manager.
  • Focus and dedication to providing excellent customer service.
  • Maintain a clean, properly stocked and organized truck and maintain all company equipment.
  • Be accessible by phone and participate, as necessary, in the on-call schedule.
  • Assist in warehousing and facility related tasks when necessary.
  • You will assist other team members as you see opportunities arise and be a leader for the team when needed.
 

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.

We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Lawn Maintenance Labourer
description:
About the Job

Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for a Lawn Maintenance Labourer (Full-time) to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Overview:
  • With over 30 years of award-winning experience in landscape and landscape construction, we stand firmly behind our work and our employees.
  • Join a team that helps our clients realize their dreams.

Job Details:
  • Position: Lawn Maintenance Labourer
  • Location: Brantford, Ontario
  • Pay: $18 to $20/hr. depending on experience.
  • Benefits: after 3 months
  • Company events

Job Duties: 
The key job duties for this lawn maintenance position are:
  • Mow grass.
  • Weeding.
  • Flower bed maintenance.
  • Trimming.
  • Raking.

Job Requirements:
  • Have reliable transportation to and from the main yard.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work long hours.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to think as a team player.
  • Ability to do physical work.
  • Respect for on-site safety.
  • Ability to work Saturdays as required.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Application Details:
Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties.

If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application process, please contact me via email at  jobs@oakridgelandscape.com
About Oakridge Landscape Contractors

Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.

Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: Lawn Tractor/Ventrac Mower Operator (FT)
description:
About the Job

Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for a Lawn Tractor/Ventrac Operator to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

With over 30 years of award-winning experience in landscape and landscape construction, we stand firmly behind our work and our employees. Join a team that helps our clients realize their dreams.

Position: Lawn Tractor/Ventrac Operator
Pay: $26-30 per hour (Depending on experience).
Benefits: after 3 months.
Year round work is available.

Job Duties:
  • Lawn maintenance related to the landscape gardening industry. 
  • The position of lawn tractor/ventrac operator will involve assisting in the daily performance of maintenance projects for Oakridge Landscape Contractors.
  • Perform pre-operational checks including checking oil and fuel.
  • This position also includes the use of numerous types of related equipment.

Key Duties include:
  • Mowing grass
  • Trimming
  • Drive company truck and trailer.

Job Requirements:

  • Clean Driver’s Abstract.
  • Minimum of 2 years field experience
  • Strong knowledge of job safety and safe work habits.
  • Ability to operate lawn tractor/ventrac in a safe manner
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work long hours and the occasional Saturday.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application process, please contact me via email.

title: Shop Administrative Assistant (FT)
description:
About the Job

Oakridge Landscape Contractors has an immediate need for a Shop Admin Assistant (Full-time) in Hamilton to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With 30 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects. We have won 9 Landscape Ontario awards in 2021 for our residential and commercial projects.

Shop Admin Assistant
 
We have an exciting and multi-faceted job opportunity for a candidate with solid organizational and sound computer skills. This role is ideal for a mechanically minded individual, or someone able to learn, and who enjoys interacting with team members throughout our organization.

Compensation Package:
  • Salary $18 - $20/hour.
  • Company-paid benefits after 3 months
  • Company RRSP system.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Proactively coordinate and schedule service requirements for vehicles and equipment, including preventive maintenance, safeties, oil changes, repairs, and tire retorques
  • Maintain service records/maintenance files in compliance with MTO standards
  • Develop and maintain a database identifying when services are due
  • Administer GPS system for vehicles and equipment
  • Administer driver’s electronic logs and inspections
  • Transport G class trucks to/from outside service facilities
  • Order and pick up parts as required
  • Issue purchase orders for parts/outside services and match P.O. to invoice/work order.
  • Track parts and materials inventory
  • Maintain physical filing and e-filing systems
  • Track hours for equipment services
  • Provide safety training to maintenance staff as issued by Human Resources.

Skills:
  • Flexible, resourceful, and possesses a positive attitude
  • Solid organizational skills
  • High attention to detail
  • Sound knowledge of MSOffice
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Clean driver’s abstract
  • Comfort working in a shop office environment
  • Familiarity with maintenance shop protocols, trucks or heavy equipment would be an asset.

About Oakridge Landscape Contractors

Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.

Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: Jr. Landscape Construction Superintendent (FT)
description:
About the Job

OAKRIDGE LANDSCAPE CONTRACTORS has an immediate need for a Junior Landscape Construction Superintendent in Hamilton to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!
 
About:
Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With over 25 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects.

Job Title: Junior Landscape Construction Superintendent.
Location: Hamilton, Ontario.
Pay: $40,000 - 45,000 per year.
  • Benefits after 3 months.
  • Company Vehicle.
  • iPhone.
  • RRSP.
  • Company Events.

Responsibilities:
The Junior Construction Superintendent aids in coordinating and supervising all construction activities. He/she will direct all field personnel to achieve completion of the project on schedule, within budget, and with quality workmanship that conforms to original plans and specifications.
  • Assist with the scheduling and utilizing both labour crews and equipment efficiently.
  • Assist in overseeing sub-contractors and Oakridge employees at job sites assigned to ensure work is completed correctly within budget.
  • Assist with and monitor the delivery of all materials relating to the job being managed. 
  • Meet with clients as required. This included onsite as well as off-site meetings.
  • Maintain strong communication with forepersons and assist in resolving site problems and issues.

Skill Requirements:
  • Knowledge of landscaping and construction.
  • Ability to read blueprints and understand specifications.
  • Knowledge of the use of various tools, small and heavy equipment.
  • Knowledge and recognition of various materials used in the industry (paving stone, precast wall, concrete, armor stone, etc.)
  • Knowledge and recognition of plant material, identification, and proper planting techniques are considered an asset.

Qualifications:
  • Experience in scheduling, ordering, field supervision, quality control, and job safety work habits.
  • Experience in managing multiple projects and construction workers.
  • Valid G-Class Driver’s License with clean Driver’s Abstract.
  • College Diploma or Degree is an asset with a concentration in Construction Management.

Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties.  If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application process, please contact us.

title: Garden Centre Skid Steer Loader (PT/FT)
description:
About the Job

Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for a Landscape Supply- Skid Steer Operator to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Overview:
  • With over 30 years of award-winning experience in landscape and landscape construction, we stand firmly behind our work and our employees.
  • Join a team that helps our clients realize their dreams. Oakridge provides a wide variety of landscape supplies for both residential and commercial projects.
  • We take pride in our ability to create and specialize in a number of different screened topsoil blends.
  • Our products include also include mulch, compost, river rock, brick sand, and other landscape materials.

Job Details:
  • This is a seasonal position that operates during the spring/summer/fall seasons; however, winter work is available if desired.
  • We have full-time and part-time positions available.
  • Position: Landscape Supply- Skid Steer Operator (Seasonal- winter work available).
  • Location: Hamilton, Ontario.
  • Pay: $18.50 - 20.00  per hour.
  • Benefits after 3 months.
  • RRSP program.
  • Company events.

Job Duties:
  • This skid steer operator will assist in the dour' bulk retail department customers with landscape materials purchases.
  • This position also includes the use of numerous types of related equipment.

Key Duties & Responsibilities include:
  • Operate skid steer.
  • Assist with loading landscape supply materials into trucks.
  • Ensure all essential product is stocked.
  • Assist customers with the loading of materials.
  • Operate cash register and credit/debit machine.
  • Assist with the deliveries of bulk materials in a G Class mini dump truck.

Requirements:
  • G Driver's license.
  • Clean Driver’s Abstract.
  • Reliable transportation.
  • Basic understanding of construction and landscaping.
  • Available to work weekends.
  • Experience operating a skid steer.

title: HR Generalist
description:
About the Job

OAKRIDGE GROUP INC. has an immediate need for an HR Generalist to join our dynamic team of talented individuals! This position offers an exciting blend of full-cycle recruitment, policy development, coaching, training, and occupational health and safety support.

Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With 30 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects. We have won 9 Landscape Ontario awards in 2021 for our residential and commercial projects.

  • Pay: $40,000 - $50,000(depending on experience)
  • Benefits: after 3 months
  • RRSP: company contribution match
  • Company events.

Reporting to the HR and Safety Manager, you are an HR professional who prides him/herself on the ability to juggle a multitude of projects and create positive employee experiences. You will provide counsel, coaching, and support on HR programs, employee relations and respond to employee/manager questions. This role is critical in executing key HR initiatives, providing available and responsive internal employee support, and driving HR functional excellence within our organization.

The ideal candidate is someone who can think outside the box with respect to recruiting and finding new talent.

QUALIFICATIONS AND OR EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • Formal Human Resources education at the post-secondary level is required
  • HR experience is considered an asset
  • CHRP designation is considered an asset
  • Strong experience working with MS Office.

ADDITIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED:
  • High attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Professional demeanor
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Effective communication skills. (both verbal and written)
  • Efficient time management skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills. 

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
HUMAN RESOURCES:
  • Assist in full-cycle recruitment (on-boarding and off-boarding), including creating, posting, and managing job advertisements, screening and arranging interviews with candidates, and preparation of letters of offer.
  • Coordinate Oakridge's recruiting efforts and look for new methods to attract candidates.
  • Assist in the provision of coaching, guidance, and administration support to managers and employees related to HR programs and processes, training, employee relations management, absence/disability management, benefits, and performance management.
  • Development and maintenance of corporate policies.
  • Ensuring the issuance of the employee handbook and applicable policies, maintaining up-to-date employee profiles (including training/ disciplinary records).
  • Experience in HR program delivery and facilitation of HR programs.
  • Creation and presentation of training programs.
  • Assist in updating and completing job descriptions.
  • Management of employee attendance and vacation.
  • Sound knowledge of the Employment Standards Act and other government requirements to support compliant employee relations.

HEALTH AND SAFETY:
  • Assist HRSM in coordinating and initiating the safety orientation for all new employees.
  • Assist HRSM in issuing weekly Tailgate Safety topics to the field crews that will be conducted and returned.
  • Assist in developing and implementing safety procedures for all staff and divisions.
  • Keep all safety boards updated regularly.
  • Ensure that the orientation training for all drivers, operators, and lawn maintenance staff has been undertaken.
  • Management of training recall database.
  • Assist in the implementation of our COVID-19 safety protocols.

WSIB:
  • Assist with filing and managing of WSIB claims and return-to-work.

Insurance Claims:
  • Assist HR and Safety Manager in the information gathering for insurance claims.

About Oakridge Landscape Contractors
Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.

Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.




    About Oakridge Landscape Contractors:

    Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.
