title: CA - Bilingual Contractor Performance Manager (remote in ON)
description:
Why Crawford?:

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect  our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are  Empowered  to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote  Sustainability  through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize  Training  and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are  One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give  Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an  Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at  www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently seeking a Bilingual Contractor Performance Manager to join remotely our team in Ontario.

 

Job Description:

 

The successful candidate will provides real time coaching on ways to overcome identified performance trends, teach contractors how to effectively utilize business tools to become more efficient, and make recommendations on ways current processes may be improved to gain efficiencies. Will be responsible for interacting with contractors, district managers, as well as adjusters.  

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Organize, plan, and prepare for Quality Review Meetings with induvial contractor locations
  • Assist in creation of training material
  • Coach contractors and conduct educational trainings
  • Provide data review, analysis, and monthly reporting
Requirements:
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in business administration, management, construction or a related discipline; or an equivalent combination of education

  • Minimum 2 year training, coaching and/or leadership experience

  • Minimum 2 year Project Management experience preferred

  • Residential Property Insurance training experience preferred

  • Excellent written, verbal and oral communication skills
  • Excellent attention to detail; organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects or contractors concurrently under minimal supervision
  • Strong relationship/team building skills
  • Strong time management abilities
  • Excellent knowledge of computer programs such as Office 365
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

In accordance with the Human Rights Code, Accessibility with Disabilities Act and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Join SADA as a Sr. Data Engineer!
 
Your Mission 
 
As a Sr. Data Engineer at SADA, you will work collaboratively with architects and other engineers to recommend, prototype, build and debug data infrastructures on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You will have an opportunity to work on real-world data problems facing our customers today. Engagements vary from being purely consultative to requiring heavy hands-on work and cover a diverse array of domain areas, such as data migrations, data archival and disaster recovery, and big data analytics solutions requiring batch or streaming data pipelines, data lakes and data warehouses. 
 
You will be expected to run point on whole projects, end-to-end, and to mentor less experienced Data Engineers. You will be recognized as an expert within the team and will build a reputation with Google and our customers. You will demonstrate repeated delivery of project architectures and critical components that other engineers demur to you for lack of expertise. You will also participate in early-stage opportunity qualification calls, as well as lead client-facing technical discussions for established projects. 
 
Pathway to Success 
 
#BeOneStepAhead: At SADA we are in the business of change. We are focused on leading-edge technology that is ever-evolving. We embrace change enthusiastically and encourage agility. This means that not only do our engineers know that change is inevitable, but they embrace this change to continuously expand their skills, preparing for future customer needs. 
 
Your success starts by positively impacting the direction of a fast-growing practice with vision and passion. You will be measured quarterly by the breadth, magnitude, and quality of your contributions, your ability to estimate accurately, customer feedback at the close of projects, how well you collaborate with your peers, and the consultative polish you bring to customer interactions.  
 
As you continue to execute successfully, we will build a customized development plan together that leads you through the engineering or management growth tracks. 
 
Expectations
 
Required Travel - 10% travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, travel has been temporarily restricted.
Customer Facing - You will interact with customers on a regular basis, sometimes daily, other times weekly/bi-weekly. Common touchpoints occur when qualifying potential opportunities, at project kickoff, throughout the engagement as progress is communicated, and at project close. You can expect to interact with a range of customer stakeholders, including engineers, technical project managers, and executives.
Training - Ongoing with first-week orientation at HQ followed by a 90-day onboarding schedule. Details of the timeline can be shared.
 
Job Requirements
 
Required Credentials:
  • Google Professional Data Engineer Certified or able to complete within the first 45 days of employment 
 
Required Qualifications: 
  • Mastery in at least one of the following domain areas:
    • Data warehouse modernization: building complete data warehouse solutions, including technical architectures, star/snowflake schema designs, infrastructure components, ETL/ELT pipelines, and reporting/analytic tools. Must have hands-on experience working with batch or streaming data processing software (such as Beam, Airflow, Hadoop, Spark, Hive).
    • Data migration: migrating data stores to reliable and scalable cloud-based stores, including strategies for near zero-downtime. 
    • Backup, restore & disaster recovery: building production-grade data backup and restore, and disaster recovery solutions. Up to petabytes in scale. 
  • Experience writing software in one or more languages such as Python, Java, Scala, or Go
  • Experience building production-grade data solutions (relational and NoSQL)
  • Experience with systems monitoring/alerting, capacity planning and performance tuning
  • Experience in technical consulting or customer-facing role
 
Useful Qualifications:
  • Experience working with Google Cloud data products (CloudSQL, Spanner, Cloud Storage, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Dataproc, Bigtable, BigQuery, Dataprep, Composer, etc)
  • Experience with IoT architectures and building real-time data streaming pipelines
  • Experience operationalizing machine learning models on large datasets
  • Demonstrated leadership and self-direction -- a willingness to teach others and learn new techniques
  • Demonstrated skills in selecting the right statistical tools given a data analysis problem
 
About SADA
 
Values:  We built our core values on themes that internally compel us to deliver our best to our partners, our customers and to each other. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to SADA's values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer.
 
  1. Make them rave
  2. Be data driven
  3. Be one step ahead
  4. Be a change agent 
  5. Do the right thing
 
Work with the best: SADA has been the largest partner in North America for GCP since 2016 and has been named the 2019 and 2018 Google Cloud Global Partner of the Year.  SADA has also been awarded Best Place to Work by Inc. as well as LA Business Journal!

Business Performance: SADA has been named to the INC 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies list for 12 years in a row garnering Honoree status. CRN has also named SADA on the Top 500 Global Solutions Providers for the past 5 years. The overall culture continues to evolve with engineering at its core: 3200+ projects completed, 3000+ customers served, 10K+ workloads and 25M+ users migrated to the cloud. 
 

About SADA

Values:  We built our core values on themes that internally compel us to deliver our best to our partners, our customers and to each other. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to SADA's values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer.

  1. Make them rave
  2. Be data-driven
  3. Think one step ahead
  4. Drive purposeful impact
  5. Do the right thing

SADA has also been awarded Best Place to Work year after year by the Business Intelligence Group, Inc. Magazine, as well as LA Business Journal!

Business Performance: SADA has been named to the INC 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies list for 15 years in a row garnering Honoree status. title: Carpenter / Drywaller / Painter
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a Full-time Carpenter/Drywall/Painter to help rebuild homes and businesses for our residential and commercial customers after fire or flood emergencies.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CARPENTER/DRYWALL/PAINTER

You are focused on bringing back homes and businesses to their former beauty. Your attention to detail and passion for construction assists you in delivering superior quality work to our customers. Whether repairing a roof, painting a kitchen cabinet, or installing drywall, you consistently demonstrate skill in the safe operation of tools.

You have excellent communication skills that assist daily as you work collaboratively with construction crews. Health and safety are important to you, which is why you respect all the policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by other employees and subcontractors.

You are a get-it-done person who likes to be active and isn't afraid to jump right in and make things happen. You take pride in your work and feel good about being able to restore order for people in our community while helping us build a loyal customer base!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • At least 3 years of experience in the carpentry, construction or restoration industry
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Valid drivers' license
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR AMAZING TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, First Onsite Restoration will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources or the Hiring Manager of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Gérant de projet
description:
Paul Davis Sud Ouest est une entreprise de restoration apres sinistre à service complet qui recherche des personnes ambitieuses et énergiques pour se joindre à notre équipe. Une expérience dans l'industrie est un atout mais n'est pas requise.

Paul Davis Sud Ouest est basé à Châteauguay, au Québec. Nous offrons une formation en cours d'emploi, des salaires compétitifs, des avantages médicaux et dentaires et un environnement d'équipe favorable.

Le gérant(e) de projet sera responsable pour :
  • organiser et gérer tous les détails de ses projets d’urgence et reconstruction après sinistre, (gérer plusieurs projets en même temps)
  • rencontrer les propriétaires et experts en sinistres (et autre professionnels du domaine)
  • préparer toute documentation nécessaire pour réaliser le projet en utilisant le logiciel Xactimate (devis, sketchs, bon de travail etc.)gérer les équipes de sous traitants (au besoin)
  • régler les plaintes en temps de manière efficace
  • développer et entretenir des bonnes relations et d'agir en tant que premier agent de liaison avec l'assuré et experts en sinistres
  • prendre les appels d’urgence (Sur appel en rotation)
Vous devez :
  • posséder de l`expérience dans le restoration après sinistre
  • avoir une bonne connaissance des procédures de réclamations d’assurance
  • avoir la facilité avec les ordinateurs Office, Xactimate (min 3 ans d`expérience avec Xactimate) , Xactanalysis
  • avoir la capacité de travailler sous pression et rencontrer les échéanciers
  • avoir des excellentes aptitudes de communication verbale et écrite
  • avoir des fortes compétences du service à la clientèle
  • être consciencieux et responsable
  • être débrouillard
  • avoir un permis de conduire valide (Québec)
  • être bilingue français / anglais
  • Cours IICRC seront un atout
 Salaire de base selon expérience plus commission

title: 2848 IT MS Exchange Business Email Specialist
description:
One of Canada's leading, client-centric, innovative service firms, requires an IT Computer Operations (MS Exchange) eMail Specialist,
ideally located in Toronto, Ottawa or Montreal. Highly specialized in email. About 2500 users. On site 65 - 70% of time / flexible, reporting to the company Director IT Operations.
OVERVIEW:
  • Maintaining and supporting MS Exchange Messaging System, Office 365, AD, and InTune, Powershell.
  • Work in tandem with the IT Technical Support team, Cyber Security group and the Infrastructure group.
  • Provide support to enable the performance to meet or exceed service level expectations
RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Provide support regarding backup restore, troubleshooting and optimizing email systems.
- Ensure the email security gateway, maintain encryption certificates, and security policies.
- Support, Maintain, and Monitor the Exchange Online and Office 365 system and troubleshoot
hardware, software, and network issues.
- Install and configure messaging software to allow projects and other initiatives to be met.
- Provide 2nd level support to Help Desk as required.
- Involved in 24x7 on-call rotation on an as required situation.
- Install patches and software updates as needed.
- Manage cloud and on site backups.
QUALIFICATIONS:
- Degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent experience.
- 5 years of similar work experience.
- Highly specialized in business-class email and calendaring (MS Exchange) essential.
- Work experience in a mixed MS Office/365, MS Exchange on site, Exchange Online site, Teams.
- Some experience with Sharepoint, Azure, Active Directory, backup and restore tools.
- Migration experience moving to different operating systems.
- Able to build and maintain high availability solutions.
- In depth understanding of email, messaging, data loss prevention.
- Some PowerShell and scripting abilities.
skills: ['Provide support to enable the performance to meet or exceed service level expectations', 'Work in tandem with the IT Technical Support team, Cyber Security group and the Infrastructure group.', 'Maintaining and supporting MS Exchange Messaging System, Office 365, AD, and InTune, Powershell.']

title: Rebar Worker Installer (FT)
description:
We are looking for Rebar Workers or Installers to join our team!  With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!

Position: Rebar Worker Installer in Whistler, British Columbia (Full Time Position)

Responsibilities:
  • Reading blueprints or looking at sketches to determine how to install rebar
  • Figuring out the quantity, size, and shapes of reinforcing rods and determining where to place them
  • Preparing rebar and mesh for installation using metal shears, hacksaws, and torches
  • Bending or welding rebar together
  • Installing cables
  • Using pliers to tie wire around rods to fasten them together
  • Positioning and securing rods, cables, mesh, or rebar in concrete forms
Requirements:
  • High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent experience preferred
  • Rebar, concrete, and general contracting experience, highly preferred
  • Minimum 2 years experience in doing rebars
  • Technical and detail-oriented
  • Good communication skills
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work-life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!

New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.


About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Skilled Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Skilled Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible. 
 
With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team! 
 
Location: 844 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 3M5  
 
Responsibilities:
  • Clean interior suites and possible areas around so the site.
  • Installing exterior air barrier and assisting Superintendents do daily tasks.
  • Interior suites wood working on windows frames and trims.
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts if necessary.
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.
  • Other duties that may be assigned.
 
Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • Driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills
 
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. title: CA- Client Service Supervisor ( Remote in BC)
description:
Why Crawford?:

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are Empowered to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote Sustainability through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize Training and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently recruiting for a Client Service Supervisor to join remotely our Contract Connection team.

 

Train, coach, guide, support, and mentor our Team Leaders with daily operational tasks including service level adherence, staff performance, and administrative tasks. The successful candidate will be responsible to monitor quality, conduct audits and be familiar with specific client protocols; provide written and verbal feedback in a timely manner and to drive performance management. In addition, the Supervisor will be responsible for assisting the manager with administrative tasks, new program implementation and other general administrative duties in collaboration with the management team.

Requirements:

Demonstrate leadership with capability to motivate and inspire

Outstanding interpersonal skills, coupled with the ability to communicate effectively

Effective conflict resolution skills

Superior organization and time management skills; coupled with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks

Demonstrates initiative and follow through

Proven ability to work independently and consult outside sources when required

Excellent ability to problem solve

Must be a team player

Advanced computer skills

Property/Casualty Insurance experience would be considered an asset

French/English bilingualism will be considered an asset

Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

In accordance with the Human Rights Code, Accessibility with Disabilities Act and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

title: Information Technology Administrator
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Information Technology Administratorâ€™s role is to ensure proper computer operations so that end users can accomplish organizational tasks. This includes receiving, prioritising, documenting and actively resolving end user help requests. Problem resolution may involve the use of approved diagnostics and help tools, as well as require that the individual give hands-on help at the desktop level. Regular duties involves support for JIT (Just in Time) automotive sequencing operation. This includes setup and monitoring of relevant components like servers, workstations and network equipment, and the appropriate maintenance thereof.

Responsibilities:
  • Administer a small, uniform site alone or assists in the administration of a larger system.
  • Monitor IT Help Desk support tickets and resolve them on timely manner. Record, track and document â€“ help desk requests, problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and brief IT members on the resolution.
  • Supporting day to day IT activities including our core business operation which is sequencing of automotive parts to our customer in fast pace environment.
  • Design, deploy, maintain servers, virtualization environment, related operating systems software and hardware, Switches, and maintains shop floor computers systems
  • Ensure scheduled backup of all Physical and Virtual servers using Veeam backup and recovery application. Test and restore backups as required.
  • Perform Microsoft Active Directory related services like, create OUs/Security groups/Distribution groups, add/remove users and respective security groups, add/remove GPO to respective OU etc.
  • Perform first level problem determination and resolution on all problems.
  • Escalate unresolved issues to the appropriate support team.
  • Software support focus within the network activity, primarily within a Microsoft Windows environment.
  • Administrates local network in accordance with wider company procedures and practices to ensure proper integration, works on switching and external connectivity mediums to maintain network integrity, operates using best security practices for local network planning and implementation.
  • Maintains telecommunications equipment and systems including new extension provisioning, removal, call handling manipulation and troubleshooting.
  • Coordinates and consults with shop floor software programmer(s) and assists in the introduction of new systems or alterations.
  • Provides in-house expertise and technical support to end-users on database and software-related issue on Broadcast system.
  • Develops and produces accurate and timely routine and special reports (using SQL Queries), and data retrievals for staff as needed, and is the point person for managing custom reporting requests
  • Backup and Restore SQL Server database as needed.
  • Monitor and follow-up on all outstanding issues to ensure proper and efficient resolution or to update the client as to the current status.
  • Notify appropriate management of priority problems and subsequent resolution.
  • Utilize all tools necessary to monitor servers and perform other daily duties.
  • Communicate with co-workers, management, clients and others in a courteous and professional manner.
  • Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures and instructions.
  • Develop help sheets and knowledge base for future reference and end users.
  • Perform related duties consistent with the scope and intent of the position.
  • Available for support calls 24/7.
Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • 2-4 yearsâ€™ work experience in related field
  • Certifications from accredited schools in computer systems and computer networking
  • Knowledge of basic computer hardware and applications software
  • Solid understanding of LANâ€™S, WANâ€™s, TCPIP and VPNâ€™s. Working knowledge of Cisco switches
  • Experience with Windows Servers(Server 2016 and above), Hyper-V virtualization
  • Practical experience on Microsoft SQL database will be an asset
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adaptable to new and changing technology and capable of training users
  • Strong communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Strong analytical ability
  • Proficiency with database applications and administration systems, specifically Microsoft Office
  • Ability to work effectively alone and prioritize
  • Must be a highly motivated, service and team-oriented individual with an attention to detail
  • Enthusiasm for challenge and new initiatives are prerequisites
  • Troubleshooting ability is required
  • Strong decision making and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated good internal customer service skills
  • Proven good presentation skills.
  • Good presentation skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects.
  • Detail oriented
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Senior Azure Support Engineer/Administrator
description:
Overview:

Adastra is seeking a Sr. Azure Engineer/Administrator to join our Managed Services team in Canada to support clients in the Public Sector. We are Canada's leading Data & AI company, implementing cloud-based solutions for business-critical data and analytics workloads. You are an energetic result oriented individual, with extensive Azure Administration Support experience. You have a strong client facing communication ability, and the skills to effectively direct and advise other support staff. You will work primarily during Canadian business hours, after hours on-call work is required for which, additional compensation is provided. Your expertise may be required to facilitate project deliveries.  

 

Location:  GTA, Ontario

Status:  Full Time, Permanent

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

Service Management & Compliance  

  • Monitor and respond to Service Desk incidents, requests, and alerts in accordance with our SLAs  
  • Contribute to improvement of support processes and case management  
  • Primary admin contact for internal and external customer support/help desk  
  • Communicate with customers regarding status of cases and request more details when needed  
  • Investigate, isolate, and resolve issues  
  • Ensure all cases are logged and monitored in the ticketing system  
  • Ensure adherence to our standards as defined by requirements for SOC2 Type 2 and ISO27001  
  • Ensure security policies and processes are adhered to  
  • Maintain knowledge base and support documentation  
  • Engage with Cloud providers, and 3rd party vendors as necessary to resolve incidents  

 

Azure Administration  

  • Monitor and restart Azure services/clusters/VMs.  
  • Create and manage swap space on deployed cloud system per customer policies for the deployed cloud systems and environments, to fulfil support obligations.  
  • Create custom scripts to automate support processes where applicable Ability to Power off/ Down the un-used VMs or services.  
  • Ability to identify and resolve issues within the Azure environment  
  • Manage Azure subscriptions and profiles.  
  • Deploying and Configuring Virtual Networks.  
  • Orchestrating Routing Paths, especially in a Hybrid Cloud.  
  • Managing Public and Private IP addresses for your VMs and selecting other Azure resources.  
  • Monitoring resources and effective use of Azure Monitor / Log Analytics  
  • Querying, understanding data / schema, filtering & grouping, creating insightful charts and exporting data for focused analysis  
  • Monitoring internal and customer environments for performance, resource capacity utilization and uptime  
  • Deploying VMs into Virtual Networks.  
  • Configuring VM for Optimum Cost, Performance, and Security  
  • Backing up VMs and potentially providing Fail-over Recovery  
  • Understand how to deploy, manage, and monitor containers  
  • Management and implementation of effective storage  
  • Controlling & securing access, implementing backup and restore processes, implementing archival strategies  
  • Implementing secure data encryption for data at rest and in use/motion  
  • Protecting Azure Active Directory accounts against compromise.  
  • Provide recommendations for reducing the attack surface of Azure resources, and the ability to implement.  
  • Azure and Azure Active Directory management  
  • Perform deployments and Solution installations in Azure    
  • Perform administration activities such as creating, modifying, and deleting users, optimizing remote access, and security access for Azure environment  

 

Required Skills, Knowledge, Education and Experience

  • The successful hire will be required to obtain Canadian Security Clearance, and therefore must be a Canadian Citizen
  • Prior experience in a relevant service and support role  
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills  
  • The ability to function independently in a customer facing context, and within a support team  
  • Good functional knowledge of Networking, Databases, Software, and Servers in the Cloud, and proven experience supporting these assets  
  • Experience in supporting and optimizing Backup, Restore, Recovery and high availability processes / configurations  
  • Experience with:  
  • Azure defender, Sentinel  
  • Virtual machine Creation/Configuration, Azure Automation, VNET, NSG, SUBNET  
  • Azure Firewall, Azure Firewall Policy, Firewall manager  
  • VPN, EXPRESSROUTE and UDRâ€™s  
  • Azure DevOps, Pipelines,Storage Accounts,Azure Key Vault    
  • Azure Virtual desktop, patch management etc.  
  • Experience in using products such as PowerShell and Office 365, knowing how they integrate with Azure.  
  • The relevant Azure certifications are advantageous  
  • Nice to have â€“Microsoft licensing expertise, especially Microsoftâ€™s Modern Workplace on Azure  
  • Nice to have â€“ Experience with Infrastructure as a Code (IaC)  
  • Nice to have - General programming experience, especially basic knowledge in frameworks such as ASP.NET, and programming languages such as JavaScript, SQL Server, and HTML5.

 

About Adastra

At Adastra, we transform the Data & Analytics space by providing cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud, Digital and Governance services. Our consultants specialize in transforming enterprise applications and collaborate across functions, competencies, and sectors to help our clients harness and leverage their data assets, accelerate innovation, improve operational excellence, and create unforgettable customer experiences.

 

Adastra has been recognized as one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies for 16 consecutive years, reinforcing our position as a best-in-class organization known for strategic excellence, innovation, and culture. People are at the core of Adastra's capabilities, and the Adastra Group has 2,500 consultants actualizing projects across 13 global branches. In 2020, the group's annual revenue crossed $230 million.

 

What We Offer  

  • Opportunity for advancement and career progression
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Comprehensive benefits plan
  • Successful referral program
  • The opportunity to work with one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies
  • Satisfaction of working for a reputable company
  • A flexible and dynamic workplace

Equal Opportunity Employer

In our commitment to promote fair and equitable treatment of all employees and applicants, Adastra Corporation provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of age, sex, disability, race, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sexual orientation, marital status or any other ground as described in the Ontario Human Rights Code. In addition, accommodation will be provided during the hiring process. Adastra Corporationâ€™s implementation and support of employment initiatives, encourage diversified labour force participation and equal access to opportunities based on merit and performance.

title: Interior Carpenter (FT)
description:
Interior Carpenter - Victoria

As a Carpenter, you will be responsible for reading blueprints and working with lumber, plywood, wallboard, and other materials to help within the scope of our Building Envelope projects. You may build and repair wooden structures and use a variety of tools such as hammers, power saws, tape measures, drills, etc. depending on the needs of our Building Envelope project.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team! 

Responsibilities:
  • Installing wooden structures such as roofing frames, rafters, partitions, joists, and stud work
  • Selecting lumber by size and strength to suit each job, sourcing wood to suit the customer’s budget and style
  • Calculating the number of fasteners required for each job
  • Reading blueprints and designs to work to specifications prepared by other construction professionals, architects, and building code recommendations
  • Liaising with clients, suppliers, and other construction professionals
  • Other duties assigned.

Requirements:
  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Carpenter or equivalent.
  • A certificate in the relevant area is preferred.
  • Experience in using hand and power tools such as drills, chisels, sanders, saws, and nail guns.
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills
  • Experience using construction machinery is an asset

Benefits:   
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work-life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more! 
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment. 




About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Senior Facade Specialist
description:
Senior Facade Specialist – Building Envelope
Toronto, Ontario
Architecture Firm
Competitive Salary + Benefits

Other titles: Building Science Engineer, Building Science Director, Lead Building Science Specialist, Facade Engineer, Building Science Consultant, Building Science and Restoration Specialist

THE COMPANY
TalentSphere is partnering with a reputable and progressive company as they look to add a Senior Facade Specialist to their growing team. This company prides themselves in their delivery through a full range of services for the built environment.

You will be reporting to the Principal of Building Envelope Services, you will be liable for overseeing small to large scale projects while maintaining a high level of service for the Building Envelope practice. This involves leveraging technical expertise, working closely with the other service groups in the firm to ensure consistent, consolidated, and leading-edge service delivery.

THE JOB

Responsibilities Include:
  • Work collaboratively with the Building Envelope leadership team
  • Oversee and execution of projects within the realm of building envelope consulting such as existing building repair/restoration/renewal, condition and forensic assessment and the design and performance of building envelope systems for new buildings
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance as a Project Principal leading small to large scale projects through effective management and coordination
  • Ensure the effective management of project budgets through cost control methods, scheduling, and resourcing
  • Actively participate in the mentorship of staff to grow the future leaders and key contributors of the firm
  • Assist with the development of such templates, standards of practice and information sharing systems that will improve efficiency and the level of knowledge within the group
WHAT'S REQUIRED
  • Minimum 8 years experience working in building science
  • Bachelor’s degree in building science, engineering, or architecture
  • Must have a working knowledge and ability to use programs such as Microsoft Word and Excel and Bluebeam
  • Experience in the following programs Therm 6.3, Windows, WUFI, HAM, REFM, Mepla, and any of the various scheduling programs, and 3D building modeling software.
  • Experience working with both small and large projects
  • Has a broad range of experience with different building envelope types
  • Up to date knowledge of energy standards, requirements, and insurance
  • Driven and engaged individual; capacity to grow into a senior leadership role within the firm
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to travel

WHAT TO DO NOW
If you believe this position is a good fit for you and you meet the criteria above, click apply now.

Keywords:Building Science Engineer, Toronto, Ontario, Markham, North York, Richmond Hill, Eastern Canada, Architecture, Engineering, Building Science Director, Lead Building Science Specialist, Facade Engineer

title: CA- Estimate Reviewer ( Remote in AB)
description:
Why Crawford?:

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

 

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

 

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect  our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are  Empowered  to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote  Sustainability  through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize  Training  and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are  One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give  Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an  Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.In addition to a competitive salary,

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at  www.crawfordandcompany.com.

 

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

The successful candidate will perform quality assurance review of network contractor estimates.   The review team is responsible to audit estimates and make recommendations based on program instructions provided by individual clients.   Frequent interaction with adjusters, contractors, and District Managers to exchange information, answer inquiries, and escalate quality trends identified.

 

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Reviews network contractor repair estimates to ensure estimates are technically accurate and meet appropriate industry guidelines and standards for repairs
  • Compiles specific estimate revision requests and interacts with network contractors (verbal and written) to obtain appropriate estimate corrections.
  • Manage multiple assignments and tasks within each assignment in XactAnalysis Estimate Review queue
  • Understands and comprehends multiple network programs, guidelines and requirements.
  • Interacts with clients (verbal and written) for specific discussions relating to assignment activity
  • Participates in special projects or performs duties in other areas as requested
  • Upholds the Crawford Code of Business Conduct and Ethics at all times.
Requirements:
  • Intermediate understanding of construction materials and installation methods
  • Intermediate understanding of Xactware suite of products
  • Intermediate understanding on water mitigation standards (IICRC S500)
  • Intermediate proficiency in evaluating roof damage i.e. wind and hail
  • Intermediate understanding of construction order of operations
  • Highly proficient and advanced computer skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Good time management abilities.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving ability.
  • Excellent written, verbal and oral communication skills.  
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • English/French Bilingual an asset
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

 

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

 

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

 

In accordance with the Human Rights Code and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

 

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Global Financial Firm located in Mississauga has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced Senior Infrastructure Engineer

"This role is currently on a Hybrid Schedule.
You will need to have reliable internet, computer and android or iphone for remote access into the client systems during remote work.
We will be expected in the office weekly 1-3 days depending on the team requirement.

* ***Video/ f2f interviews are required prior to all offers.

The Senior Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for Infra related activities that includes server builds, software install and configuration , OS and software remediation's and environment setup. Candidate will be responsible for provisioning and configuration of new Infra request for the multiple applications.
Help troubleshoot the issues related to application setup and deployment configurations. The candidate should have experience talking to multiple application stakeholders and coordinating multiple tasks at the same time and should be willing to perform deep dive investigating to achieve results.


Key Responsibilities:

1) Create automation of repetitive tasks like Software Install/upgrades, DB patching, OS Patching, Server build
2) Responsible for setting up the application framework and configuration. For example- IBM WebSphere, WebLogic, Tomcat setup, WMQ and Messaging services setup, Connectivity setup with upstream and downstream systems.
3) Create complex project plans, perform impact analyses solve/work high impact problems/projects, and provide resolutions to restore services
4) Drive Root Cause Analysis (RCA) post restoration of service
4) Review requirement documents, define hardware requirements and examine and update processes and procedures as necessary
5) Provide technical/strategic direction and act as advisor/coach to lower level analysts
6) Develop projects required for design of metrics, analytical tools, benchmarking activities and best practices
7) Knowledge of CICD tools and automation pipelines.
8) UNIX/Linux experience for setting up application environments using automated scripts.
9) Contribute to technical direction and strategic decisions by prepare, discuss and implement strategic solutions to avoid repeated issue.
10) Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
11) Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
12) Coordination of infrastructure activities with SA, Admin, Solution team.
13) Comfortable working with Service now change management.
14) Documenting the project related process and guidelines.


Technical Expertise
1) Should be able to write/debug and automate tasks using Unix/Shell scripts, Python scripting and Ansible playbooks for software installation, patching and building environments.
2) Knowledge of Virtual IP/ Wide IP, Load Balancing, Network. Always-on design and setup.
3) Working knowledge of Certificates, SSL, Connectivity and Firewall.
4) Experienced in platform migration and upgrade activities. Ex. OS and DB migration activities (Unix and Windows)
Good To Have:
1) Experience moving legacy application to cloud environment (Kubernetes/OpenShift/AWS).
2) Nice to have knowledge of CI/CD tools like jenkins, udeploy.
3) Knowledge of AWS, cloud ecosystem.

Qualifications:
8-12 years of experience in Infrastructure Technologies delivery with a proven track record of operational process change and improvement
Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audience
Ability to work with virtual and in-person teams, and work under pressure or to a deadline
Experience in a Financial Services or large complex and/or global environment preferred
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Effective analytic/diagnostic skills

Education:

Bachelor s/University degree or equivalent experience

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the Maintenance Technician performs routine daily maintenance activities for the facility and scheduled preventative maintenance on the processing equipment. Troubleshoots mechanical failures, recommends corrective action and carries out the necessary repairs in a timely manner to restore equipment and operational status. Adheres to all facility safety programs.

Responsibilities

  • Performs routine daily maintenance activities for the facility and scheduled preventative maintenance on the processing equipment as directed by the Supervisor
  • Identifies problems, collects data, draws valid conclusions, recommends corrective action and carries out necessary repairs in a timely manner to restore equipment to operational status
  • Identifies the materials needed, obtains pricing information, completes purchase orders and with the Supervisors approval, orders materials needed
  • Interfaces with operations personnel regarding work orders and outside contractors, as necessary
  • Adheres to all facility safety programs
  • Assists with other tasks as assigned by Supervisor

Qualifications
  • High School Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Language, mathematical and reasoning skills necessary to compute complex measurements and read and comprehend detailed instructions and electrical/mechanical drawings
  • Five (5) years of maintenance experience in a processing/manufacturing environment preferred
  • Specific areas of knowledge include:
  • Purchasing
  • Knowledge of 480 volt 3 Phase power
  • Ability to read and interpret ladder logic and electrical diagrams
  • Electric motor control troubleshooting
  • Repair and troubleshooting of mechanical systems
  • Ability to operate welding equipment and a cutting torch
  • Knowledge of hand and power tools and their safe use
  • Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds

Special Requirements:
  • Must be medically approved for respirator use (EO)
  • Must be able to tolerate exposure to high temperatures and high humidity (120F and 60% RH for 20 minutes) (EO)

Training Required:
  • Must complete all required training for a Maintenance Technician outlined in the training manual.
The name Sotera Health was inspired by Soteria, the Greek goddess of safety, and reflects the Companys unwavering commitment to its mission, Safeguarding Global Health. Sotera Health Company is a leading global provider of mission-critical sterilization and lab testing and advisory services for the healthcare industry. With a combined tenure across our businesses of nearly 200 years and our industry recognized scientific and technological expertise, we help to ensure the safety of millions of patients and healthcare practitioners around the world every year. Across our 64 facilities worldwide, we have over 3,000 employees who are dedicated to safety and quality. We are a trusted partner to more than 5,800 customers in over 50 countries, including more than 40 of the top 50 medical device companies and 8 of the top 10 global pharmaceutical companies.

Sotera Health goes to market through its three best-in-class businesses " Sterigenics, Nordion and Nelson Labs. Sterigenics is a leading global provider of outsourced terminal sterilization and irradiation services for the medical device, pharmaceutical, food safety and advanced applications markets. Nordion is the leading global provider of Co-60 and gamma irradiators, which are key components to the gamma sterilization process. Nelson Labs is a global leader in outsourced microbiological and analytical chemistry testing and advisory services for the medical device and pharmaceutical industries. Learn more about Sotera Health at soterahealth.com.

title: CA- Insurance Defence Lawyer (Remote in any office in Ontario)
description:
Why Crawford?:

 

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect  our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are  Empowered  to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote  Sustainability  through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize  Training  and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are  One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give  Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an  Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at  www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently recruiting for a Insurance Defence Lawyer to join our team anywhere in one of our Ontario offices.  

 

Job Description:

 

Directs all assigned matters with sound judgement and legal reasoning. Excellent analytical skills and creativity in solving problems.   Demonstrated ability to develop strategies, present a clear plan to the client, and communicate instructions rigorously and precisely.

Requirements:

Job Skill Requirements:                  

  • Minimum of 4 years at the Ontario Bar
  • Minimum 5 years relevant experience in insurance defence
  • Experience in MVA, liability, Coverage and/or subrogation
  • Ability to direct investigations, evaluate, negotiate and settle first and third party claims
  • Advanced computer skills including Office 365
  • Must be a team player with a strong commitment to quality and customer service
  • Flexibility to work remotely in a paperless environment
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

 

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

 

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

 

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

title: Site Foreman (FT)
description:
New City Contracting is looking for a Site Foreman to join our team! The Site Foreman's responsibility includes providing on-site supervision and coordination between different subcontractors, to ensure that required quality standards are met for the building envelope projects and to ensure work is executed towards the on-schedule completion of the project and the project's conditions are safe.

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor the work progress on site by efficiently managing the Coordination of different trades
  • Motivating sub-trades, to complete the work safely, on time and to an acceptable standard of quality
  • Reporting to Site Superintendents on-site progress, possible delays, and other issues
  • Troubleshooting common issues that may arise on site
  • Maintaining a good working relationship with the team, subcontractors, and regulatory authorities

Requirements:
  • 5+ years of experience as a Site Foreman
  • First Aid Ticket Level 1 or 2 is preferred
  • Proven trade experience (carpentry, drywall, painting, etc.)
  • Must be familiar with a transit
  • Proven experience building stairs, ramps, and handrails.
  • Must be handy with tools and must know how to run a crew
  • Concrete experience and lift ticket will be a plus
  • Experience in Building Envelop Maintenance Projects is a definite advantage
  • Ability to interpret construction documents, including drawings, plans, and schedules
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills
  • Experience using construction machinery is an asset

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!

New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.




About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Systems Specialist
description:
My client a leading Digital Transformation Solutions Provider.  Listed as a growing market by Gartner – they are doing extremely well, grew 100% over the last year and expanding the team.


They are looking for a Systems Specialist.


You will work independently or as part of a larger team to implement and/or provide problem determination and remediation services related to system infrastructure technologies.

 

Responsibilities

  • Provide technical services related to assessment, design, implementation, migration, upgrades, and technical documentation.
  • Expert knowledge in VDI infrastructure technologies such as Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktop. This includes Citrix Delivery Services, PVS and Machine Creation Services, policy management, ICA and HDX protocols, Secure Ticket Authority, Session Reliability, StoreFront, License Server, Cloud Connectors, etc.
  • Strong knowledge in Hyperconverged and Virtualization Technologies such as Nutanix AOS and AHV or VMWare ESXi. This includes Redundancy Factor settings, Cluster technology, Host and Storage management, Virtual Machine settings, policies and management, Domain Protection config, capacity management, etc.
  • Knowledge in FlexPod platforms (Cisco UCS & NetApp) such as monitoring, blade management, service profiles, volume & SVM management, etc.
  • Knowledge in Citrix Hypervisor technologies such as installation, maintenance, pool management, etc.
  • Strong knowledge in Windows Server technologies such as Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, etc.
  • Knowledge in Microsoft SQL technologies such as maintenance plans, failover activities, Always On Availability Groups, backup & restoration, database management, etc.
  • Knowledge in SSL certificate lifecycle management (CSRs, private keys, certificate chains, etc).
  • Setup, maintain and continuously improve Hyperconverged environments, Windows, Citrix and Virtualization Desktop Infrastructure including master image maintenance, monitoring and management solutions.
  • Remediate technology environments by researching, identifying, and resolving technical problems.
  • Respond to system incidents, problems, and escalations, assign ticket severity, prioritize work accordingly, and collaborate and work with other staff and vendor support resources to resolve issues.
  • Prepare and maintain knowledge base documentation.
  • Works with Lead Systems Specialist and Managed Services Operations Manager to improve operations, escalate issues, and streamline processes.
  • Collaborate closely with the Service Delivery Manager on delivering customer-facing communications and initiatives.
  • Perform advanced analysis of remote monitoring reports to identify capacity and performance issues and remediate them.
  • Conduct system assessments and audits.
  • Enhance operations through automation.
  • Execute change management and incident management processes.
  • Strong communication with customers as required, keeping them informed of incident progress, providing expert advice, and notifying them of upcoming changes.
  • Obtain and maintain technical certifications related to job function.
  • Deliver services within agreed‐upon SLAs.
  • Some travel to Data Centers will be required to perform on-site hardware installations.
  • Other duties as required.

 

 

Other Info:

  • Established over 20 years ago
  • Over 20 million in revenue
  • Great environment
  • Over 100 employees
  • Focused on Work life balance
  • Very low turnover since they started
  • Incredible growth opportunities within the organization
