title: Registered Practical Nurse
description:
POSITION: REGISTERED PRACTICAL NURSE UNIT: CONTINUING CARE CENTRE (CCC) SALARY: $31
23- $31
57 POSITION DESCRIPTION: The Continuing Care Centre (CCC) is committed to compassion and excellence in the provision of complex care and rehabilitation services
We strive to meet the physical, emotional, social and spiritual needs of each person
We believe in treating each person with respect, dignity and compassion
Three levels of care are provided in our CCC unit that include: Activation / Restoration – with a functional goal of progression (i
e
exercise and recreational activities) to increase and strengthen independence
The average length of stay in this program is 56 to 72 days
Short Term Complex Medical Management – with a functional goal of stabilization and progressions (i
e
medically complex and specialized services) to help avoid further loss of function, increase activity tolerance, and progress
The average length of stay in this program is up to 90 days
Long-term Complex Medical Management – with a functional goal of maintenance (i
e
medically complex and specialized services over an extended period of time) to maintain/slow the rate of, or avoid, further loss of function
The RPN works at their full scope of practice to provide direct care to assigned patients
The RPN practices independently when the patient’s condition is less complex such that the outcome is predictable
The RPN collaborates with the Registered Nurse in patient situations that are beyond the RPN scope of practice
HOURS: The successful candidate must be available to work all tours applicable to the department
In addition, this position must be flexible to occasional changes in hours when required to meet the operational needs of the department and be able to commit to the non-availability standards outlined in the Collective Agreement
SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Registered Practical Nurse, currently registered and in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario practicing at full scope
Preference will be given to those with at least one (1) year Continuing Care experience within past three (3) years Current BCLS certification Palliative Care Fundamentals (Level 1) preferred Current Safe Management Training Certification preferred Continuing education in geriatric nursing preferred Recent experience in physical assessments, IV medication administration, administration of blood and blood products, catheterization, chest and respiratory assessment with the ability to demonstrate competencies; Thorough understanding and commitment to Patient and Family Centered Care principles and ability to use in practice
Demonstrated problem solving, critical thinking, decision making, and conflict resolution skills and able to work through conflicts and differences in a respectful manner
Demonstrated excellence in the highest level of communication skills and customer service skills
Demonstrated knowledge and commitment to patient and staff safety
Ability to adapt and work within a constantly changing environment
Basic computer skills (Outlook, Cerner, etc
) Ability to meet the physical demands of essential duties of the position Demonstrated ability to attend work on a regular basis Successful candidates must provide evidence of a fully completed COVID-19 vaccination status prior to your first day of work
Any candidate entering
the facility to attend an interview will be required to provide evidence of a fully completed COVID-19 vaccination status
To be considered fully immunized, individuals need to have received their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days earlier than the date they are arriving to an interview or to begin work at STEGH

title: Inspecteur, Normes de performance / Inspector I Performance Standards
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Posting End Date: May 17, 2022 Employee Type: Regular-Full time Union/Non: This is a non-union position Gazifère, le distributeur exclusif de gaz naturel en Outaouais, une entreprise dynamique en forte croissance, est à la recherche d’un Inspecteur, Normes de performance. En tant que personne clé au sein du département des opérations, vos principales responsabilités incluront l’inspection et la conformité des travaux de notre entrepreneur en installation de conduites principales. Si vous avez à cœur la sécurité, d'excellentes compétences en communication et aimez travailler avec des équipes diversifiées, postulez dès aujourd’hui! Nous aimerions recevoir de vos nouvelles. Vos principales responsabilités consistent à : Inspecter les travaux d’installation des conduites principales, des services et des équipements du réseau gazier afin de s’assurer de la conformité par rapport aux procédures et aux codes applicables Superviser le travail de nos entrepreneurs. Fournir une formation/coaching continue de notre entrepreneur en service, lorsque requis Compléter les rapports et les documents électroniques pour tous les travaux d’inspections effectuées tels que spécifié par le contrat avec notre entrepreneur S’occuper des plaintes des clients, des Villes et des compagnies de services publics ainsi que des préoccupations soulevées par les autres services d’opérations, dans un délai raisonnable et de façon appropriée Inspecter les travaux de restauration et s’assurer qu’ils respectent les exigences du contrat•Identifier les problèmes dans nos processus de travail ainsi que les opportunités d’améliorations à travers de meilleures pratiques de travail Participer au programme On-Call et être disponible au besoin pour répondre aux appels d’urgence Compléter la documentation de nos dossiers (records) dans les systèmes appropriés Fournir un support au service de Construction. Assurer un suivi des coûts de projet, permettant ainsi d'identifier les contraintes qui pourraient apporter des dépassements de prévisions budgétaires. Qualifications: Bilingue français et anglais. Détenir ou devra obtenir la certification en vérification de système de distribution (Québec VSD ou Ontario GPI). Diplôme universitaire connexe et expérience préalable limitée OU deux années ou plus d’expérience en chantier OU une combinaison équivalente d’études et d’expérience. Un D.E.P. en Plomberie-chauffage, Chaudronnerie, Réfrigération, Mécanique de machines fixes ou une formation équivalente, sera considérée un atout. 3 ans d’expérience en inspection de travaux dans les projets de construction de réseaux gaziers, seraient considérés un atout. Permis de conduire valide avec un excellent dossier de conduite Expérience démontré avec Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook. Expérience démontré à travailler de façon autonome. Bonnes capacités d’analyse, de prise de décision ainsi que de bonnes aptitudes interpersonnelles, et bonne capacité à travailler en équipe. Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite en français et anglais. Être axé sur les résultats et le service à la clientèle, posséder des compétences organisationnelles efficaces, et détenir des aptitudes à la négociation. Détenir, ou devra obtenir la carte ASP Construction, Santé et sécurité générale sur les chantiers de construction Connaissance des procédures des Opérations, les différents codes applicables, les lois et règlements Connaissance avec les logiciels connexes: GIS, FRA (Datapak), iViewer, GPS Track Editor, Maximo, etc. Forte sensibilisation à l’importance de la sécurité, avec de l’expérience pertinente dans le domaine. ***** Gazifère, the exclusive distributor of natural gas in the Outaouais, a dynamic and rapidly growing business, is looking for a Performance Standards Inspector I. As a key contact within the Operations Department, your major responsibilities will include the inspection and compliance of our contractor’s installations of our main pipelines. If you care about safety and have excellent communication skills and enjoy working with diverse teams, apply today! We want to hear from you. Responsibilities: Inspect the installation of gas system mains, services and equipment to ensure compliance with company and legislation, policies, procedures and health and safety regulations. Oversee the work of our contractors. Provide ongoing training/coaching of our in-service contractor, when required Complete electronic reports and documents for all inspection work performed as specified in the contract with our contractor Address customer, city and utility complaints and concerns raised by other operations departments in a timely and appropriate manner Inspect restoration work and ensure it meets contract requirements Identify issues in our work processes and opportunities for improvement through best work practices Participate in the On-Call program and be available when needed to respond to emergency calls Complete our records documentation in the appropriate systems Provide support to Construction Monitoring of Project Costs as to identify and limit possible constraints that could lead to overruns of forecasted budget Requirements and Qualifications: Bilingual French and English. Hold, or must obtain, Certification in Distribution System Verification (Quebec VSD or Ontario GPI) . Related university degree and limited previous experience OR two‐plus years of previous field operations experience, OR equivalent mix of formal education and experience. Having a D.E.P. vocational diploma in Plumbing and Heating, Boiler making, Refrigeration, Stationary Machinery Mechanics or equivalent training will be considered an asset. 3 years of inspection experience in gas system construction projects would be considered an asset. Valid driver’s license with excellent driving record Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook Demonstrated ability to work independently. Good analytical, decision-making, and interpersonal skills and capable of working in a team environment. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and French Focus on results and client service, possess effective organizational skills, and negotiation skills Hold, or must obtain, the ASP Construction, Health and General Safety card on construction sites Knowledge of Operations procedures, applicable codes, laws and regulations Knowledge with related software: GIS, FRA (Datapak), iViewer, GPS Track Editor, Maximo, etc. Strong awareness of the importance of security, with relevant experience in the field. Diversity and inclusion are important to us. Enbridge is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to age, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, veteran status, Indigenous/Native American status, or disability. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats, communication supports, or other accessibility assistance by contacting careers@enbridge.com. Information For Applicants: Applications can be submitted via our online recruiting system only. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check. To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com</section>

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
The Company 

Think Research is changing the way healthcare is delivered - we are a global SaaS company that delivers the latest clinical knowledge to the point-of-care in hospitals, seniors care homes and in the community. The body of global medical research grows exponentially every day. Itâ€™s impossible for doctors to keep all of the latest best-practices in their heads so we make software that brings it to their fingertips, organizing medical knowledge and data to improve patient care. We're a fast-growing publicly traded company (in 2800 healthcare facilities and counting) and weâ€™re making a global impact with a footprint in seven countries. If you are looking to improve patient care and are passionate about technology â€” look no further.

 

This is a hybrid role, with a combination of systems engineer (70%) and Database administration (30%)

You Will Have The Opportunity To:

  • Deploy cloud infrastructure and services on Google Cloud Platform 
  • Assist in developing, maintaining and monitoring production 24 * 7 * 365 infrastructure. 
  • Produce systems that are secure, scalable, automated, and well-documented, and train others to take on operations
  • Collaborate with DevOps and Engineering teams to deploy and support customer-facing web applications
  • Ensure backup functionality and consistency, including restoration process and data recovery plans for disaster recovery
  • Provide DBA support as assigned, doing installations, upgrades, database loading, migrations, testing
  • Troubleshooting and resolution of database/server problems
  • Backup and recovery of local and remote replicated databases
  • Create and verify data backups including configuration data in critical environments
  • Communicate timelines, service dependencies, resource constraints and progress with key stakeholders quickly and effectively 
  • Maintain the technical infrastructure for business continuity plan (BCP) and DR (Disaster Recovery) 
  • Develop and improve infrastructure and application performance monitoring and alerting systems 
  • Provide platform support as required, on 24x7 on-call rotation

What You Will Bring:

  • 3 yearsâ€™ experience with design, implementation and management of highly available (HA) system architectures.
  • 3 years experience administering and troubleshooting Linux systems.
  • 1 year Containerization experience
  • 1 year Kubernetes experience
  • Hands on experience with cloud infrastructure such as GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.
  • Solid understanding of bash, ruby, python, or other scripting languages with a focus on automation
  • Experience managing large-scale infrastructure using automation for provisioning, software deployment and configuration management (e.g. Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, Packer etc.).
  • Experience with orchestration tools (TeamCity, Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience deploying and configuring monitoring solutions such as Nagios, Datadog, NewRelic
  • Experience deploying and configuring logging aggregation solutions such as ELK, Graylog
  • Experience with metric collection technologies such as TICK stack
  • Experience handling on-call shifts for mission critical systems. 

Why Us?

  • It's not every day that you have the chance to change the way your friends and family are cared for - Make an impact!
  • Be a part of the digital disruption happening in healthcare and do challenging, meaningful work 
  • Weâ€™re growing, and so will you with leaders who will support your development through mentorship and other opportunities
  • Collaborative, creative, dynamic and flexible work environment, with a start-up spirit

 

Subject to applicable laws and regulations, Think Research vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter a Think Research or subsidiary office/clinic.

title: Technical Support Analyst
description:
Worker Sub-Type:

Regular

 Job Description: 

Be part of something special; come join the BlackBerry Technical Support Team!

BlackBerry® – the iconic brand you know and trust – is now a market leading security software and services company. As the Internet of Things (IoT) has become the next great wave in business transformation, BlackBerry already secures over 500 million endpoints. We are leading the way with a single platform for securing, handling and optimizing how intelligent endpoints are deployed in the enterprise, enabling our customers to stay ahead of the technology curve. BlackBerry’s top customers include all the G7 governments, 9 of the top 10 global financial institutions, automotive OEMs, aerospace, defense, healthcare and media companies. Our mission is “Intelligent Security. Everywhere.”

Are you the person we are looking for?

At BlackBerry we offer our customers comprehensive, cloud-enabled software that helps handle and secure the Enterprise of Things. The totality of the BlackBerry solution is called BlackBerry Secure and is grounded in the new BlackBerry mobile software security platform. BlackBerry software is the key ingredient that allows our customers to confidentially and reliably transmit critical data between endpoints to keep people, information, and goods safe.

As a Technical Support Analyst, you will be joining our global Customer Support Organization, dedicated to ensuring the smooth and flawless usage of BlackBerry products by our customers. Working alongside Software Development and Technical Account Management teams, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring the technical success and customer satisfaction with our products and solutions.

In return for your talent and passion we will provide you with professional tools and training with fantastic opportunities for development, and the chance to thrive in a dynamic environment, working alongside outstanding colleagues. In short, you bring the talent, and we provide the environment, tools and resources for you to build your skills and accelerate your growth & personal development.

In return for your skills, expertise and passion, we will provide you with an attractive compensation & comprehensive benefits package. Become part of a team that is already leading the way and has even bigger plans for the future. Come join us!

In this role, you will:

  • Deliver outstanding customer support to customers directly while also assisting with technical consultations and customer concerns from internal and external partners

  • Provide guidance and next step consultation for analysts and recommending escalation when issue is outside analyst technical proficiency to ensure we provide relief and restore functionality for the customer as efficiently as possible

  • Take ownership of cases and bring resolution to customer’s issues by being a representative of BlackBerry for product specific customer inquiries/support and issues via inbound voice and email interactions

  • Collect information and perform deep dive analysis, diagnosis and troubleshooting of BlackBerry product & solutions

  • Research, author and review technical documentation and take ownership, correcting any non-conformances with respect to processes and documentation

Ideally, you will have:

  • Experience in supporting customers (in a technical support environment)

  • Familiarity with network topologies, edge devices (routers, proxies, etc.), and troubleshooting techniques

  • Proven integrity and diplomacy, encouraging a customer-centric culture, with a true passion for customer service and the ability to empathize with concerned customers

  • Strong problem-solving skills and must be capable of working effectively at a technical level with internal partners

  • Excellent comprehension and communication skills, both oral and written

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field and two (2) years of experience delivering technical support

  • Deep technical troubleshooting abilities including log analysis

  • Knowledge and/or hands-on experience with the following:

  • Windows, macOS and/or Linux knowledge

  • Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning based Solutions/Projects

  • Commercial Security or Antivirus Solutions

  • Malware/Ransomware protection

  • Salesforce/Jira/CRM Solutions

  • Critical incident response

Preferred qualifications

  • Previous experience/education in the field of Cybersecurity

  • Technical Proficiency Written/Verbal in any of the following languages: German, Japanese, Spanish and French

  • US Citizenship and ability to acquire US Government Clearance

  • Experience with SIEM solutions, Elasticsearch and Kibana

#LI-DA1

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

title: Power & HVAC Rentals Technician
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

  Our Power & HVAC Rental team can take care of our customers’ power and HVAC needs with more than 900 MW of power in North America. With dedicated technicians and 24/7 real-time response we offer the broadest range of power and climate control solutions across various industries including but not limited to refining and petrochemical; electrical solutions; disaster and restoration; industrial manufacturing; utility and power generation; construction services; sports and entertainment.  

  As a Service Tech within the Power/HVAC division at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance tasks as well as minor repairs on equipment in a safe and professional manner. You will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of diesel engines, electrical distribution, transformers, HVAC equipment, and dehumidification/air purification equipment in a safety driven work environment. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards higher level Tech roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

  If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. We'll provide the training, tools, the technology and the support you need to do the job right. You will also be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your training and succession goals.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Safety documentation, Near Miss and Good Catch reporting and ongoing safety training is required
  • Maintenance and mechanical repair of primarily Cummins and John Deere diesel Prime Movers
  • Perform engine diagnostics, calibrations and troubleshoot with InSite and InPower on Cummins  60kw to 2000kw genset packages
  • Electrical maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of Generator control panels, transformers and power distribution 12vdc, 24vdc, 120vac, up to 600vac
  • Set up of generators and power distribution at customer job sites and events
  • HVAC repair, maintenance and set-up of 1.5ton to 500ton AC/Chiller systems and 9kw to 150kw electric heaters
  • Responsible for service documentation, including work orders, load test sheets and PM maintenance sheets 
  • Regular travel to customer sites to service, troubleshoot and set-up rental equipment
  • Demonstrate operation of rental equipment for customers
  • Assist with pick-up and delivery of equipment & parts
  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Journeyman Heavy Duty Red Seal, Journeyman Electrical Red Seal or Apprentice would be beneficial
  • 2-5 years of experience with repairing and maintaining diesel engines, electrical or HVAC equipment
  • Intermediate diagnostic and repair skills for mechanical, electrical, diesel and other systems
  • Basic understanding of wiring schematics and diagrams
  • Own the tools applicable to position
  • Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills
  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record
  • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.
  • On Call rotation schedule
  • Able to respond outside normal working hours when possible to support customers and other branches in emergency power outages and natural disasters

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Architecte Sénior
description:
Logient est à la recherche d'un Architecte Sénior pour l'un de nos clients oeuvrant dans le secteur des télécom.

RÔLES ET RESPONSABILITÉS
  • Mettre en œuvre et dépanner la technologie des pare-feu Fortinet
  • Configurer et installer divers dispositifs et services réseau (par exemple, routeurs, commutateurs)
  • Fournir une assistance et un dépannage de niveau 2/3 pour résoudre les problèmes
  • Effectuer la maintenance du réseau et les mises à niveau du système, notamment les mises à jour IOS, les Service Packs, les correctifs, les hot fixes et les configurations de sécurité
  • Travailler dans le cadre des politiques établies de gestion de la configuration et du changement pour assurer la sensibilisation, l'approbation et le succès des changements apportés à l'équipe d'infrastructure réseau
  • Mettre en œuvre des outils, des politiques et des procédures de sécurité en collaboration avec l'équipe de sécurité de l'entreprise.
  • Produire de la documentation pour l'infrastructure réseau existante en plus des livrables du projet réseau.
QUALIFICATIONS
Compétences générales :
  • Excellentes aptitudes à la communication écrite et verbale.
  • Expérience de la rédaction de documents ; expérience du suivi des problèmes et des questions en vue de leur résolution.
  • Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante ainsi que dans un environnement d'équipe.
Compétences techniques :
  • Expérience pratique avérée en matière d'administration de réseau
  • Technologie de sécurité Fortinet et FireEye
  • Compréhension approfondie des protocoles de réseau (par exemple IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11)
  • Compréhension et expérience du fonctionnement des VLAN, QOS, NTP et ACL
  • Excellente compréhension, planification et expérience des classes IP publiques et privées et du sous-réseau.
  • Expérience de la mise à niveau du micrologiciel Cisco IOS et de la récupération de l'image IOS.
  • Expérience dans la documentation, la surveillance, la sauvegarde et la restauration des configurations Cisco.
  • Bonne compréhension du modèle OSI ou TCP/IP.
FORMATION
  • Diplôme universitaire ou collégial en informatique ou en génie électronique ou équivalent.
__________________________________________________________________________

Logient is seeking a Senior Architect for one of our clients in the telecom industry.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Implement and troubleshoot Fortinet firewall technology
  • Configure and install various network devices and services (e.g. routers, switches)
  • Provide level 2/3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues
  • Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including IOS updates, service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations
  • Work within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes to the network infrastructure team
  • Implement security tools, policies and procedures in collaboration with the corporate security team.
  • Produce documentation for existing network infrastructure in addition to network project deliverables.
QUALIFICATIONS
Soft Skills:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience writing documents; experience tracking problems and issues for resolution.
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Technical Skills:
  • Demonstrated hands-on experience with network administration.
  • Fortinet and FireEye security technology
  • Strong understanding of network protocols (e.g. IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11)
  • Understanding and experience with VLANs, QOS, NTP and ACL
  • Excellent understanding, planning, and experience with public and private IP classes and subnetting.
  • Experience with Cisco IOS firmware upgrade and IOS image recovery.
  • Experience documenting, monitoring, backing up and restoring Cisco configurations.
  • Good understanding of the OSI or TCP/IP model.
EDUCATION
  • University degree or college diploma in computer science or electronic engineering or equivalent.

title: Construction Project Manager : Capital Projects
description:
Are you aConstruction Project Manageror ambitiousCapital Project Managerlooking to continue your career with awell-established,growing real estate firm? Do you enjoy drivingcommercial retrofit, restoration and large capital improvement projects? Do you enjoy collaborating as a team, and mentoring junior colleagues? Then read on…

With your technical expertise you will be responsible for driving commercial, retail and industrial retrofit and capital improvement projects end to end. And, with your team building skills you will collaborate with the asset management and development management teams, mentor junior colleagues and coordinate with consultants and trades.

This is a great opportunity to build your construction management career with a growing and reputable real estate company that understands if you're successful, they're successful!

What you get out of it?
Compensation will be respectful of your experience, with great benefits, and additional perks. If you are interested in building your construction career with a progressive, well established and collaborative team, then apply now!
If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Senior Platform Analyst
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Background: A Federal Government department has launched several programs and projects related to its departmental mandate for rationalization, standardization and consolidation of email, data centre and telecommunications infrastructure. We are currently looking for a Senior Platform Analyst to complement its current program and project staff to support the planning and execution of these programs and projects.

Qualifications:
•Must havea minimum of ten (10) years cumulative experience asanPlatformAnalyst
•Must havea minimum of ten (10) years experience with developing and documenting detailed statement of requirement for the proposedplatform
•Must have aminimum of ten (10) years experience designing and documenting a detailed system components,interfacesand operationalenvironments.
•Must have experience performing diagnostics on the cluster
•Must have experience in the design of container images to containerize applications
•Must have experience inconfiguringand implementingmicroservices using different frameworks
•Must have experience in creatingand managingCI/CD pipelines
•Must have experience in creatingand managingGitOpsautomation which include infrastructure and application

Responsibilities:

•Deploy applications to Container Platform
•Configure and implement Service Mesh
•Customize application builds and implement post-commit build hooks
•Implement health checks to improve system reliability
•Backup and restore critical data for the cluster
•Manage operating system resources to keep the clusters running efficiently
•Configure the LDAP and other authentication security providers
•Configure and work with the multitenant software-defined networking provider

NewFound Recruiting is a Canadian professional services company, headquartered in Ottawa, Ontario and is one of Canada’s leaders in Professional Staffing and Recruiting. Currently, NewFound Recruiting is servicing clients across Canada, having established relationships in Ontario (Toronto and Ottawa), Alberta, British Columbia, Quebec, and Newfoundland. By applying innovative techniques, we match the right candidate with the right position. Our 20 years of industry experience gives you the assurance that we will provide the right answers to your difficult questions.</section>

title: Geotechnical Engineer I - Dam Safety - (Job Number: CAL010W)
description:
Geotechnical Engineer I - Dam Safety

Company: Advisian
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Calgary
Job: Geotechnical Engineer Consultants<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: May 4, 2022
Unposting Date: Aug 2, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Principal Geotechnical Engineer

Geotechnical Engineer


Advisian, Worley Group


Calgary, AB


Advisian ndash; the consulting arm of Worley. Be part of the solution.


The dual challenge of supplying energy to a growing population, while addressing the risks ofclimate change, is one of the greatest challenges the world is facing today. The energy transition isnrsquo;t just about alternative fuels,powergeneration, or use, orstorage. Itrsquo;s all the elements that contribute to the energy ecosystem. We view these challenges as opportunities to deliver a more sustainable world.

Wersquo;re developing strategies and business cases for emissions intensive clients to move to low carbon energy options, as efficiently and safely as possible. Our consultants are advising customers on circular andhydrogeneconomies,waterstewardship,electrification, and climate change risk and adaptation.We work on projects around the globe. The problems are global and so are we.


Who we are:

  • Advanced Analysis
  • Asset Advisory
  • Decommissioning and Restoration
  • Energy Transition and Sustainability
  • Environment and Society
  • Geosciences
  • Market Services
  • Safety Consulting
  • Transport, Infrastructure amp; Logistics
  • Water

Challenging complexity. Shaping a sustainable future.


Economic viability. Resource availability. Digital reliability. Carbon neutrality. These are the components of the worldrsquo;s pressing energy and resource problems. Sound complicated and tough to balance? It is.


Luckily we thrive in complex environments


Join a community of consultants, scientists, strategists, and engineers all dedicated to solving the worldrsquo;s critical infrastructure, environmental, energy, and resource challenges. By seeing things from a different perspective, we enhance the Worley Grouprsquo;s ability to serve our clients. We are together delivering a more sustainable world.


We put sustainability at the heart of everything we do


We work with business to develop the right strategy, log in to a digital future, secure and safeguard social license, enhance local communities, and power the energy transition.


We know we wonrsquo;t solve todayrsquo;s problems by using the same thinking that created them. So, from start to finish, we challenge ourselves to find the best way forward. We question every decision, assumption, and way of working to make sure we get it right. The first time.


Rising to the challenge, together


We are thousands of consultants across the globe. Be part of the future ndash; welcome to our growing team!


Overall Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities

  • Demonstrates awareness of health, safety amp; environment issues; takes action to ensure zero harm to all colleagues, customers, contractors and the environment.
  • Provide geotechnical engineering knowledge on projects and pursuits, including geological site reconnaissance, geotechnical site characterization, geotechnical analysis, laboratory analysis, geotechnical engineering design, geotechnical ownerrsquo;s engineering and geotechnical QA/QC inspection, testing and reporting.
  • Geotechnical engineering recommendations regarding, but not limited to, seismic analysis, soil mechanics, soil and rock engineering parameters, soil dynamic parameters and site development.
  • Prepare report and proposals, attend client meetings, and deliver client and industry facing project overviews and presentations.
  • Work as part of an integrated delivery team within our business, comprising of other engineering disciplines, professional environmental scientists, project delivery and project support staff on existing and new Advisian/Worley projects.
  • Travel as required for various field programs.
  • Dam Safety Review Experience an asset, including:
  • Assessing geotechnical information, undertaking instrumentation analysis, monthly reporting and answering technical queries;
  • Ability to understand construction plans and monitoring of construction progress, considering safety and ongoing stability of structures during construction;
  • Review design and as-built documents, and work activities and identify hazards and controls for dam safety in consultation with Technical Leads;
  • Value being part of a team working across the globe.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorrsquo;s degree from an accredited institution plus appropriate continuing education in geotechnical engineering, or equivalent.
  • A minimum of five years of related experience practicing geotechnical engineering.
  • Mining experience including dam safety evaluations, dam engineering design and analysis, and dam stability would be a preferred.
  • Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) or working towards registration.
  • Experience with design software (e.g. GeoStudio (SLOPE/W, etc.), Rocscience, AllPile, and/or HEC-RAS, AutoCAD and ArcGIS software would be considered an asset
  • A demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Strong work ethic, produces accurate and credible deliverables, meet deadlines
  • Ability to work independently and make decisions with input and review from supervisor;
  • Bilingual capability (English / Portuguese) would be an advantage

Advisian (part of the Worley Group) offers an excellent remuneration amp; benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within Canada and overseas.


We strive to be an industry leader in health, safety and environmental performance. Our vision is to achieve zero harm to people and assets, and zero environmental incidents. We select people who share our values, beliefs and commitment to this vision and who demonstrate the expected behaviours, competencies and performance associated with their prospective roles within the company.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Advisian (part of the Worley Group) is an equal opportunity employer.

Be part of the future ndash; welcome to our growing team!', 'Mining experience including dam safety evaluations, dam engineering design and analysis, and dam stability would be a preferred.', 'Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) or working towards registration.']

title: Corporate Support Consultant- Technology
description:
Refer A Friend

Company Description


At McDonald's, we are committed to being the best, and that starts with finding the best people. We have built a team of extraordinary people from around the world. We are problem solvers, risk takers, innovators, and thought leaders that take our work seriously, but have fun doing it. We challenge ourselves to get smarter and sharper every day, we value personal and professional growth, and believe in rewarding and celebrating our successes.


Job Description


Position title: Corporate Support Consultant- Technology
Department: Global Technology Canada
Reports to:Senior Manager, Support and Deployment Services
Job Band: Coordination (Global Grade 1)
Type of position: Full-time, Permanent

The Opportunity

McDonald’s is taking our business beyond the walls of restaurants; revolutionizing how we interface with our guests. We are providing guests with enticing mobile, web, engagement and kiosk solutions on the scale of industry leading retailers like Amazon and eBay. Technology is at critical to our business strategy – and is a top priority for McDonald’s.

McDonald’s Canada is looking for a Corporate Support Consultant to play a critical role in helping bring the McDonald’s Technology vision to life in Canada.

Who You Are

You are energized, organized, creative and a problem solver. You can juggle multiple projects and commitments without breaking a sweat and have strong written and communication skills. You are a people person and enjoy partnering with others to drive success. You are looking for a company with a winning culture where you can grow in depth and breadth while helping contribute to the company’s overall success.

What’s in it for you?

This is an unparalleled opportunity to join a winning organization during an exciting time of transformational change and be a contributing and valued member as part of the Canadian Technology team.

Principal Accountabilities: Systems Support & Administration: Leads internal corporate support team – Systems Support & Administration: Leads internal corporate support team – ensuring that our corporate users are well supported, and systems run smoothly

•Resolve technical issues while providing excellent Customer Service by effectively communicating with users during the support process
•End user equipment (laptop, peripherals) ordering, imaging, configuration, delivery, relocation and repair
•Ordering and coordinating corporate Mobile Phones orders and configuration such as SIM and Corporate email.
•Lead for Mobile vendor relationship
•Microsoft Teams, Webex and Office 365 coordination of support and upgrades
•File restoration, file and folder permission
•Corporate end user device asset tracking and disposal
•Coordinate with the technical teams to performs installations, trains, maintenance, troubleshoots and repairs of all corporate desktop hardware and software technologies.
•Coordinate the certification of new corporate laptop and peripherals. Document any special steps required by the end user to enable the device.
•Assists with setup, and operation of audio-visual hardware as required by end user.
•Point of escalates on incidents and questions to appropriate technical support groups.
•Supports events, such as infrastructure changes, software releases
•Provides timely updates to Management about service issues, when appropriate.
•Coordinate or part of a team to disconnects, moves and reconnects desktop technology hardware for single user, multi-user and office moves.
•Uses the corporate Incident Management System to record and track all support work.
•Supports teams' abilities and functions through positive customer relations.
•Contributes to, improvement/enhancement of processes and procedures.
•Gains additional knowledge and stays abreast of current technologies; through employee and company sponsored training, periodicals, and regular interaction with other team members.


Qualifications


•3+ years experience with system support and administration; support in an IT environment is an asset
•Ability to troubleshoot and work in a fast-paced environment
•Knowledge of Acrobat, Microsoft Office, Mobile Device Management
•Strong communication skills required for face-to-face client interaction and intra-team collaboration
•Ability to communicate and function as a thought leader in the Technology Services team
•Collaborative and communication skills: Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with corporate staff and suppliers.
•Innovative problem-solving skills: Critical thinker and ability to escalate when assistance is needed in a timely manner.


Additional Information


McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

You are looking for a company with a winning culture where you can grow in depth and breadth while helping contribute to the company’s overall success.', 'Who You Are']

title: Staff Engineer - Tanzu Mission Control - Resource Management and IAM - Opportunity for Working Remotely
description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why would you enjoy this new opportunity?

Are you passionate about working on the fastest-growing Kubernetes technology on a collaborative and high-performing team? Are you ready to help VMware to build cloud services that enable the policy and identity/access management of fleets of Kubernetes clusters in any cloud? VMware's Modern Application Platform Business Unit is looking for a passionate engineer to deliver VMware's strategic offering, VMware Tanzu Mission Control.

Tanzu Mission control (TMC) is a new cloud service (SaaS), part of the VMware Tanzu Portfolio. Mission Control gives customers a single pane of glass for all their Kubernetes cluster needs so they can monitor, verify, apply policy, back up, and restore with ease. You can learn more at https://cloud.vmware.com/tanzu-mission-control.

Using TMC, the customers can tighten the security and reliability of Kubernetes clusters by defining various policies like identity and access management (IAM), security and resource quota policies. The TMC Policy team is responsible for building the infrastructure to support this policy management across a fleet of clusters.

What are the primary needs, technical challenges, and problems you will be responsible for?

As a Staff Engineer and Tech Lead of the Policy team, we expect you to:

  • Partner with the Leadership and product team to establish a vision and a roadmap for the data model and authorization and access management (Role-based access management (RBAC) and Authorization (AuthZ)) for TMC and the fleet of Kubernetes clusters.

  • Provide technical leadership for the team focused on the TMC resource and data model for and access management.

  • Scope, Design, Plan, and Build a highly scalable and high-performance platform and solutions to meet customer and internal partner team's data model and RBAC requirements.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from partner engineering, product, security, infrastructure, and operation teams.

  • Act as a role model for fellow engineers by establishing and improving engineering standards and processes.

  • An empathetic leader who coaches and mentors other engineers in the team.

Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

Within your first six months

  • You understand the vision, architecture, and data model of the Tanzu Mission Control backend control plane.

  • You will have a good understanding of Kubernetes policy management (RBAC, Network, Pod security policy, and OPA)

  • You are expected to produce software designs that define and extend TMC's resource model, RBAC, AuthZ service APIs, and related infrastructure. These interfaces must meet VMware and industry standards and provide a consistent programming model across multiple programming languages.

  • You will be expected to design, implement, test and deploy microservices developed in Go.

After six months+

  • Take ownership of the TMC data model, authorization, and access policy management and lead the team of exceptional software engineers to implement cloud-scale solutions.

  • Work with product and leadership to evaluate, prioritize and provide solutions for customers and partner service teams.

  • Representing the team and product in cross-team design discussions, identifying dependencies and areas of impact.

  • Leads developer efficiency efforts and takes personal ownership of improving the culture of innovation of the team.

  • Mentoring fellow engineers in their role, and coaching them into influential voices in the department.

What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

As part of the Tanzu Mission Control - Policy Team:

  • Most of your time will be developing microservices using cloud-native technologies like Kubernetes, gRPC, REST APIs, databases, message queues, distributed tracing, monitoring, and more. All of our services are written in Go.

  • You will write automated tests in Go to validate and secure critical customer functionalities.

  • You will be responsible for delivering your code changes to production and monitoring/maintaining our CI/CD pipelines.

  • You will take on-call responsibilities where you will triage, troubleshoot, and mitigate production issues.

  • Work directly with Technical Project Managers and Product Managers to better understand requirements, and define the scope of work

  • You'll be given responsibility for high-level epics, and be asked to help define requirements and tangible deliverables. You will be expected to break down the work into individual work items that can be assigned to the team and lead in estimating and scoping.

  • You can expect to collaborate with partner teams to identify dependencies and align on delivering cross-team initiatives.

  • You'll work closely with management to understand priorities and advocate for them on the team.

Where is this role located?

Remote: This role is fully remote and can be done anywhere in North America.

What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

The hiring manager for this role is Suresh Chellappan, Senior Engineering Manager. Suresh has been at VMware for over six years, where he has been closely aligned with identity, distributed systems, and Kubernetes.

Suresh currently leads the Policy and Resource manager team, consisting of 12 engineers distributed across the US. The Policy and Resource manager team delivers many of TMC's core features, including Access Management and Kubernetes Policy Management.

We believe sustainable pace and psychological safety foster creativity and a productive work environment. We care deeply about collaboration. Teammates are always accessible to lend a helping hand both remotely and in person.

You might like working with us if you:

· Like working as a part of a balanced team empowered to make its own decisions

· Focus on customer outcomes rather than the number of features delivered

· Prioritize equitable treatment, inclusivity, and diversity both within your team and in the broader organization



Category : Engineering and Technology
Subcategory: Software Engineering
Experience: Business Leadership
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2022-04-01



VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

title: Lead Cloud Database Engineer
description:
Title: Lead Cloud Database Engineering

Level: Grade 11 (internal purpose only)

Location:

S&P Dow Jones Indices is seeking a Senior Lead, Database Engineering to be a key player in the Database Engineering team to manage various databases in the AWS Cloud environment used for running index applications. This role requires a seasoned engineer who works effectively, both independently as well as collaboratively, in a team environment.

The candidate will build solutions to manage AWS Database resource provisioning and administration for our index applications. As part of the core S&PDJI Technology team, the candidate will have the opportunity to work on innovative technologies, work closely with Index business stakeholders and participate in formulating the technology strategy to support & grow the Index business.

Responsibilities:

  • Provision and administer RDS & Aurora Databases in AWS Cloud.
  • Design configuration standards for several RDBMS and NoSQL databases.
  • Develop database engineering solutions for Postgres, MySQL, Oracle, MS SQL.
  • Design data sharding, partitioning, BigData solutions (EMR).
  • Deploy NoSQL databases like MongoDB and DocumentDB.
  • Enforce database security policies and audit logging mechanisms.
  • Configure Database monitoring and alerts.
  • Automate database provisioning and upgrades.
  • Define procedures for database backup, recovery and retention, disaster recovery.
  • Provide solutions to optimize database performance and improve standards.
  • Deploy security patches and upgrades on databases.
  • Recommend hardware and right sizing infrastructure.
  • Participate in Risk Assessment reviews, audits.
  • Implement highly available & fault-tolerant solutions to withstand system failures.
  • Maintain database configuration, support procedures and runbook.
  • Manage and execute disaster recovery plans, coordinate change control process.
  • Troubleshoot Production issues and provide workarounds to restore business continuity.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering is required, or in lieu, a demonstrated equivalence in work experience; MS in Computer Science desirable.
  • 6-10 years of experience in Database Engineering and Database Administration
  • AWS Certification is desirable
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, Google)
  • Experience with RDBMS like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server
  • Experience with NoSQL databases like MongoDB, DocumentDB
  • Knowledge of RedShift, Graph databases
  • Experience with Data Lake and Data Warehousing applications.
  • Knowledge of servers, virtualization systems, storage and network engineering.
  • Experience with monitoring tools like Splunk, Datadog, OEM or other products.
  • Hands-on experience in troubleshooting production issues and meeting critical SLAs.
  • Excellent communication skills are essential, with strong verbal and writing proficiencies.

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $67,600 - $190,100. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive bonus/a sales commission plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires.

S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.

S&P Dow Jones Indices provides iconic and innovative index solutions, bringing transparency to global capital markets.

-----------------------------------------------------------

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: 

EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com

 and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. 

US Candidates Only:The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

-----------------------------------------------------------

	Maintains knowledge of trends and developments in IT Service Management operations and practices
	Accountable for the incident record throughout its lifecycle (incident detection, diagnosis, repair, recovery, restoration and resolution) according to the approved Incident Management (IM) process

title: Server Administrator
description:
SUMMARY

Our energy sector client is seeking a results oriented individual to provide an in-depth technical expertise in the areas of Windows and Linux System Administration, server virtualization using VMWare, Network Administration and related technologies. While working with a diverse team, you will Coordinate and execute Project tasks according to established Project Management processes, procedures, methods and standards in an effective and efficient manner.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop standards, participate in the development of strategic plans and provide operational and design specifications for the application hosting infrastructure supporting the project.
  • Provide systems design expertise to support the development of computer based information systems/tools to meet the needs of the business by establishing user requirements, developing system designs, integrating commercial products, code software and test systems. Provide project management support to design projects/teams or information systems or tools.
  • Develop solutions to provide required application and database hosting functions.
  • Manage the evolution of existing systems and tools by implementing enhancements to provide additional functionality, correct problems to improve reliability and maintainability and respond to advanced system problems or failures to restore system functionality.
  • Perform system administration duties, prepare procedures or support personnel involved in system administration activities.
  • Research commercial products and tools which can be used in the design or support of information systems and perform ongoing assessments of their ability to meet current and future requirements of systems
  • Provide systems consulting support to operations, maintenance or software development staff.
  • Perform other duties as required.

REQUIREMENTS

Requires experience in the design, development and support of computer systems and infrastructure systems including

  • Application and database hosting architecture, design and integration
  • System Networking
  • Administration and use of standard or proprietary computer operating systems
  • Server automation using standard scripting languages.
  • Support of small to large scale computer systems

A period of 8 years working in an infrastructure role in a large team environment is considered necessary to gain this experience.

  • Excellent commnications and interpersonal skills (written and verbal)
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills
  • Extensive design and administration knowledge of Windows Server and Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
  • Extensive MS Office skills in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, MS Visio, MS Access, and MS PowerPoint
  • Ability to work in a team environment including open information sharing and mentoring of peers
  • Deadline / deliverables oriented individual
  • Demonstrates organizational skills and multi-tasking capability
  • Demonstrates strong leadership qualities
  • A strong personal commitment to customer needs and the needs of the Program
  • A strong commitment to corporate and departmental objectives
  • Requires knowledge of Computer Science subjects and disciplines in order to develop and support small to large scale computer systems, storage and networks. Specific knowledge would include programming, system design, database modeling, networking and system administration.
  • Requires knowledge of technical writing to prepare effective reports
  • This knowledge is considered to be normally acquired either through the successful completion of a four year university education in the appropriate disciplineor by having the equivalent level of education.

ABOUT IAN MARTIN

Looking for Meaningful Work? We can help.

  • At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.
  • We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at 

    http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

    . We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: HR Generalist
description:
magicplan is one of the leading global construction and floor plan apps, with over 500,000 downloads per month and a 4.8 rating in the App Store. More than 50 international employees work in offices in Munich, Berlin, Nantes​, Montréal, and Portland. Our goal is to disrupt the processes and product chains around construction, restoration, real estate, and property management worldwide.

With our floor plan creation app, we have developed a unique world understanding. The combination of Augmented Reality and Artificial Intelligence enables on-site data acquisition, categorization, and processing for both B2B and B2C customers. The possibilities of AR and AI are endless - and we're already harnessing their technological power today.

About the role

Are you ready to build a world-class international team?

This ad goes out to those who want to make a real difference to the employee experience and the world we work within. At magicplan, our culture and the people that make up magicplan are unique. We have significant growth plans, and the Human Resources specialist sits at the heart of this. That's where you come in! Do you have a passion, curiosity, and desire to hire the best talent in Canada and beyond? Do you have a wise HR head attached to a body with a people-centric heart? Then this is why we want to hear from you!

What you'll do 

As an essential member of the People team, you will support us in our mission to design work so that people are engaged, successful, and proud of what they do. You will identify talent (internal & external) while promoting the company brand. Creativity is highly desired, with an ability to have a pulse on market trends and innovative solutions.

  • Coordinate key HR elements across the employee lifecycle, including recruiting, on boarding, employee relations
  • Provide HR Support to the Canadian and US Team
  • Partner with the broader People & Culture team to ensure high quality implementation of HR programs
  • Play a front-line role in answering HR questions, escalating issues as needed, complete regular audits and analysis, and act as a trusted source of information
  • Manage a variety of efforts, which include support with HR initiatives, ongoing projects and coordinating the benefits administration process,
  • Support recruitment team (identifying candidates, coordinating interview schedule and process).
  • Maintain employee change status and administration updates

About You 

Although we are looking for a passionate, purpose-driven individual rather than a 100% match of the job description, this role has a few essential things.

  • You have 1-2 years experience as HR Generalist - agency or corporate, as well as a demonstrated interest in recruiting, technology, and innovation.
  • Knowledge in Canadian employment laws , specifically in Quebec
  • Comfort in working independently
  • Understanding of Payroll processes 
  • You have outstanding interpersonal and communication skills and a natural ability to build trusting relationships.
  • You are bilingual, English & French-speaking, and written (your prospects and hiring managers are not always bilingual).
  • You are organized with an eye for detail - this role requires a lot of follow-ups and managing competing priorities.
  • You have what is called the "growth mindset," you are not afraid to be challenged and to challenge others
  • You are enthusiastic, passionate, and have a great sense of humour.
  • Experience in developing and executing employer branding-related projects is a plus

Why us?

We at magicplan believe in teamwork, fun, complex projects, simple solutions, and last but most importantly, our people!
Here you have the opportunity to accelerate your career and create a true impact within your field. Work how you work best, and never stop learning! You benefit from perks like the yearly learning budget, up-to-date hardware, collective insurance, free language courses, and as well as from our amazing team. But we also want you to take your time to recharge – with 20 annual vacation days on top of federal holidays!


Interested? We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We believe in questioning the status quo in the building industry to provide contractors with a better way to get work done while on the go.

  • Over 20 million users and major corporations use magicplan and have created the largest floor plan database in the world.
  • Over 79,000 projects were managed using magicplan per week.
  • We're proud to be trusted by 5000+ businesses.

Start with magicplan on our journey to change the work of millions of building and renovation experts worldwide!

So, ​if you are a highly-motivated individual with a genuine interest in technology and have a passion for delivering cutting-edge products, we have the perfect job for you! Come and apply!

magicplan is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and fair working practices.

title: Advisor - IT security
description:
(Work place: Lévis, Montréal)

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-08

As an Advisor - IT security, you help protect IT hardware, software and data against modification, destruction, and accidental or unauthorized disclosure. You also assist in authentication and access control by designing, administering and controlling proven security systems. You analyze IT system vulnerabilities and implement protective measures to back up, restore and secure systems.

You advise and assist clients and partners as part of IT security and compliance intervention initiatives. You develop tools, methods and processes. Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your line of work.

You propose recommendations, solutions and action plans based on the organization’s objectives and priorities. You share ideas and help solve problems using your analytical skills and extensive knowledge of the line of business. You interact with stakeholders working in other technology fields. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.

General Information on the Position

Main responsibilities

  • Play an advisory and support role in the identification, monitoring and validation of security requirements and measures in order to guarantee an acceptable security posture in the sectors

  • Develop and help implement objectives, solutions, action plans and intervention plans

  • Analyze data, conduct studies, make recommendations and write reports

  • Monitor the IT security and incident management industry.

Other working conditions

  • Workplace: Currently regular telework because of the pandemic. Position located in Montreal or Lévis, depending on the applicant selected. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work

  • Number of job available : 1

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field

  • A minimum of 4 years of relevant experience

Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

  • Security certification (CISSP, CISM, etc.) (an asset)

  • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Desjardins Cross-sector skills

Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Key competencies for the job

Business insight, Interpersonal Savvy

Work Location

Complexe Desjardins Montréal

Trade Union

Non Syndiqué

Unposting Date

2022-05-13

Job Family

Information technology (FG)

title: Junior Marine Biologist - (Job Number: BUR008P)
description:
Junior Marine Biologist

Company: Advisian
Primary Location: CAN-BC-Burnaby
Job: Environmental Science Consultants<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: May 2, 2022
Unposting Date: Jun 16, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Marine Science Team Lead

Intermediate Marine Biologist


Advisian, Worley Group


Vancouver, BC


Advisian ndash; the consulting arm of Worley. Be part of the solution.


The dual challenge of supplying energy to a growing population, while addressing the risks ofclimate change, is one of the greatest challenges the world is facing today. The energy transition isnrsquo;t just about alternative fuels,powergeneration, or use, orstorage. Itrsquo;s all the elements that contribute to the energy ecosystem. We view these challenges as opportunities to deliver a more sustainable world.

Wersquo;re developing strategies and business cases for emissions intensive clients to move to low carbon energy options, as efficiently and safely as possible. Our consultants are advising customers on circular andhydrogeneconomies,waterstewardship,electrification, and climate change risk and adaptation.We work on projects around the globe. The problems are global and so are we.


Who we are:

  • Advanced Analysis
  • Asset Advisory
  • Decommissioning and Restoration
  • Energy Transition and Sustainability
  • Environment and Society
  • Geosciences
  • Market Services
  • Safety Consulting
  • Transport, Infrastructure amp; Logistics
  • Water

Challenging complexity. Shaping a sustainable future.


Economic viability. Resource availability. Digital reliability. Carbon neutrality. These are the components of the worldrsquo;s pressing energy and resource problems. Sound complicated and tough to balance? It is.


Luckily, we thrive in complex environments.


Join a community of consultants, scientists, strategists, and engineers all dedicated to solving the worldrsquo;s critical infrastructure, environmental, energy, and resource challenges. By seeing things from a different perspective, we enhance the Worley Grouprsquo;s ability to serve our clients. We are together delivering a more sustainable world.


We put sustainability at the heart of everything we do.


We work with business to develop the right strategy, log in to a digital future, secure and safeguard social license, enhance local communities, and power the energy transition.


We know we wonrsquo;t solve todayrsquo;s problems by using the same thinking that created them. So, from start to finish, we challenge ourselves to find the best way forward. We question every decision, assumption, and way of working to make sure we get it right. The first time.


Rising to the challenge, together.


We are thousands of consultants across the globe. Be part of the future ndash; welcome to our growing team!


Advisian is a leading provider of Environment and Society (Eamp;S) services in Canada. The Eamp;S Service Line is a vibrant and growing team covering: Planning, Monitoring amp; Management (including marine, atmospherics, terrestrial, and aquatics); Society amp; Engagement; Regulatory, Permitting, and Approvals amp; Compliance. We provide a full range of environmental services with a strong reputation for technical excellence, innovation and quality of work within small project consulting and strategic advisory assignments through to large project engineering and construction management delivery. We pride ourselves on the integration of our Eamp;S specialists with our engineering, construction management and project delivery teams. Our aim is to recruit, develop, and most importantly, retain the people who share our vision and strategy.


Our Vancouver office has a long history of delivering marine projects and is the Advisian Americas centre of excellence for marine science and engineering. Our marine science team provides dynamic, creative and high-quality technical expertise to our clients. For more information on our marine science global offering, please visit http://www.advisian.com/en/what-we-do/services/environment-and-society.



We have an exciting and challenging opportunity for a full-time Intermediate Marine or Fisheries Biologist based in Vancouver, BC, to join our marine sciences team. This position has the opportunity for a remote or hybrid working environment. Our ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in marine ecology. While the focus is on the BC region, our marine science team is also currently delivering projects in the Canadian arctic and east coast, across the Americas and overseas. This new and exciting opportunity will report to the Marine Science Team Lead.


Overall responsibilities and key accountabilities:

  • Conduct and lead marine fish and fish habitat assessments including collection and analysis of marine biological, chemical, and physical data
  • Support oceanographic, wildlife, vegetation, clean soils, fisheries, aquatic and reclamation field programs
  • Collaborate across regions and disciplines to meet project goals
  • Develop environmental scopes and cost estimates with direction from the technical lead
  • Prepare permit and approval applications, including supporting documentation
  • Provide compliance support including environmental monitoring
  • Prepare marine science baseline reports and effects assessments, including data entry and analysis
  • Provide client and task management and project coordination, including communications through verbal and written correspondence
  • Provide mentorship and technical oversight to junior marine biologists
  • Implement safe working practices and policies, and contribute to health and safety discussions and follow occupational health and safety procedures
  • Travel for various field programs, as required

The successful candidate will have the following qualifications and capabilities:

  • Bachelors or masterrsquo;s degree in marine biology or related field
  • Eligibility to obtain a Registered Professional Biologist (R.P. Bio) designation or eligibility for registration within a reasonable timeframe
  • Demonstrate a thorough understanding of various aquatic life forms, coastal ecology, and marine habitat
  • Understanding of applicable legislation pertaining to Canadian marine environments, including, but not limited to Species at Risk Act, Fisheries Act, Navigable Waters Protection Act, Canadian Environmental Protection Act, BC Water Sustainability Act, and Environmental Management Act
  • Understanding of Environmental Assessments and Environmental Management Planning
  • Readiness to travel for local, national, and international projects
  • Knowledge of marine industries, such as ports and terminals, pipelines, dredging and shipping, and fisheries
  • Excellent communication, organization and time management skills
  • Strong interpersonal, management and leadership skills
  • Strong technical writing skills
  • Self-starter and flexible team player
  • Ability to work within a team environment
  • Excellent computer skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in the field and carry out challenging programs in all weather conditions

Advisian (part of the Worley Group) offers an excellent remuneration amp; benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within Canada and overseas.


We strive to be an industry leader in health, safety and environmental performance. Our vision is to achieve zero harm to people and assets, and zero environmental incidents. We select people who share our values, beliefs and commitment to this vision and who demonstrate the expected behaviours, competencies and performance associated with their prospective roles within the company.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Advisian (part of the Worley Group) is an equal opportunity employer.
