title: Director, Architectural Services
description:
Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of more than 115 operated senior care and living centres as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada

 

This position will be located at our Head Office in Markham, Ontario and will have flexibility for both remote and in-office work based on our hybrid work model.

 

We are looking for an experienced Director Architectural Services to plan, develop and implement building designs. Accountabilities will include the need to compile feasibility reports, determine environmental impacts, create project proposals. The Director, Architectural Services will Hire & direct the project consultants for the development of project drawings from preliminary design to those issued for construction and specifications.

 

We are looking for a creative and inspired design professional to handle projects which will include managing client relationships, developing and presenting design proposals, preparing drawings, specifications, budgets, construction documents, and managing project teams. You will lead the internal project design team and should be able to take ownership of the projects, be it the design of greenfield projects, an extension, alterations or a restoration project, to deliver on Extendicare’s requirements.

 

As a skilled designer, to be successful in this position you should be able to visualize space in three dimensions, have a good understanding of construction technologies, and be an effective project leader. An outstanding Design Leader will have strong interpersonal skills, demonstrate superior technical design skills and be able to create designs that are functional, creative and sustainable and improve the lives of the residents who this home will serve.

 

Candidates are invited to apply for the full-time Director, Architectural Services position to work out of our Extendicare Corporate Office located in Markham, Ontario. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES


Under the direction of the company’s Vice President, Project Development & Construction, assist with project design from concept development through to completion of the full lifecycle of multiple simultaneous Long-Term Care projects across Canada.

 

Duties shall include:

  • Engaging in the early feasibility of projects, including the search and procurement of Land. Including overseeing Due Diligence.
  • Meeting with Extendicare’s key stake holders, including Operations and Facilities teams, in determining their needs and requirements.
  • Being familiar with planning approval process and being comfortable acting as the “Owners Representative” at Local Council Meetings, Planning Committee Meetings & Committee of Adjustments or LPAT Meetings.
  • Managing design projects from concept development through to design completion.
  • Developing and presenting project proposals. 
  • Adjusting designs and plans to meet the client's needs.
  • Hiring project external Consulting Team.
  • Working with the Consulting Team to ensure that they complete the Preparation of drawings, specifications, and contract documents.
  • Conducting research and compiling reports on feasibility and environmental impact. • Complying with Long Term Care Design Guidelines, safety standards and local planning regulations. 
  • Determining and adhering to budgets and timelines.
  • Managing project teams and collaborating with other development professionals.
  • Processing permit response letters and coordinating revisions with engineers and consultants to obtain necessary required documentation and permits.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Degree in Architecture or Architectural Technology.
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience as an Architect/Architectural Technologist preferred.
  • Excellent technical drawing skills.
  • Strong communication and project management skills.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office and software programs such as AutoCAD LT 2021, Revit, Adobe Creative Suite, Newforma, etc.
  • Good interpersonal and presentation skills.
  • Knowledge of building codes and regulatory standards.
  • Strong creative and visualization skills.
  • Knowledge of MLTC Design Guidelines would be an asset.
     
     
    Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodation needs must be provided in advance. To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Capital Construction Manager
description:
Are you looking for career opportunities within a global growing real estate company?

Then you might be our next Capital Construction Manager.

Join us and be a part of our journey.
 

job description

Akelius is seeking a Capital Construction Manager to join the construction department.

The Capital Construction Manager will manage several multi-family residential construction and renovation projects throughout the local portfolio. 

The successful candidate will be a team player that successfully collaborates with internal and external personnel.

They will be a forward thinker with the ability to share ideas and suggestions and focus on the big picture.

 

  • manage multiple residential retrofit and restoration projects throughout the cities area
  • initiate projects from the concept stage, carry out feasibilities and investigations and see them through construction completion
  • review designs, specifications, and tender packages
  • advise on budget and project costs and provide recommendations to branch managers
  • monitor on-site construction and actively enforce quality and schedule with contractors
  • provide branch managers with updates on schedule, budget, and design
  • effectively communicate to property managers and property administrators about schedule updates and potential tenant disruptions
  • review completed projects and address deficiencies in a timely manner
  • other duties as assigned

who you are

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Architecture, or Architectural science
  • Three-plus years of large-scale residential or commercial construction projects experience
  • clean criminal background
  • problem-solving ownership of responsibilities, able to anticipate and address issues, solutions-focused and driven
  • a team player, work as a team with internal and external personnel, forward-thinking, ability to share ideas and suggestions, focus on the big picture, and pitch-in attitude
  • time management and organization, set priorities, meet deadlines and multitask

about Akelius

Akelius acquires, upgrades, and manages residential properties.

Akelius owns 18 thousand rental apartments in the metropolitan cities of New York, Boston, Washington D.C., Montreal, Toronto, London, Paris, and Austin.

Read more at www.akelius.com.

Akelius Canada is committed to providing accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for this position and require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let the HR team know.

title: Manager, Centre for Career Action
description:
Overview

Term: 2 years

 

The Centre for Career Action (CCA) Managers contribute to the leadership of CCA through activities such as strategic planning, communication, staff management and development, collaboration, development and oversight of quality programs, measurement of effectiveness, marketing/branding, project management, and reporting. Collectively, the CCA leadership oversees the design and implementation of inclusive career education services and programming for students, alumni and employees, as well as co-operative education supports for students on their first co-op recruitment term. This position has a focus on Career Education Innovation. 

 

The Manager, Strategic Initiatives, CCA will focus on managing a variety of ongoing and new career curriculum projects, in addition to contributing to the operational and management decisions of the CCA department, including supervising direct reports.

 

CCA is a department housed within the portfolio reporting to the Associate Provost, Co-operative and Experiential Education (CEE).

 

 

Responsibilities

Support team in continuously striving to design and deliver equity-informed and inclusive career education programming and resources that support learners across a variety of career education contexts

  • Identify and implement continuous improvement measures to optimize service delivery model and operations
  • Analyse, measure and report on service and quality data
  • Develop training tools and practices that facilitate advisor performance and growth (including in how they support co-op students on work term and co-op students still seeking employment late in term) and that are adaptable for people from all identities and experiences
  • Keep abreast of and support team knowledge of: best practices in providing inclusive, equityinformed career education with a focus on: advising literature and theory; employment coaching; experiential learning theory; career- and labour market-related trends including systemic challenges facing individuals with disabilities, as well as racialized, certain gender identity, and other underrepresented groups; and innovations/technologies (including leveraging employer connections and other resources for sector knowledge; coordinating and disseminating such knowledge to students and staff)
  • Actively seek to support staff development needs and opportunities for growth

 

Guide the development and implementation of strategic, effective communications to promote the uptake and understanding of CCA initiatives/services/resources (Manager, Career Education Innovation Team)

  • Provide oversight and direction to strategic marketing, communications and branding activities for CCA workshops, individual advising services, online and print resources, and events, with attention to our wide variety of stakeholders (e.g., students, faculty, alumni, staff, employers)

 

Provide career advisement and career education subject matter expertise, oversight and guidance to undergraduate and co-operative education-related services (Manager, Undergraduate Career & Cooperative Education)

  • In partnership with Co-operative Education department managers, ensure that Student Advisors are well-supported to advise co-op students and that co-op processes support student well-being and are aligned with sound career education practices
  • With the Co-op Student Experience Manager(s), ensure a comprehensive and successful career advising experience for co-op students that is tailored to the diverse lived experiences of students and the needs of employers

 

Identify strategic initiatives and drive them forward in partnership and collaboration with campus partners

  • In partnership with managers across AAS, CE, CEE Business Services, the Faculties, the Library, the WCC, GSPA, SSO, Work-Learn Institute and WIL Programs, optimize the design and delivery of programming and service design
  • Manager, Graduate & Post-Graduate Career Education: In partnership with WIL Programs, optimize the design and delivery of the EDGE experiential education programming, taking the lead on curriculum design and adaptation for different campus partners

 

Lead and manage direct reports, support ongoing skills development , and ensure the delivery of results in support of the vision, mission and values of CCA and the larger Co-operative and Experiential Education portfolio.

  • Provide information and context needed for each employee to be effective
  • Hire the best people available from inside or outside the Co-operative and Experiential Education portfolio
  • Set goals and expectations and helping employees create clear paths to productivity and engagement
  • Develop effective work team dynamics
  • Hold employees accountable for performance including consistent application of CCA and Cooperative Education business processes
  • Manage performance through both formal (performance appraisal) and informal methods, such as through regular feedback, strengths-based coaching and one-to-ones

 

Provide overall leadership to the organization

  • Personally champion CCA’s vision, mission and guiding principles, and play a leadership role in bringing them to life
  • Provide leadership, direction and strategic planning for CCA
  • Monitor business practices to ensure that CCA and other members of CEE have the appropriate practices and processes in place to work effectively for all stakeholders, such as students and faculty, as well as internally for staff and externally for the University at large
  • Lead the development of new approaches and capabilities, as required for the introduction and optimization of new systems, tools, or processes
  • Develop productive, collaborative working relationships across CCA, across the CEE portfolio, and across UW
  • Lead the identification, development and implementation of projects to improve service quality, relationships, stakeholder satisfaction, timeliness, staff capability and performance
  • Develop internal/external customer service standards, monitors satisfaction with service delivered and take action to restore and enhance service quality

Qualifications

  • Master’s degree (preferably in a field related to well-being)
  • Equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered
  • Minimum 5 years of management experience in a human services setting, preferably in career development
  • Experience leading, managing and coaching teams
  • Experience developing and implementing effective strategic initiatives in collaboration with others
  • Experience building relationships and fostering team engagement
  • Experience and comfort with measuring program effectiveness and impact on an ongoing basis
  • Experience in connection with career counselling, counselling and/or career education curriculum development is preferred
  • Manager, Undergraduate Career & Cooperative Education: Experience operating within a post-secondary co-operative education and/or experiential education system is an asset
  • Skills in building relationships and maintaining open lines of communication to foster and maintain trust in individual and team settings
  • Skills in coaching skill development to continuously support growth in career development-oriented advising and facilitation
  • Excellent active listening skills
  • Awareness of own social location and how it affects the power and privilege in supervisory relationships and leadership roles
  • Excellent writing and presentation skills – persuasive, with the ability to make a case built on both logic and emotion and influence others’ direction or point of view
  • Excellent problem-solving skills related to planning for major projects and managing the team in their implementation
  • Highly attuned to trends and directions within labour market, post-secondary education and business, with a demonstrated globally-minded, innovative orientation
  • Strong organizational and time management skills, as well as excellent attention to detail are essential
  • Ability to discern good from great career development interventions is a must
  • Experience in overseeing partnerships and programming related to delivering accessible and inclusive programming is an asset
  • Skills and comfort to provide input to budget allocation across all accounts and sign off on some CCA accounts to a pre-set budget limit
  • Occassional travel requirements
  • Some unusual hours or schedules

Vaccination Requirement Statement

Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the University’s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The University’s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.   

 

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/   

 

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

 

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.

Equity Statement

The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

 

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion.  As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, Métis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

 

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

 

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

title: Engineering Technologist II - (Job Number: 43520)
description:
Description43520
Qualifications

At the City of Edmonton - Parks and Roads Services, the long-term success of serving our citizens is implemented by the actions of exceptional employees who exemplify our Cultural Commitments of being Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent. This position’s role will be to cultivate our vision and cultural commitments while championing continuous improvement.


Reporting to the Right-of-Way Management Coordinator, the Engineering Technologist II supports the right-of-way agreements, licenses and permits administered by the Traffic Operations Section of Parks and Roads Services on a year-round basis. This position is accountable for authorizing use of road rights of way for utility installations, authorizing temporary use of right-of-way and ensuring user compliance with agreements, legislation, and corporate policy governing the use of the City’s road right-of-way.


With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

  • Develop, negotiate and issue licenses, agreements and permits associated with management of right-of-way management as per authority delegated to the working unit
  • Make agreement amendments, revise and develop new clauses in the agreement as needed
  • Authorize right-of-way permissions, notices as per delegation of authority (e.g. agreement termination, removal notice, other communications, etc.)
  • Support the development of, and negotiations for, agreements related to right-of-way consent and access for private and other government infrastructure on City land, operations and maintenance agreements associated with enhanced maintenance activities on City Land and assets
  • Collaborate with Law, Risk Management, CPSS, Right of Way Management colleagues and supervisory staff, and other City business units to develop agreements and ensure agreement development procedures are effective and align with good business practices
  • Accountable for requesting and receiving detailed information, conducting detailed assessment and managing documentation; working with core project stakeholders to clarify content, tag people for comments within the documents; resolve agreement queries by consulting with respective business area stakeholders, resolve opened comments and action items and close when resolved
  • Follow appropriate agreement execution process as required
  • Coordinate updates to legal agreements and memorandums to reflect changes in administration, legislation and/or departmental changes
  • Act as first point of contact for encroachment circulations and provide support and guidance to applicants and other business units of Parks and Roads in support of development on right-of-way management
  • Assess, review and respond to road closure circulations, encroachment agreement applications and circulations, project circulations, development permit circulations in a timely manner
  • Review applications and collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop terms and conditions of agreements ensuring alignment with applicable legislation, corporate policy and delegation of authority
  • Maintain awareness of any political sensitivities, stakeholder requirements and development conditions associated with various applications to ensure agreements are developed in a timely and effective manner
  • Provide support and guidance to applicants and other business units of Parks and Roads in support of development of right-of-way management agreements
  • Maintain records and databases supporting agreements, licenses and related correspondence to enable timely responses to inquiries, ease of access to relevant correspondence and summary report generation
  • Manage time and prioritize workload effectively and efficiently in order to meet the operational requirements to ensure permission development, renewal and circulation timelines are met, and accommodate special requests associated with applications on an as needed basis
  • Support ULA processes and associated procedures related to access agreements on an as needed basis
  • Authorize utility equipment installation by issuing utility line assignment permits for placement of utilities within existing road right-of-way, including documenting conditions placed on installation and restoration requirements
  • Assess circulation requirements to ensure both internal and external stakeholders are adequately involved and have had the opportunity to provide feedback on proposals
  • Manage circulation processes to ensure timely receipt of circulation comments, support resolution of conflicts identified by relevant stakeholders, and facilitate any expanded consultation requirements identified through the circulation feedback
  • Support circulation, review and approval processes associated with non utility company projects including the Alberta Transportation and Alberta Infrastructure Projects and major City led capital projects
  • Assigned workload is to be completed independently to an acceptable standard within given timelines and submitted work should be to a high standard and free from errors or inaccuracies
  • Perform other related duties as required

title: Specialist Solution Management
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

Recommendation to retain Fuel Optimization & Transportation Solution Management skillset as I&O Intellectual Property (IP), as this business knowledge is a critical support element. The candidate will be part of the team responsible for Critical Fuel Optimization & Transportation application management.

 

Main Responsibilities

Recommend overall strategic approach in the management of CN Fuel & Transportation applications (HPTA, SmartYard, Right Time Business Intelligence, Wayside Health Network).

Develop, implement, administer, and maintain procedures, policies, and standards

Investigate, analyze and resolve issues including post-mortem follow-up and root cause analysis

Provide functional & technical leadership to CN’s Business, Delivery & Architecture teams, via the analysis, design validation, and implementation of operational project requirements; including active participation in critical go-live and stabilization activities.

Implementation of routine maintenance including initial research, thorough testing, planning and deployment

 

Conduct routine Disaster recovery testing ; including backup & restore validation, maintenance of DR environment & development of scripts to facilitate recovery

Interpret and enforce technical and administrative policies, standards, and procedures.

Assist with the preparation of business cases, reports, and enhancements/defects as required

Review and sign off on third party deployments, as well as work performed by external consultants, to assure CN operationalization standards are met

 

Impacts:

Team will not be able to sustain the impact of losing a resource, we would not be able to meet current SLAs and will have to reduce project contributions, impacting major operations and fuel optimization projects.

 

Skills, Certifications/Competencies:

5+ years of proven experience managing highly customized applications that provide a critical business service. Experience in 24/7 On call support rotation.

Demonstrated problem determination, troubleshooting and problem resolution experience.

Above average verbal, written, and technical communication skills are required to interact with individuals at several levels; ideally in both French and English

Advanced knowledge of ITSM processes and deployment requirements

Ability to think critically and see the big picture. In particular, the ability to see the impact of product enhancements.

Strong ability to conduct research, gather information from various sources, analyze data, draw conclusions and document findings

 

Not recommended to outsource at this time - it is important that the solution management role for critical operations applications be a CN resource that understands the interdependencies and impact to our users

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee's experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Information Security Manager - AccesD Project
description:
(Work place: Lévis, 100, rue des Commandeurs Lévis, Montréal)

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-11

As a senior IT security advisor, you help protect IT hardware, software and data against modification, destruction, and accidental or unauthorized disclosure. You also assist in authentication and access control by designing, administering and controlling proven security systems. You analyze IT system vulnerabilities and implement protective measures to back up, restore and secure systems.

You lead and influence development projects and complex, highly innovative strategic initiatives involving multiple sectors. You help develop and recommend strategic directions and business positions. Your initiatives require extensive knowledge of your field.

You make recommendations on the planning and execution of operationally and conceptually complex projects and initiatives that require comprehensive analysis and understanding of the organization and line of business. Coordination is critical, so you interact with stakeholders working in a wide range of other fields. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.

You serve as expert advisor and subject matter expert, as well as resource person and coach for senior management and decision-making bodies.

General Information on the Position

Other working conditions

  • Workplace : Position located in Lévis or Montreal, depending on the applicant selected. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work

  • Number of jobs available : 1

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field

  • A minimum of 8 years of relevant experience

Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

  • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Desjardins Cross-sector skills

Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Key competencies for the job

Interpersonal Savvy, Strategic mindset

Work Location

Complexe Desjardins Montréal

Trade Union

Non Syndiqué

Unposting Date

2022-05-10

Job Family

Information technology (FG)

title: Concrete finisher (3 vacancies)
description:
Terms of Employment:
Permanent, Full Time

Salary:
$31.00 Hourly, for 40.00 Hours per week

Anticipated Start Date:
As soon as possible

Available Positions:
3

Location:
Various location in Lower Mainland, BC and #303-1330 Marine Dr North Vancouver BC V7P 1T4

Skill Requirements:
- Education: No formal education required
- Experience: Minimum 2 years of experience required - Languages: Written and Oral English
Specific Skills:
- Level top surface of freshly poured concrete on floors, walls, ceilings according to grade and depth specification,
- Check formwork, granular base and steel reinforcement material, - Direct placement of concrete into forms or surfaces
- Fill hollows and remove spots on freshly poured cement,
- Operate power vibrators to compact concrete
- Spread, level and smooth concrete surfaces using hand and power tools,
- Apply hardening and sealing compounds to cure surfaces,
- Waterproof, damp proof and restore surfaces and erect scaffolding and swing stages
- Repair, resurface and replace worn or damaged sections of concrete structures,
- Mold expansion joints and edges, using edging tools, jointers and straghtedge
- Signal and direct concrete mixing trucks to facilitate pouring concrete and move chute to direct concrete on forms
Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: Physically demanding

Employer:
IM Concrete Finishing Services Ltd
Address:
#303-1330 Marine Dr North Vancouver BC V7P 1T4

How to Apply:
PLEASE NO PHONE CALLS OR WALK-INS
By E-mail: careers.imconcretefinishing@gmail.com

title: P1 - Network Analyst
description:
Do you have experience working as a Network Analyst? If so, this is a great opportunity for you!

Our client is looking for a Network Analyst for a 12 months contract in Calgary. This position is working a hybrid model.
Actively seeking for candidates with below requirements.

High potential for contract extension

Rotational shifts: Monday to Friday


Advantages
Hybrid remote work
Start date is ASAP
Competitive pay rate
Contract extension
Opportunity to work with in a friendly and mature team


Responsibilities
As a Network Analyst, your duties will include but not be limited to:
Implementing and troubleshooting Fortinet firewall technology
Configuring and installing various network devices and services (e.g., routers, switches)
Providing Level-2/3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues
Performing network maintenance and system upgrades including IOS updates, service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations
Working within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure team
Implementing security tools, policies, and procedures in conjunction with the company’s security team
Producing documentation for existing network infrastructure in addition to network project deliverables


Qualifications
University/Community College degree in Computer Science / Electronic Engineering or equivalent is required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience in writing documentation
Experience in tracking problems and issues towards successful completion
Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment
Proven hands-on network administration experience
Fortinet and FireEye security technology
Deep understanding of networking protocols (e.g. IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11)
Understanding and experience working VLAN, QOS, NTP, and ACL’s
Excellent understanding, planning, and experience in public and private IP classes and subnetting
Experience in upgrading Cisco IOS firmware and recovering IOS image
Experience in documenting, monitoring, backing up and restoring Cisco configurations
Solid understanding of the OSI or TCP/IP model


Summary
Interested in the Network Analyst role in Calgary? Apply online today!
Candidates moving towards the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Bilingual Project Manager, Engineering and Project Management
description:
Ã‚  :

 

 

Reports To:   Vice-President, Operations Services

 

Position Summary:     Prepare Condition Audits, project  fee estimates, specifications, budgets and schedules. Manage  structural  Envelope Rehabilitation engineering design and plan production. Provide PM functions for all assigned structural envelope projects. Coordinate with engineers, vendors, contractors and internal stakeholders to ensure project schedules and deadlines are met within budget. Conduct site inspections to ensure work is performed to Capreitâ€™s standards and codes prior to signing off on the completion.

The Project Manager, Structural and Envelope Rehabilitation will help to facilitate knowledge sharing, improve efficiency, standardize process, drive skills training, initiate IT system development and inspire overall collaboration.  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with engineers, architects etc. to determine the specifications of the project
  • Obtain permits and licenses from appropriate authorities
  • Determine needed resources (manpower, equipment and materials) from start to finish with attention to budgetary limitations
  • Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met
  • Supervise the work of laborers, mechanics etc. and give them guidance when needed to ensure quality control and work is carried out in accordance with contract documents
  • Evaluate progress and prepare detailed reports
  • Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and report issues
  • Work closely with Senior Director, Procurement to assist in the preparation and creation of scopes for repair/construction work & tender documents
  • Carry out Condition Audits, property inspections and provide analysis and assist in the preparation of capital expenditure budgets
  • Project manage various construction, intensification and retrofit projects within the portfolio, including budget management, reporting, and quality control of general contractor and consultants.
  • Assist with new acquisitions; 5-year capital plan
  • Provide site inspections including quantitative analysis to various internal operational groups as they relate to the modernizing, upgrading and maintaining the properties within the portfolio
  • Maintain and constantly improve cost reduction initiatives relating to maintenance and repair works throughout the portfolio
  • Work with Procurement in vendor selection, tender evaluation and award recommendation
  • Assist in the preparation of project approval recommendations to various internal departments
  • Provide guidance and share PM best practices with Technical Services Mangers and other internal stakeholders

 

Required Skills:

  • Knowledge and application of safety and environment principles and procedures
  • Familiarity with quality and health and safety standards
  • In-depth understanding of construction procedures and material and project management principles
  • Proven experience as construction project manager
  • Strong planning, communication, organizational, and time management skills
  • Flexibility and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated experience implementing a strong safety culture
  • Identify and manage risk and opportunities on construction projects
  • Establish and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders and decision makers
  • Provide leadership, direction and motivation to the project team
  • Familiarity with construction/ project management software
  • A team player with leadership abilities

 

Qualifications:

  • Fluency in French and English, both written and verbal
  • Post-secondary education in Structural Engineering, Building Science, Architecture or Construction Management, Professional Designation an asset.
  • PMP or equivalent certification will be an advantage
  • Minimum 5-10 years of relevant experience with carrying out investigative building reviews, project management and quality control of restoration and construction projects.
  • Capable of establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with internal operational and management teams and external associates and vendors.

title: M365 Systems Administrator III
description:
Why CompuCom? (Overview):

As the Windows Systems Administrator III you will function as an engineer in a managed services environment supporting a variety of customers ranging from medium size business to large enterprise. The systems administratorâ€™s primary responsibilities include monitoring, administering, and supporting the core services of a mixed Windows Server (2008/2012/2016) environment.

Schedule is Mon-Fri, 8-5, with on-call rotation 2 weeks on, 2 off in a month

Also, weekend and 3rd shifts available

The role also requires the ability to obtain appropriate government level security clearance and/or verification of valid and appropriate security clearance.

Proof of full Covid-19 vaccination will be required upon hire.

What We Need & What You'll Do (Responsibilities):

 

· Performs systems maintenance, upgrades, capacity planning, and administration

· Develops, documents, and standardizes preventative maintenance routines to ensure system availability and performance standards on production systems

· Investigates, troubleshoots, and resolves incidents and problems within defined service level agreements (SLAs)

· Communicates effectively with various entities, including CRMs, account managers, remote site personnel, and client technical and non-technical resources

 

Who You Are (Qualifications):

· 5+ years experience in a related environment supporting Windows Servers

· Windows Server (2008, 2012, 2016)

· Office 365

· Core Server infrastructure (DNS, DHCP, SNMP, etc.)

· TCP/IP Networking

· Microsoft failover clustering

· Blade chassis management (UCS, HPC7000, etc.)

· Server Optimization and Hardening

· Xen Desktop, Presentation Server, XenApp

· System backup and restore management

· VMware + HyperV

· Diskpart / Disk extends, and working knowledge of SAN technology

· Windows Debug, Crash dump analysis

· Windows OS Patching, Driver and firmware updates

· Ability to lift 50lbs, datacenter racking\stacking, cabling

· Other duties as defined by management

 

· Plus:

· MCSA/ MCSE 2012, 2016, O365

· VCP

· ITILv3

· Experience or Certifications supporting Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)

· Middleware technologies (HIS/Apache/WebSphere/MQ

title: Technician Field Service
description:
Description:

Job Summary

The AVI-SPL Field Service Technician will work in partnership with the Global Helpdesk to provide Service support for customers at on-site locations with the end goals of restoring functionality to our customersâ€™ assets while delivering a world-class Customer Service experience.  

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
â€¢ Read and interpret electronic schematics and architectural blueprints
â€¢ Perform preventative maintenance visits to help maintain a stable client-based system
â€¢ Clean various AV equipment including but not limited to: camera lenses monitors and equipment fans
â€¢ Take responsibility to accurately complete job documentation as needed
â€¢ Field installation of control programs (AMX / Crestron/Firmware) â€“ upload and download capability
â€¢ Field service support of networked devices (Routers IP Protocols etc.)  
â€¢ Perform service tasks in a timely and quality conscious manner including but not limited to: pulling cable installing connectors mounting projectors and hanging ceiling mounts
â€¢ Provide necessary training and support for next level service technicians
â€¢ Provide end-user client training as needed  
â€¢ Adhere to and understand health and safety standards for all phases of the job
â€¢ Setup and troubleshoot various video codecs/video teleconferencing systems
â€¢ Travel to various job sites required
Other duties assigned as needed



Skills and Abilities  

â€¢ Effectively communicate with employees customers and colleagues  
â€¢ Ability to use hand and power tools in a safe and efficient manner
â€¢ Ability to work and think independently and ensuring to meet deadlines
â€¢ Basic computer knowledge
â€¢ Knowledge of basic signal flow for audio video and control
â€¢ Ability to manage small to medium projects
â€¢ Ability to solder & crimp connectors  
â€¢ Valid Driverâ€™s License and a clean Driver's Abstract that meets AVI-SPL driving standards

Education and/or Experience  

â€¢ Minimum of 1 â€“ 3 years of audiovisual integration experience preferred
â€¢ Formal education in Electronics or related field preferred
â€¢ Minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent preferred  
â€¢ Preferred external training:  
o Avixa (InfoComm) Quick Start to the Audio-Visual Industry
o Avixa (InfoComm) CTS General Certification
o AMX Intro to Networking for AV Professionals
o Crestron Professional Installation
o Extron AV Associate Certification

title: Application Support - Blueprism
description:
Company Description

Talan is a consulting firm specializing in digital innovation and transformation. For over 20 years, Talan has been advising, supporting, and implementing transformation projects for businesses and public authorities, in France and abroad. With operations on five continents and nearly 6,000 consultants, the group anticipates revenues of 600 million euros in 2022 and expects a turnover of 1 billion euros by 2024. The group places innovation at the heart of its development strategy and is involved in areas of technological change affecting major corporations, such as Big Data, the Internet of Things, Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence. By placing the "humanist approach to technology" at the center of its strategy, the Talan Group is convinced that it is by serving people that technology multiplies its potential for society.

Job Description

Talan Canada is growing and looking to strengthen its teams with an Application Support Specialist - Blueprism for the Montreal office, able to work with clients in several industries.

Application Support Specialist DTS RPA and HFS

***Blueprism experience at least 2 years, good knowledge linux, windows, sql, network, firewall. Experience in Application Support 5 to 6 years

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Part of a multi-disciplined team providing support to the production elements of the DTS & HFS application. This Production Engineer role is center more specifically on application support of HFS / Fezziwig. The production engineer will form the follow the sun support team providing 24/6 Service to the business. He will act as a backup for the other application of the supported perimeter on RPA application and will have to do rotational shift for Sunday.

The Production Engineer will work closely with development and infrastructure teams to:
•             Manage daily operations requests for assistance and oversee the help desk activity
•             Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner
•             Manage operations expectations effectively and participate to any task force required by operations if needed
•             Perform level 1 and 2 support and complex analysis of reported issues, and evaluate alternative business solutions and workarounds to minimize the impacts
•             Prepare Test strategy, Test scenarios and test cases for the defects identified
•             Liaison and discussion with Paris central teams for all parameterization related issues and any other functional advise on reported issues or proposed solutions
•             Work with external infrastructure, monitoring and DBA team to fix the incidents.
•             Ensure a smooth follow up of all technical processes (Online, STP and batches…)
•             Understand the database concepts and provide extractions to users whenever required
•             Participate to the night support of the application and undertake the appropriate actions – both functional and technical
•             Closely follow up of all generated logs (Online, STP, batches) and alerts and monitor the flows dashboards
•             Ensures presence, monitoring and checks during application rollouts and DR exercises.
•             Ensure excellent Communication, reporting and escalation as and when needed.

The Production Engineer will also work with other teams to respond to incidents and resolve issues promptly, often under pressure, to restore normal services to the business.  Therefore, ability to be on call and provide support out of hours is essential.

As this is a production support role, focusing across a range of different and mostly cutting-edge technologies, candidates must possess the aptitude and desire to learn.

IT Governance
•             Responsible and accountable to strictly and consistently adhere to BP2S NAR IT Governance policies and procedures – Incident management, Vendor management and change management

Candidates must be local to Montreal or open to relocate asap for this job opportunity.

Additional Information

  • We are looking primarily for employees recruited in permanent positions at Talan, but are open to working with freelancers
  • The teleworking conditions depend on the mandates to which our consultants are assigned

Joining Talan also means

  • Joining an international group (10 countries, 3000 employees) of Professional Services and IT Consulting, committed to the digital transformation of its clients for over 15 years
  • Joining a Canadian company, created in 1997, with more than 100 consultants, working in an agile and pragmatic way with large companies (Finance, Insurance, Telecommunications, Services, Distribution, Public Sector) by combining consulting services / technological expertise / innovation / capacity to deliver and deploy projects
  • Joining dynamic teams, where the employee's place is at the center of attention, with the desire to create spaces that allow each person to grow, and societal and environmental commitments
    The "Great Place to Work" survey conducted this year for Talan confirms that we are well above the standards in Canada.
  • Having the opportunity to access the various communities of practice throughout the group, to share expertise, to contribute to development and to innovate, all with a strong team and entrepreneurial spirit
  • Benefit from market-competitive benefits!

Talan is a great playfield, it's up to you!

Qualifications

KEY SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
•             Bachelor’s degree required advanced degree considered a plus.
•             Minimum 6 years financial industry experience or in a similar role.
•             Prior business analysis experience in an application support environment
•             Experience with PL/SQL Developer
•             Familiarity with Autosys, Quality Center, Sailpoint, ServiceNow and Jira.
•             System administration – In-depth knowledge in Windows systems, but also Linux for helping on automation of RPA server delivery automation
•             Good general understanding of global infrastructure, firewalls, networking, and considerations in these areas.
•             Networks : Good understanding of network principals and practical knowledge of load balancing technologies, like F5 Big-IP is essential
•             Monitoring – Experience in managing monitoring tools (such as ITRS Geneos)
•             Automation – Experience to release and or server automation tools such as Ansible, Bladelogic
•             Knowledge of programming and scripting methodologies and demonstrable proficiency in writing code in one or more of the following languages Python, Perl, Ruby, Java
•             Data – Experience into Log indexing product such as Splunk and Elastic Search, Influxdb.
•             Application servers – Strong knowledge in configuring and supporting web technologies such as Tomcat, Apache, nginx, IIS
•             Analytical skills - Ability to analyze data surrounding incidents to a fine level, investigate dependencies and evaluate possible areas for improvement, and actions with a view to automate resolution
•             Prior experience creating requirements documents, functional specifications, process flow diagrams and procedures
•             Good written and spoken English is a must
•             Overall General IT knowledge is a must

Desirable IT Skills
•             Test tools – practical experience of Load testing tool like Jmeter
•             Databases – exposure to or skills in SQL Server, Oracle and noSQL DBs
•             Containers – exposure to Docker, Rancher
•             Understanding of application lifecycle and Agile methodology
•             Good tasks management, prioritization, risk management
•             Appreciation of production processes, including change and release management
•             Good incident and problem management skills, with knowledge of ITIL beneficial

Personal Attributes
•             Strong problem solving skills
•             Good interpersonal skills and team player
•             Client focused
•             Attention to details
•             Strong aptitude and interest in technology
•             High energy level coupled with a desire to take on responsibility
•             Able to multi-task
•             English/French



Additional Information

Application Support Specialist, Blueprism, DTS, RPA, HFS, French, English, Python, Perl, Ruby, Java, PL/SQL, Windows systems, Autosys, Quality Center, Sailpoint, ServiceNow, Jira, Firewalls, Networking, Agile, ITIL, Docker, Rancher, Tomcat, Apache, Nginx, IIS, Ansible, Bladelogic

title: Line Supervisor - Northeast
description:
Line Supervisor - Northeast

St. Thomas, Ontario

Entegrus Powerlines operates and maintains electricity distribution systems for over 60,000 customers in Southwestern Ontario. We are committed to operating with local values in mind, while delivering safe, reliable, and exceptional service to our customers, partners, and communities. A core value of Entegrus is having inspired and empowered people and Entegrus is the recipient of the 2021 Local Distribution Company Performance Excellence Award from the Electricity Distributors Association.

Entegrus Powerlines, progressive company dedicated to providing the highest level of service and a safe and positive work environment, requires a Line Supervisor (Northeast Region) for its St. Thomas Operations Centre. This role works in tandem with the Operations leadership team to manage the activities of the operations staff, including sub-foreman, journeymen and apprentices across the Company. 

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Schedule and plan work, assign sub-foremen, assemble crews and equipment to complete approved jobs in an efficient, safe and cost effective manner;
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable corporate and industry safety policies, procedures, standards and occupational health & safety regulations;
  • Work with the Health & Safety Manager to promote a safety culture and ensure that all staff are properly trained and working safely;
  • Provide ongoing leadership and coaching to the Operations department, including performance reviews, feedback, assistance with labour relation issues and administration of discipline (if required);
  • Monitor training and progress of apprentices, including guidance and implementation of improvements as required;
  • Develop and execute plans for all functions in the department and provide input into the annual budget process;
  • Work closely with the Engineering department in reviewing and approving technical requirements and construction details of proposed work; provide technical assistance/advice and recommendations as required;
  • Monitor and review progress of all work on an ongoing basis;
  • Review and analyze work with the view of improving methods, scheduling, cost efficiencies and customer service;
  • Coordinate emergency repair and power restoration in accordance with corporate policies/procedures and plans. 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Education: Must possess and maintain a Powerline Technician Certificate of Qualification in Ontario. Must possess a Grade 12 Graduation Diploma. A College diploma in a related subject matter area is a definite asset.
  • Experience: 10 years of experience as a certified Lineman with demonstrated successful leadership experience (e.g. as a sub-foreman or in a supervisory role) for at least 5 years.
  • Knowledge: Must possess a sound understanding of electrical principles and the operation of the electrical distribution system. Must have thorough knowledge of procedures and equipment needed to complete jobs in a safe and reliable manner, including applicable OH&S, MOL, MOE, ESA, OEB, EUSA rules & regulations. Must have familiarity with scheduling, budgeting and financial reporting, including cost monitoring and containment tools and techniques.
  • Skills: Must have excellent people skills, including the ability to mentor staff and effectively communicate health & safety and technical information. Must have an ability to manage disparate opinions and discern when best to seek out consensus or impose decisions. Must have an appreciation of health and safety concerns and the need to balance corporate objectives and employee morale and feedback on an ongoing basis.
  • Other: Must possess a valid DZ Ontario Driver’s Licence and maintain an acceptable Driver’s Abstract.

The regular hours of work are from 7:30 a.m. until 4:00 p.m., daily. The successful applicant will also be expected to be periodically on-call and available to assist and direct after hour emergencies as required. Periodic travel within the Entegrus service territory to support other operational centres (Chatham) is also required. This is a salaried position and includes compensation and benefits in accordance to the company’s non-union benefit program.

All qualified applicants may e-mail their resume quoting the “Line Supervisor - Northeast” position in the subject line to: entegrusjobpostings@entegrus.com 

The closing date for all applications is May 16, 2022. Entegrus is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fair and accessible employment practices that attract and retain talented employees. 

Should you require accommodations during the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at 519-352-6300 or e-mail entegrusjobpostings@entegrus.com.  Applicant information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Freedom of Information and Privacy legislation and will be used strictly for the purpose of candidate selection. We thank all candidates in advance; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Field Technician
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.  As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently. The field technician is responsible for maintaining and commissioning Rogers network elements and transport facilities within a defined area of the Rogers network to achieve optimum service levels for cellular and enterprise customers. This role is based on the North-Shore of Montreal and the Technician will have to work in the greater Montreal area.  What you will be doing:Respond to trouble reports of network problems by performing effective problem analysis, rapid troubleshooting diagnosis and prompt repair to ensure service restoral objectives are met.Coordinate with other Field Technicians as required to restore network problemsPlan for and execute preventive maintenance routines to ensure network standards of performance are met.Perform rearrangement and changes on the network as directed by electronic work orders.Perform acceptance tests on newly installed sites and equipment to ensure results meet design specifications.Participate in activities associated with network optimization and build activities.Follow the timeline and the escalation procedure.Maintain inventory of required parts and perform regular audits to ensure availability of parts.Document activities for future assessment analysis.Maintain current documentation of site status, complete trouble tickets, deficiency tickets, incident reports and other required reports.Install fiber optic cables associated to construction and implementation within new enterprise costumers
What you'll bring:2 – 4 years of telecommunication’s experience.Diploma/Certificate in Electronics from a technical institute.Knowledge of transmission equipment, microwave radio, fiber optic and multiplexer.Ability to work with minimal supervision.Must be able to demonstrate strong computer skillsProven ability to work in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.Demonstrated investigative, problem solving, analysis and troubleshooting skills.Strong interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills. Special Conditions:                  Flexibility to work shifts, including weekends and holidaysRequirement to work overtime and on standby.Ability to travel and work at various sites.Must possess a valid driver’s licence and have a clean driving record.   As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.  Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: No Selection
Work Location: 800, Gauchetiere O, Bureau 4000-Place Bonaventure - Montreal(182), Montreal, QC
Travel Requirements: Up to 25%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 260376
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.
 
Posting Notes:  Digital & Technology

title: Canadian Social Performance Director, Social Impact - Strategic Transformation - (Job Number: CAN007
description:
Canadian Social Performance Director, Social Impact - Strategic Transformation

Company: Worley
Primary Location: Canada
Job: Environmental Engineer Consultants<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: Apr 28, 2022
Unposting Date: May 29, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Elena Miceski

Deliver a more sustainable world


The dual challenge of supplying energy to a growing population, while addressing the risks ofclimate change, is one of the greatest challenges the world is facing today. The energy transition isnrsquo;t just about alternative fuels,powergeneration, or use, orstorage. Itrsquo;s all the elements that contribute to the energy ecosystem. We view these challenges as opportunities to deliver a more sustainable world.

Wersquo;re developing strategies and business cases for our clients to move to low carbon energy options, as efficiently and safely as possible. Our consultants are advising customers on circular andhydrogeneconomies,renewable power such as solar and offshore wind, waterstewardship,electrification, and climate change risk and adaptation.We work on projects around the globe. The problems are global and so are we.


Who we are:

  • Advanced Analysis
  • Asset Advisory
  • Decommissioning and Restoration
  • Energy Transition and Sustainability
  • Environment
  • Geosciences
  • Market Services
  • Safety Consulting
  • Society
  • Transport, Infrastructure amp; Logistics
  • Water

Challenging complexity. Shaping a sustainable future


Economic viability. Resource availability. Digital reliability. Carbon neutrality. These are the components of the worldrsquo;s pressing energy and resource problems. Sound complicated and tough to balance? It is.


We thrive in complex environments


Join a community of consultants, scientists, strategists, and engineers all dedicated to solving the worldrsquo;s critical infrastructure, social, environmental, energy, and resource challenges. By seeing things from a different perspective, we enhance Worleyrsquo;s ability to serve our clients. We are together delivering a more sustainable world.


We put sustainability at the heart of everything we do


We work with business to develop the right strategy, log into a digital future, secure and safeguard social license, enhance local communities, and power the energy transition.


We know we wonrsquo;t solve todayrsquo;s problems by using the same thinking that created them. So, from start to finish, we challenge ourselves to find the best way forward. We question every decision, assumption, and way of working to make sure we get it right.


Rising to the challenge, together


We are thousands of consultants across the globe. Be part of the future ndash; welcome to our growing team!

The opportunity


As part of our commitment to grow and evolve our business, we have recently launched the Strategic Transformation Program which aims to position Worley to be the industry-leading sustainability solution provider. The program focuses on a number of key growth areas, including exploring opportunities for genuine transformation within the broad social performance area. As such, we are currently recruiting key personnel to join our newly formed global social growth unit.


An opportunity exists for a full time Canadian Social Performance Director ndash; Social Impact Management. The newly created role will be a key component of our social growth unit. Yoursquo;ll be responsible for cultivating new relationships, enhancing our customer base and engaging new clients.


Working with the Canadian Environment and Society business operations and the Transformation Program team, you will develop and implement strategies to address the stakeholder engagement challenges within the renewable energy and climate change transition process and lead our entry into new and emerging markets.


In this self-directed role, yoursquo;ll connect and partner with Transformation team members in Australia, USA, United Kingdom, Latin America and Asia. You will also engage with our Canadian operational leads and resources as we look to further refine our world leading social impact management activities.


Yoursquo;re an experienced, passionate and motivated individual. We unashamedly seek the finest and brightest minds and will endeavor to provide the best platform for you to succeed in your role.


Key Accountabilities

  • Significant social impact management experience in consulting, industry, government or NGO settings.
  • Ability to cultivate, manage and develop positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Highly developed written and verbal interpersonal and communication skills including facilitation, presentation and negotiation capabilities.
  • Ability to provide high level strategic analysis, advice and recommendations on opportunities and challenges within the social impact management sphere.
  • Knowledge of social impact initiatives and experience in developing and implementing social impact management plans.
  • Previous experience in developing social impact management policies or processes in either a standalone setting or part of a larger framework.
  • Previous experience in social impact management within established communities.
  • Knowledge of leading practice social impact management methodologies.
  • Social impact management experience in the context of National or Provincial environmental legislation is preferred.
  • Knowledge of project development as it relates to an Engineering, Procurement and Construction company.
  • An understanding of the growing trends and emerging issues within the broader social performance area within Canada and the ability to develop strategies and concepts to tap into the associated opportunities.
  • Previous experience in similar growth or transformational project settings, or business development role desirable but not essential

Worley offers an excellent remuneration amp; benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within Canada and overseas.


Worley promotes a diverse workplace and encourages Indigenous peoples and female candidates to apply.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.


Worley is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Furniture Repair Technician
company: Ashley Homestore Canada - The Dufresne Group
description:
Furniture Repair Technician Career Opportunity!

Ashley HomeStore is currently seeking a Furniture Repair Technician for our Mississauga Distribution Centre located at 333 Matheson Blvd West.

As a Furniture Repair Technician you will be responsible for Repairs and refinishes furniture, including case goods, upholstery, leather, and some electronic furniture products.

Ashley is committed to investing in our team members; we offer:

  • Comprehensive benefits plan, educational assistance program and excellent employee discounts;
  • Employer Sponsored Retirement Savings Plan;
  • Career growth and continuous development;
  • Respectful and family-oriented working environment with strong company values
  • World class training programs;
  • To work at one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies.

As the Furniture Repair Technician you will:

  • Assess product to determine repair requirements
  • Restore product to showroom condition using proven techniques, including refinishing, re-upholstery, painting, etc. at our distribution centre or within our guest's homes. 
  • Answer Customers’ questions before, during, and following repairs, including providing directions for future use and care of product
  • Repair damaged stock and Customer product as scheduled by supervisor
  • Document and complete service reports and paperwork (including the use of electronic reporting systems),
  • Attend and support training on furniture repair topics.
  • Inspect and validate repair parts.
  • Operate and support maintenance requirements for service vehicles
  • Understand and follow all safe work practices and rules including WHMIS

As a successful candidate you will have the following:

  • High School diploma with practical work experience in furniture repair, upholstery, leather, woodworking or finish and fine carpentry
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as instructions for use, directions and safety manuals
  • Good computer skills with working knowledge of MS Office products and ability to learn in-house computer programs
  • Demonstrated ability to safely operate various hand and power tools, as well as larger machinery
  • Ability to learn in-house inventory management system
  • Good verbal communication skills
  • Able to work independently and manage time effectively
  • Valid Class 5 Driver’s license with clean driver’s abstract
  • Physically fit, able to lift and move objects up to 50 lbs.
  • Able to conduct physical work in warm and cold conditions
  • Some exposure to solvents
  • Operate various equipment (hand trucks, power tools, spray booth, compressors, etc)
  • Flexible schedule requirements including evenings and weekends
  • Available to work overtime as required
  • Criminal Record Check required

Plan Your Future With Us!

Apply Now!

Ashley HomeStore welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Manufacturing Maintenance Technician
description:
Job Description:
Title: Manufacturing Maintenance Technician
Location: Burlington, ON
Contract: 6 – 8-month contract with high possibility to convert FTE
8 Hour Shift (Flexible Start Time: 9am-12noon)

Job Description:
  • The Manufacturing Maintenance Technician will participate in the oversight of the Personalization and Manufacturing equipment cells and support the Mailing Equipment Cell in parallel.
  • They will play a critical part in new product and technology introduction projects in roles varying from design, to integration, to testing by collaborating with other technical teams.
  • You will be given assignments to lead critical projects, discussions, and activities within the plant.

Preferred Requirements:
  • Atleast 1 years of experience in working with repairing electro-mechanical equipment in a manufacturing environment.
  • Atleast 1 year experience working with mechanical and electrical tools to troubleshoot and do beginner level repairs of equipment.
  • Must have experience with troubleshooting electrical and mechanical issues, performing beginner range electrical repairs.
  • Must have experience with troubleshooting electrical and mechanical issues (beginner level).
  • Experience with reading and deciphering technical documentation, parts diagrams, etc.
  • Prior Experience working as either one of manufacturing technician, hands-on repairman, IT specialist, Automation Expert, mechanical technician, electrician, etc.
  • Solid understanding of basic IT Networking, taking backups of machines, restoring computers.
  • Experience repairing embossing machinery (Data card/Matica equipment).
  • Experience with mechanical repairs, machine shop tools, key mechanical concepts and pneumatic systems.
  • Must possess an understanding of the philosophy and application of Total Preventive Maintenance.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook emailing, Calendar, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
  • Experience with reading and deciphering technical documentation, parts diagrams, etc.
 
Duties:
  • Providing direct support with the integration of new equipment and technology introduced in the plant related to the production and packaging processes.
  • Maintaining manufacturing machinery systems in proper working order to ensure business continuity and minimize production downtime.
  • Providing daily reports to the Production Manager and Shift Supervisors, as well as the Maintenance team.
  • Maintaining a log of all work done during the shift that relates to machines and items related to ongoing developments or projects.
  • Maintaining the inventory system that serves as the foundation for parts usage tracking, machines parts usage tracking, parts reordering process, and parts reception process.
  • Analyzing downtime data, making graphs using Excel, and presenting downtime and assessment for reasons of downtime to support continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Covering other shifts as needed with short notice to assist with coverage needs.
  • Creating purchase requests, following up with Purchasing and Finance to ensure orders are placed and executed, to their final reception and audit.
  • Developing the Repair Training program for equipment repair using your experience with the equipment.
  • Performing IT tasks, such as network troubleshooting, patching software, backing up machine systems, etc.
 
Skills:
  • Formal education or training with embossing machinery (Datacard/Matica equipment).
  • Formal education or training with mailing and packaging equipment (Bell & Howell or Client).
  • Experience working in Card Personalization Center and it’s regulatory requirements.
  • Experience with Kaizen, Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma continuous improvement processes like DMAIC.
  • Experience capturing and reporting on Key Performance Indices related to Maintenance.
  • Experience using Oracle or Other Inventory Management ERP system for order placing and inventory control.
  • Experience coordinating work and project actions with vendors to their completion through follow ups.
  • Knowledge being able to read and review PLC, circuit logic, electrical repairs and assessments.
  • Prior experience working with other departments (Quality Assurance, New Product Introduction NPI, IT, and Logistics) to administer quality validations, ensure NPI processes followed, fulfill communication with logistics for shipping and receiving of engineering products.
