title: Ville de
description:
Come and make a difference in a modern, expanding city, which has its citizens at heart. An environment where your creativity contributes to the realization of major stimulating projects favoring the well-being of Lavallois. In addition to offering you career possibilities, you will be part of a large public organization on a human dimension.

for Division Art et Culture of the service of leisure, sport and social development culture, City of Laval is looking for a:

Coordinator Activities and programs

Management of municipal art collections

permanent position

The challenges that await you:

under the authority of the immediate superior, you will coordinate the various programs and activities in the field of public art. As such, you will ensure optimal use of human, material and financial resources that will be allocated to you.

and more particularly, you:

  • Plan, organize, coordinate and assess the processes of public art acquisition in accordance with the integration policy of public art with buildings and municipal sites;
  • Ensure the conservation of collections and supervise the process of restoration of works of public art;
  • Develop mediation programs with the Laval population or with the targeted customers
  • Consulting and mobilizing internal and external partners for the realization of your projects;
    • Collaborate with your superior in the development of projects of policies, procedures and programs in terms of management and development of the municipal collection of works of public art;
    • Provide all other expertise required for the realization of various activities relating to your competence.

    This function description reflects the general elements raux of the work accomplished and should not be considered as a detailed list of all the tasks to be accomplished. However, the tasks having an influence on the evaluation of the employment appear at the description.

    the sought -after profile:

    • Having a baccalaureate in art history or in a relevant field of intervention, a mastery in museology is an asset;
    • Owning two (2) years of relevant experience in the field of visual arts, in particular in management of collections and ideally in a context of local or regional governance;
    • have experience in project management;
    • Master the Microsoft Office suite ;
    • have skills in oral and written communication;
    • have a driving license and have access to a car

    Here is what we offer you :

    • A permanent position;
    • collective insurance and a Retirement regime with determined benefits;
    • A 5 ​​-day work schedule (33.75 hours);
    • A hype of work Bridle allowing telework;
    • An easily accessible workplace (Maison des Arts de Laval, 1395 Boul. of the western Concorde).

    The city of Laval is continuously looking for competent and dynamic professionals who wish to join an enterprising organization. The city undertakes to offer you a stimulating work environment!

    If this challenge interests you, apply online, before May 9, 2022 , by going to our site Internet:

    the city de Laval applies an access to equality access program and invites women, visible minorities,Ethnic minorities, natives and people with disabilities to submit their application.

title: FURNITURE SHOWROOM MANAGER – EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY
description:
FURNITURE SHOWROOM MANAGER – EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY

REQUIRES RESIDENTIAL FURNITURE SALES & DISPLAY EXPERIENCE – NO EVENINGS AND GENERALLY MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY

Our client is a manufacturer of residential furniture (living rooms primarily) sold all across Canada and the US. They have an impressive showroom at their headquarters just north of Toronto and in the west end of Vaughan where the person hired will be based.

This showroom is mainly geared towards Retailers and Interior Designers & Decorators who can order on site for their own customers, or gather inspiration and information to prescribe purchases.

The scope of the Showroom Manager is to provide a full range of support activities in the showroom to so as to optimize and maximize sales through the above mentioned visitors.

This position reports directly to the Managing Director who will provide training and guidance. The position is, therefore, most suitable for someone who can bring energy, enthusiasm and knowledge to the role but someone who is also comfortable in a developmental role.

Ideally candidates will have 3, 4 or 5 years of direct experience in the Furniture or Home Furnishings Manufacturing industries. A retail background in residential furniture may also be suitable. Anyone with more or less experience in this industry is encouraged to apply.

If you are from the residential furniture industry, preferred candidates will have sales experience from retailers such as Hudson's Bay, Restoration Hardware, Crate & Barrel, West Elm, William-Sonoma, La-Z-Boy, Modern Sense, Martin Daniels Interiors and Ethan Allen (or similar retailer). Additionally, over and beyond sales, home staging experience is desirable. Other qualifications include an Interior Decorating or Interior Design diploma or equivalent in experience.

Due to the importance of customer interaction, excellent English language skills are required for this position.

LOCATION:

North Toronto in the City of Vaughan. It is preferable if you live within a commute that is not more than 30 to 40 minutes from the west end of Vaughan.

WORKING HOURS:

Hours are hours generally 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday.

Some time may be required on Saturdays for events (with equivalent time off on other days).

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Duties and responsibilities will include 2 broad areas of focus:

Showroom management:

Set up and maintain the showroom to ensure that it is always in its most optimal visual display. Advise management of any ideas, suggestions that would improve the floor layout and visual display.

Research and suggest merchandise that will meet customers’ needs, outlining the features and benefits of merchandise to customers, and recommend add-on items.

Keep the company abreast of trends, fashion and novelties available on the market (particularly overseas), researching possible suppliers and collecting samples and other important information from them, and setting up displays of these new products in the corporate showroom.

Input the marketing department with merchandising ideas, programs and actions.

Sales:

Guide clients through the different sections of the. showroom. Assist buyers in the purchase of large quantities of custom design furniture ranging from contemporary to traditional styles, domestic and imported lines and designer collections. (NB: During the COVID sanitary restrictions these tours are delivered virtually.)

Collaborate with the visiting interior designers to develop effective and logical approach to accommodate clients design dilemmas and architectural challenges. Advise on styles and trends, suggest different options according to space style and use of room.
Review wide range of designs, selected best combination of styles, quality, price and on- going availability.

Ensure quality customer service by providing product specifications, pricing and samples in a professional manner. Follow up, encouraging customers to return, generating repeat business categories:

REQUIREMENTS:

Showroom management experience in the residential furniture industry, or in the home furnishings industry having worked for other furniture manufacturers or retailers.

Successful sales experience preferably in residential furniture or home furnishings.

Residential furniture showroom display experience. Interior Designer/ Decorator credentials or equivalent experience in this field is a plus plus.

Excellent sense of esthetics, composition, design and colour.

Knowledge of fabric – advantageous.

A very flexible, friendly and accommodating personality.

An action oriented individual who is organized and good at getting tasks done.

Impeccable English - spoken and written.

COMPENSATION:

This is a salaried position. Salary is commensurate with experience and suitable for someone in the first 5 years of their career seeking mentorship and an opportunity to contribute.

TO APPLY:

Submit your resume via the APPLY button appended to this ad or send your resume via email to: charles-g@peoplefindinc.com

Please submit a Word formatted resume and state your salary expectations.

If you need more information, call Charles at: 1-866-477-0855 ext. 21.

CONFIDENTIALITY:

Your resume is held in confidence and will not be sent to any employer without your prior permission. We appreciate all expressions of interest, however, as a practical matter, only select candidates whose backgrounds best match our client's requirements will be contacted.

All resumes are retained and treated confidentially for consideration against future opportunities.

NOTE ON PEOPLEFIND INC:

PeopleFind Inc. is an Executive Search and Outplacement firm committed to the delivery of outstanding results. Through our affiliated recruiting partners in NPAworldwide, Top Echelon and TEAM (UK) we are in constant touch with over 1.500 independent recruiting firms in North America and globally and have access to thousands of jobs should you be a job seeker, and, a vast talent base should you be an employer. Visit www.peoplefindinc.com for more information. Or, call Charles Grossner, President, PeopleFind Inc at 1-866-477-0855 ext 21.

title: Chargé de projet - science du bâtiment
description:
Veuillez noter que ce poste est affiché en anglais, car le rôle exige que les candidats qualifiés possèdent d’excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale en anglais.

Building Science Project Manager (intermediate)

We are looking for an intermediate Building Science engineer/architect for our Ottawa office. The candidates are to have experience working for consulting A/E firms in the buildings and property market in the Ottawa region.

Join a global leader in professional services. We are committed to solving the world's greatest challenges in the water, energy and urbanization market sectors.

Main responsibilities
-    In charge of the planning, collaboration, execution, and management of projects related to the building envelope with a strong understanding of building envelope and building science principles;
-    Conduct Property Condition Assessments and Reserve Fund Studies;
-    Plan, collaborate, execute, and manage different types of projects related to technical expertise (diagnostic, technical-legal, etc.), physical assessments of buildings, development of plans and specifications for rehabilitation building envelope systems.
-    Participate in the preparation of service offers and contracts;
-    Ensure the application of relevant standards and laws;
-    Ensure the quality of interventions, compliance with deadlines for deliverables and project fees;
-    Other related tasks.

Note that project manager will be supported by a multidisciplinary of project managers, project coordinators, site technicians, certified thermographers, etc., that are engineers, junior engineers, technologists and technicians.

Key Qualifications and Experience
-    Bachelor's degree in building science, building engineering, civil engineering, construction engineering or architecture;
-    Minimum 5 years of experience in the field of building science;
-    Member of the Professional Engineers of Ontario or the Ontario Association of Architects;
-    Strong understanding of building envelope and building science principles;
-    Strong proven background and experience in conducting Property Condition Assessments and Reserve Fund studies;
-    Fully Bilingual (possesses strong written and communication skills (both languages));
-    Client facing experience;
-    Experience with construction cost estimating;
-    Experience as designer or consultant relating to building envelope, parking garage, fenestration restoration/rehabilitation would be considered an asset;
-    Analytical skills and professional judgment.
-    Ability to work independently and in a collaborative environment.
-    Mastery of the MS Office suite;
-    Possess a valid driver's license and a vehicle.

En tant qu’organisation diversifiée et inclusive, nous encourageons les réalisations individuelles et reconnaissons la force d’un milieu de travail diversifié. GHD est un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Sur demande, GHD fournira des mesures d’adaptation raisonnables pour les candidats handicapés tout au long du processus de recrutement et de sélection.

We are committed to solving the world's greatest challenges in the water, energy and urbanization market sectors.", 'We are looking for an intermediate Building Science engineer/architect for our Ottawa office. The candidates are to have experience working for consulting A/E firms in the buildings and property market in the Ottawa region.', 'Note that project manager will be supported by a multidisciplinary of project managers, project coordinators, site technicians, certified thermographers, etc., that are engineers, junior engineers, technologists and technicians.']

title: Accounting Clerk
description:
The Accounting Clerk (“AC”) is a key component of Abstract’s Accounting and Finance team and is the financial cornerstone for recording the Company’s detailed AP and AR transactions. Reporting to the Controller, the AC is responsible for a wide range of tasks, and ensuring data is complete, accurate, and in accordance with underlying contracts.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for receiving, processing, verifying and obtaining approval of invoices related to accounts payable
  • Provide the Project Accountants with support to the various construction projects by matching purchase orders, subcontracts and packing slips to invoices ensuring documents meet approval requirements
  • Ensure AP invoices reconcile with the schedule of values
  • Ensure subcontractor holdback releases are completed per policy and procedures
  • Verify and investigate discrepancies, if any, by reconciling vendor accounts and monthly vendor statements
  • Accurate bank reconciliations for multiple company bank accounts
  • Preparing cheques and ensuring timely payments to vendors
  • Preparation and posting of cash receipts
  • Preparing bank deposits, general ledger postings and statements
  • Research, track and restore accounting documentation problems and discrepancies
  • Collecting and entering employee expense reimbursements
  • Maintain the integrity of the general ledger
  • High attention to detail and accuracy of work
  • Adhoc duties assigned by the Controller
  • Liaise with project team, vendors, and other staff as required
  • Support all organizational teams as required
  • Uphold the values of “Passion, Quality, Integrity” in all aspects of work.
  • Ideally two (2) years of related experience
  • Knowledge of GAAP and real estate related accounting practices
  • Strong work ethic and sense of responsibility and confidentiality
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Office (SharePoint, Teams, Excel, Word, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of project contractual commercial terms
  • Jonas Premier accounting software experience preferred

Salary up to $55,000

Plus 6% vacation

Plus benefits after 3 months

title: Senior Airport Service Agent - Toronto - (Job Number: 220000TX)
description:
Job Purpose

Working under the direction of senior Airport Services colleagues, to represent Emirates and enhance passenger service to both arriving and departing passengers. Ensure all operational criteria are completed within specified time frames as per the criteria set forth by the Company’s commercial, safety and security policies, standards and procedures.

  • Provide assistance to passengers on arrival and departure, ensuring high quality and professional passenger service is maintained at all times. These include ascertaining the requirements of various categories of passengers such as unaccompanied minors, passengers with reduced mobility etc. ensuring appropriate special services and facilities are provided to meet the special service requirements of the passengers.
  • Co-ordinate the airport operation of chauffeur-driven limousines for eligible passengers after arrival, and open the Emirates arrival information desk.
  • Monitor the arrival immigration problems, retrieve relevant documentation and report accordingly ensuring adherence to all procedures with regard to travel, immigration and safety regulations.
  • Monitor check-in including 'queue-combing' to keep passengers informed of checking delays, identifying and giving priority to Premium passengers and ensure service standards are maintained.
  • Assist in the preparation and completion of pre and post flight documentation and statistical information to ensure all data is accurately accounted for.
  • Provide cover in the absence of the senior team members during leave/sickness/training as directed by the Airport Services Officer or other senior colleague.
  • Assist in dealing with problems such as delays, disruptions, excess baggage or denied boarding including implementation of 'Options' within the guidelines provided by the  Senior Staff on Duty in order to retain Passenger confidence and loyalty. Also ensure eligible passengers are provided with accommodation and transport as per applicable procedures.
  • Where required, assist with check-in, boarding at the gates as per laid down procedures, provide announcements, and carry out hand baggage removal, handling of late-to gate passengers, flight coupon reconciliation and head count confirmation to ensure safe and on time departure of flights.
  • Monitor baggage delivery performance against agreed standards, keeping passengers informed about any delays or irregularities with their baggage to maintain an efficient baggage delivery service to passengers and monitor files creation and quality of baggage services as per Emirates Standard Operating Procedure.
  • Support and cover the Emirates Ticket Desk, where applicable, and undertake ticketing/reservation duties to ensure seamless service to passengers.

Admin Accountabilities (back office duties)


Undertake various administrative functions as directed from time to time by the Airport Services Manager/Airport Services Officer/Airport Services Supervisor.

  • Provide comprehensive support to the ASM/ASO in developing rosters for the team.  Ensure all discrepancies in attendance are highlighted in a timely manner so that it does not impact month end payroll processing.
  • Plan & assist with the execution of ad hoc projects/assignments liaising with relevant internal/external stakeholders and provide updates to management on the progress and of any concerns that needs escalation.
  • Respond to queries, complaints and claims in an efficient and timely manner in order to restore passenger confidence.  Assist with enquiries from CASA and other authorities. 
  • In the event of resource shortfalls, provide frontline assistance and support to the operational team.   Assist with flight delays, disruptions, excess baggage or denied boarding, including implementation of the "Options" Scheme, within the guidelines provided by management in order to retain customer confidence and loyalty.  Make/amend reservations as and when necessary.
  • Ensure post flight activities are completed such as compilation and dispatch of TLS, reconciliation of flight coupons and assemble flight file so that future queries can be dealt with.  Ensure expenditure on meals and accommodation for transfer or delayed passengers are in accordance with company procedures.
  • Ensure all invoices are processed within specified time frame, as per Accounts SLA.
  • Monitor and replenish stocks of revenue and other airline stationery to ensure a smooth operation.
  • To create and maintain appropriate record and filing systems for easy retrieval and proper maintenance of records.
  • Coordinate with service suppliers for regular, preventive or in the event of breakdown of office equipment.  Ensure all deficiencies are accurately reported/logged and corrective action is taken to maintain to EK standard of service.
  • To ensure that correct action is taken by the GHA in respect of any AHL or OHD on the flight and ensure that subsequent follow-up action is taken and that passengers are kept informed.
  • Share responsibility with Airport Services Manager/Airport Services Officer on the induction process of new hires into the department by conducting briefing sessions on administrative matters.

Qualifications & Experience

 Qualifications:


         Minimum  High School Level or equivalent


     Must have completed relevant and recognized professional training courses in Passenger Services and Ground Operation


          Knowledge of Basic Fares and Ticketing would be advantageous


  Experience:


        Given the specific requirements at outstations, a minimum of 2 years’ Airline Industry experience is required.


Knowledge/Skills:


       Fluency in written and spoken English and Local Language


Customer Service Delivery


Job Category Airport Operations
Primary Location Canada-Toronto
Job Posting 22-Apr-22, 9:02:00 PM
Closing Date (GMT+4) Ongoing

title: Database Administrator – RAC
description:
Story Behind the Need:

• Business Group: GTS – Database Operations
• The main function of a Database Administrator is to provide database support on a variety of hardware and software platforms and peripherals.

Candidate Value Proposition:

• The successful candidate will have the opportunity to be involved in many key projects and initiatives to further build the Bank’s IAM capabilities. This individual will be collaborating with a strong senior leadership team of IAM and security professionals and gain exposure to industry leading IAM platforms.

Typical Day in Role:

• Quarterly database PSU patching
• Oracle upgrade/migration
• Performance Tunning
• Database P1/P2 support

Candidate Requirements/Must-Have skills:

• 5+ years of experience with Oracle Installation – Database upgrades/migrations on different OS Solaris, Linux, Windows. AIX is nice to have.
• 5+ years of experience with Database creation and upgrade of Oracle database versions 11g, 12c & 19c
• 5+ years of experience with RAC (Real Application Cluster) – setup, configure and support –
• 5+ years of experience with Automatic Storage Management (ASM) – setup, configure and support
• 5+ years of experience with RMAN, RMAN Catalog, backup, restore and Data Pump export/Import
• 5+ years of experience with Data Guard – Database replication tools, setup, configure and support
• 5+ years of experience with Database performance and tuning
• Ability to provide 24×7 production support – rotational shift (1 week a month or 5 weeks pager support after hours)
• Familiar with OEM/Grid Control (13c)
• Familiar with Oracle Exadata

Nice to Have Skills:

• Familiar with Security and Auditing
• Oracle Golden Gate
• Database setup in a Cloud environment
• Oracle Certifications
• Experience working with executives

Soft Skills:

• Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills to be able to work well with technical peers and business stakeholders at different levels within the organization
• Excellent interpersonal skills to be able to collaborate and work closely with external vendors
• Ability to analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions
• Ability to work as part of a team, as well as work independently or with minimal direction
• Good time management and organizational skills to effectively manage high scale project

Education:

• Post-secondary degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required

Candidate Review & Selection:

• 1 round interview – hiring manager (30-45 minutes)

title: Business System Analyst
description:
Position Summary:
The Business Systems analyst will support organization applications related to Transportation, Demand Planning and Ordering Systems to enable business processes including application administration, systems integration, business analysis, data integrity and reporting.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Perform administrative tasks such as user access management, application backup / restore, performance tuning, jobs monitoring, troubleshooting, configuration and system upgrades which will require regular on call 24/7 support.
  • Support ongoing cloud migration from AWS to GCP Windows Servers
  • Write SQL code, VBA and VB Scripts to support necessary data transformations, data loads from and into various production and test systems.
  • Perform all necessary testing to ensure data integrity and on-going monitoring for data quality.
  • Work cross-functionally with Transportation, Operations and Supply Chain teams to understand systems requirements, support ad-hoc analysis and reporting.
  • Develop Excel Reports and Tableau Dashboards to assist business users in managing their processes and performance.
  • Provide training and support to business SMEs to drive best utilization of applications and best practices.
Skills and Experience:
  • A bachelor’s degree in engineering or computer science
  • Strong understanding of systems integration and relational database management systems
  • Understanding of Microsoft SharePoint features and functionalities, including web parts, web controls, workflows, forms, service applications, external data, customization
  • Excellent SQL skills and experience, with focus on code readability
  • Experience with supporting and writing VB Script and VBA
  • Experience with Windows Servers, knowledge of cloud infrastructure and concepts
  • Team player with excellent collaboration and communication skills
  • Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly manner
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
  • Previous experience in transportation, logistics and/or supply chain is preferred
  • Experience with any of the reporting or data discovery tools such as Tableau is an asset

title: Logistic Support Analysis Manager
description:
The Logistic Support Analysis (LSA) Manager delegates, manages and creates all required analysis in support of the LSA function and support to the vessel project manager.

Duties/Accountabilities

The LSA Manager, reporting to the ILS Manager, is responsible to manage and delegate tasks to supply the vessel internal customer, ILS Project Manager, with the activities related to the development of Logistic Support Analysis.  The LSA Manager delegates to, and collaborates with the wider VSY, performing the LSA functions.  The incumbent partakes, delegates, and guides the design process of all products relevant to maintainability, reliability, testability by optimizing of life cycle costs through the definition of required resources to support the product, during in-service operation.

  • Leads the preparation of the following analysis:
  1. Reliability Maintainability and Availability
      1. Reliability – The ability to perform a specific function and may be given as design reliability or operational reliability.
      2. Availability – The ability to keep a functioning state in the given environment.
      3. Maintainability – The ability to be timely and easily maintained (including servicing, inspection and check, repair and / or modification).
  2. Configuration Management
      1. Establishing and maintaining consistency of a product's performance, functional, and physical attributes with its requirements, design, and operational information throughout the operational life.
  4. Maintenance
      1. Utilize the maintenance planning process for the development of the maintenance concept.  Develop the maintenance concept to evolve and establish requirements and tasks to be accomplished for achieving, restoring, and maintaining the operational capability for the life of the system.
  6. Material Supply and Management
      1. Supply support encompassing all management actions, procedures, and techniques necessary to determine requirements for acquisition of support items and spare parts.
  8. Packaging, Handling, Storage and Transportation
      1. Resources and procedures to ensure that all equipment and support items are preserved, packaged, marked, handled, transported, and stored properly for short- and long-term requirements.
  10. Support and Test Equipment
      1. Analysis to identify support and test equipment including all equipment, mobile and fixed, required to perform the support functions
  • Creates and manages schedule and budget.
  • Participates and chairs meetings and forums as well as development and support required.
  • Controls and achieves quality for all deliveries and communication conducted.

Education and Experience

  • An Engineering degree, or equivalent experience.
  • Minimum 8 years' experience in conducting Logistics Support Analysis for complex systems or equipment.
  • At least 2 years' experience in a supervisory role.
  • Project Management Professional designation is desirable.

Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies

  • Strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative.
  • Above average communication, interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Proficient knowledge of MS Office products, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Intellectual curiosity, seeking opportunities to develop new skills.
  • Knowledge of OmegaPS considered a plus.

title: Senior Personalization & Manufacturing Equipment Maintenance Tech
description:
Location: Burlington, Canada

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

The Senior Personalization & Manufacturing Equipment Maintenance will be part of the Engineering & Maintenance team located in Burlington, Ontario, and will extend support and machine maintenance to the Production environment, minimizing downtime and supporting Machine Operators through technical problems they encounter on the machines related to quality, downtime or performance.

This Maintenance Technician will also fix mechanical, electrical, computer and firmware related problems in a high-paced, time-critical production environment and coach operators on problem solving at their level. Being the senior technician in charge of the Personalization and Manufacturing equipment cells and support the Mailing Equipment Cell in parallel, this role will play a critical part in new product and technology introduction projects in roles varying from design, to integration, to testing by collaborating with other technical teams.

As a Senior Technician, this role will be an ambassador representing the Engineering & Maintenance team to other teams and external parties, given assignments to lead critical projects, discussions, and activities within the plant.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Providing direct support with the integration of new equipment and technology introduced in the plant related to the production and packaging processes

  • Maintaining manufacturing machinery systems in proper working order to ensure business continuity and minimize production downtime

  • Providing daily reports to the Production Manager and Shift Supervisors, as well as the Maintenance team

  • Maintaining a log of all work done during the shift that relates to machines and items related to ongoing developments or projects

  • Maintaining the inventory system that serves as the foundation for parts usage tracking, machines parts usage tracking, parts reordering process, and parts reception process

  • Attending weekly Maintenance team meetings and updating the team on assigned projects, tasks, and ongoing problems, utilizing the forum to discuss road blocks and improving overall department performance

  • Focusing on quality and working towards a goal of being World Class by continuously practicing Six Sigma-Lean manufacturing approach to monitoring, controlling and improving the department’s key performance indicators

  • Working with other departments to enhance quality by participating in continuous improvement projects, finding new ways to reduce scrap and save costs

  • Analyzing downtime data, making graphs using Excel, and presenting downtime and assessment for reasons of downtime to support continuous improvement initiatives

  • Covering other shifts as needed with short notice to assist with coverage needs

  • Creating purchase requests, following up with Purchasing and Finance to ensure orders are placed and executed, to their final reception and audit

  • Developing the Repair Training program for equipment repair using your experience with the equipment

  • Performing IT tasks, such as network troubleshooting, patching software, backing up machine systems, etc.

  • Regularly communicate technical information and updates to external customers and other stakeholders, internally and externally

  • Maintaining a clean work environment and practicing the principles of 5S daily

  • Working on integrating the machines assigned to you into the production floor by planning their arrival, coordinating with the manufacturer, following up with support departments, electrical work, the pre-start work, the actual implementation, and post implementation services

  • Informal supervision and coaching of junior technicians

Required Skills and Experience:

  • Prior experience as a lead or experience supervising members of a team of technical employees in support of a common function

  • At least 4 years of experience in working with repairing electro-mechanical equipment in a manufacturing environment

  • At least 4 year experience working with mechanical and electrical tools to troubleshoot and do advanced repairs of equipment.

  • Prior experience working as either one of manufacturing technician, hands-on repairman, IT specialist, Automation Expert, mechanical technician, electrician, etc.

  • Prior experience communicating technical information and concepts to different audiences in a variety of formats

  • Experience with reading and deciphering technical documentation, parts diagrams, etc.

  • Excellent team player with proven examples of achievements through collaboration; this is a crucial part of this role

  • Solid understanding of basic IT Networking, taking backups of machines, restoring computers,

  • Bachelor’s degree or post-secondary Diploma with Mechanical or Electrical focus or equivalent

  • Proven ability to self-teach on equipment you are not formally trained on by accessing printed documentation (service manuals)

  • Experience with mechanical repairs, machine shop tools, key mechanical concepts and pneumatic systems

  • Must possess an understanding of the philosophy and application of Total Preventive Maintenance

  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook emailing, Calendar, Word, Powerpoint, and Excel.

  • Knowledge of task management and ability to prioritize your work.

  • Professional attitude, able to work well in a fast-paced environment, self-motivated, a quick-learner, with ability to receive direction and feedback positively

  • Ability to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity leveraging problem solving skills and a willingness to learn with only high-level direction

  • Experience with inventory management and control

  • Team-player with professional attitude, able to work well in a fast-paced environment, self-motivated, a quick-learner, with ability to receive direction and feedback positively

  • Organized with strong attention to detail, time management skills and a problem-solver

  • Working with other departments (Quality Assurance, New Product Introduction NPI, IT, and Logistics) to administer quality validations, ensure NPI processes followed, fulfill communication with logistics for shipping and receiving of engineering products.

  • Proven and demonstrated ability to develop strong and positive interpersonal connections with your colleagues, with other teams, and your superiors is critical to this role.

Schedule: 8 hours shifts, which may lead to overtime for some shifts / weeks. Schedule can vary depending on job needs. Hours will normally be between 9am-5pm, but may change as per business needs. May be required to change shifts occasionally to cover other shifts. Shifts are normally planned 2 weeks in advance, and regular start and stop times of shift are preferred to allow for stability in planning both for the employee and for the company.

Physical Environment: Manufacturing environment, concrete floors, HVAC controlled indoor climate, manufacturing machinery noise, forklifts and logistics machinery may be present in some locations in the site.

Travel: Travel is required in rare circumstances out of country for trainings or work at other sites, which are planned in advance

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Knowledge of industrial and safety regulations related to machinery such as OHSA regulations and electrical, building and fire codes

  • Formal education or training with embossing machinery (Datacard/Matica equipment)

  • Formal education or training with mailing and packaging equipment (Bell & Howell or Pitney Bowes)

  • Experience working in Card Personalization Center and it’s regulatory requirements

  • Experience capturing and reporting on Key Performance Indices related to Maintenance

  • Experience using Oracle or Other Inventory Management ERP system for order placing and inventory control

  • Experience coordinating work and project actions with vendors to their completion through follow-ups

  • Knowledge being able to read and review PLC, circuit logic, electrical repairs and assessments

  • Prior experience working with other departments (Quality Assurance, New Product Introduction NPI, IT, and Logistics) to administer quality validations, ensure NPI processes followed, fulfill communication with logistics for shipping and receiving of engineering products.

  • Demonstrated experience in floor equipment layout manipulation and implementation of new equipment

  • Knowledge of industrial and safety regulations related to machinery such as OHSA regulations and electrical, building and fire codes

  • Demonstrated ability to take complex business process challenges and lead a team to evolve to a future state so the process becomes an highly effective and efficient business process

  • Prior experience communicating pertinent and technical information to external customers and other stakeholders on a regular basis

  • Demonstrate experience in floor equipment layout manipulation and implementation of new equipment

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Faculty Relations Manager
description:
Overview:

The Faculty Relations Manager is a primary liaison with the faculty on two fronts: a) to ensure Co-op contributes to the academic mission of the faculty; and b) to provide account-like oversight to the faculty as a uWaterloo co-op employer. This role provides a senior-level single point of contact with faculty to create greater opportunity for strategic and value-added collaboration and partnering, and facilitates evolution toward uWaterloo as a "model" co-op employer.

 

This FRM role will support the Faculty of Environment.  

Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary "faceâ€ and liaison to Faculty for academic integration and co-op employment

  • Foster an open and transparent dialog between Co-op and the faculty
  • Identify and promote academic program and faculty co-op requirements
  • Engage with the Faculty to ensure contributions as appropriate to policy, strategy, new programs, and operational discussions/decisions
  • Own the experience of all faculty-based employers: academic, staff, and administrative
  • Optimize Faculty strategies to effectively manage co-op work terms
  • Ensure appropriate support for Faculty co-op and graduate hiring as per a faculty account plan

Consultation and Support for Initiatives For Student Success

  • Ensure consultation and support for initiatives (faculty or Co-op) for student success (e.g. criteria for jobs, duration of work terms, etc.), working with the Co-op Student Experience Manager
  • Lead Co-op engagement with faculty on program reviews and feasibility analyses

Lead development of jobs for new academic programs

  • Create smooth transition to account manager when first co-op student is hired
  • Monitor success of two work terms of new role through Account Manager and Student Advisor,

Provide overall leadership to the organization

  • Personally champion mission, vision and guiding principles and play a leadership role in bringing them to life
  • Provide leadership, direction and strategic planning for Co-op
  • Monitor business practices to ensure that Co-op has the appropriate practices and processes to work effectively internally and represent UW externally
  • Lead the development of new capabilities required by the introduction of new systems, tool or processes
  • Develop productive, collaborative working relationships across Co-op and uWaterloo
  • Lead the identification, development and implementation of projects to improve servicequality, relationships, stakeholder satisfaction, timeliness, staff capability and performance
  • Develop internal/external customer service standards, monitors satisfaction with service delivered and take action to restore and enhance service quality

Leverage Faculty Relationships

  • Leverage Faculty relationships to develop new employers outside UW
Qualifications:
  • University degree
  • 7 years of related experience, including experience in front-line or account management, and experience in academic settings, preferably working with faculty-level administration
  • Program/project management experience is an asset
  • Research planning and executing web-based research is an asset
  • Problem solving: The Faculty Relations Manager works with incomplete or poor quality data and information, assesses and integrates the needs and perspectives of multiple stakeholders, and drives from available information to actionable and innovative recommendations (e.g. new program definitions; relevance criteria for specific work terms in a sequence; methods and strategies for job development and employer relations)
  • This role involves unusual hours or schedules (e.g. flexible/extended work hours to meet changing priorities and pressing deadlines)
Vaccination Requirement Statement:

Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the Universityâ€™s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The Universityâ€™s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.    

 

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/    

 

 Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

 

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.

Equity Statement:

The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

 

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion.   As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, MÃ©tis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

 

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

 

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources atâ€¯

hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca

â€¯â€¯or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

____________________

What Weâ€™re Looking For

We are looking for an experienced social media specialist to join our content team. You will be responsible for developing Age of Unionâ€™s social media strategy, building brand awareness, and day-to-day managing our social media channels. Youâ€™ll work with a diverse team of global partners to create engaging â€œin the fieldâ€ content that inspires the world to become environmental changemakers. You will be an active participant in data collection and analyses to consistently improve our social media practices.

The successful candidate will be an excellent communicator, a diligent, creative writer, and a team player.

What youâ€™ll do

  • In collaboration with our Head of Content build and deliver a solid social media strategy via research, platform determination, bench marking, messaging and audience identification.
  • Generate, edit, publish and share high-quality written and visual content to build brand awareness, encourage meaningful connections, and inspire action.
  • Generate and perfect company pages within a variety of social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Youtube, Tiktok, etc.) to increase the visibility of companyâ€™s social content.
  • Moderate all user-generated content in line with the moderation policy for each community and stay up to date on audience interactions and engagement to develop dynamic communities on each platform.
  • Develop on-brand social media assets, sometimes using existing motion design templates.
  • Establish relationships with team members and global partners to highlight key stories, manage brand reputation, and coordinate cross-team alignment.
  • Continuously improve by capturing and analyzing the appropriate social metrics, insights, and best practices.
  • Staying up to date on emerging social media trends and tools.
  • Coaching internal team and partners to scale content creation and social media practices.

What youâ€™ll bring

  • Excellent critical thinking, interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills.
  • Proven social media experience demonstrating the ability to develop, pitch, and deliver social media strategies, increase brand awareness, and create engaging content.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in French and English.
  • Meticulous attention to detail when it comes to written and visual content.
  • Experience using analytics software.
  • Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
  • Excellent knowledge of social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitter and LinkedIn.

Even better if you have

  • Prior experience related to environmental conservation.
  • Social media graphic design skills
  • Interest in Web 3.0

Why work with us ?

Weâ€™re a small team and weâ€™re just starting but weâ€™re going places. Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to help a community of dedicated changemakers working to restore our dear mother earth. We understand we all need to have a healthy work-life balance, whatever your situation is youâ€™ll be able to choose your schedule and we offer great flexibility. Although we are based in Montreal, our team is fully remote at the moment, so you can work from anywhere. If you thrive in a collaborative and trusting environment this role is for you !

How to apply ?

  • Send us your CV examples of your work by clicking on the "Submit Application" button
  • Someone from our team will reach out to you to update you on your application

 

Diversity and inclusion are core to our culture. If you are a member of an underrepresented group, we strongly encourage you to apply.

 

 

 

À propos de Age of Union

Age of Union est une alliance environnementale à but non lucratif qui soutient et rend visible une communauté mondiale d'acteurs du changement travaillant sur le terrain pour protéger les espèces et les écosystèmes menacés de la planète.

Lancé en octobre 2021 par le leader technologique et militant écologiste Dax Dasilva à Montréal, au Canada, Age of Union cherche à allumer une flamme chez chaque personne grâce à des efforts de conservation qui résolvent des défis environnementaux critiques dans le monde et inspirent des changements à fort impact en montrant l'impact positif que chaque individu peut faire.

____________________

About Age of Union

Age of Union is a non-profit environmental alliance that supports and makes visible a global community of changemakers working on-the-ground to protect the planet's threatened species and ecosystems.

Launched in October 2021 by tech leader and environmental activist Dax Dasilva in Montreal, Canada, Age of Union seeks to ignite a flame within every person through conservation efforts that solve critical environmental challenges around the world and inspire high-impact change by showing the positive impact that every individual can make.

title: Rehabilitation Assistant
description:
We are excited to announce the opening of Golden Life’s newest location, Ocean Front Village, in the gorgeous Comox Valley! We are on track to open in Summer of 2022, and this will be our company’s first Village on Vancouver Island. We are excited to build an amazing team, and we are looking for exceptional, passionate individuals dedicated to providing an unparalleled experience for our residents.

We’re looking for a qualified Rehabilitation Assistantto join our new recreation team at Ocean Front Village in Courtenay, BC. This individual will work closely with our Occupational Therapist/Physical Therapist, and will be responsible for performing delegated treatments, following treatment protocols, and documenting outcomes.

The successful candidate will bring related experience in a senior care setting, completion of the required educational component, and a strong passion for providing high quality care and support for seniors.

Duties will include, but are not limited to:
  • Performs delegated duties such as implementing individual and group interventions and activities that improve or maintain functional abilities of patients.
  • Conducts individual and group therapeutic activities, such as therapeutic ambulation, wheelchair mobility training (manual and power), exercise classes, and individual prescribed exercises, to restore, improve, and maintain a patient’s functional ability.
  • As instructed, assists Therapist during direct treatment or during assessment sessions.
  • Reports observations on patient progress and condition to DOCC and other appropriate team members.
  • Supports Therapist in making, modifying, and adapting self-help devices and equipment, as requested.
  • Maintains records such as statistics, and inventories, and performs related duties by utilizing a personal computer, word processing software tools, and related equipment.
Our culture attracts proactive self-starters who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion, integrity, passion, and curiosity. If this resonates, maybe you’re the right person to join the Golden Life team.

The successful candidate will meet the following qualifications:
  • Successful completion of a recognized Kinesiology program.
  • Completion of PT (Physical Therapist) Aide Program through Ed2GO; Proof of enrollment will be accepted, as long as Program is completed within 3 months of start date.
  • A minimum of 6 months related experience.
  • Must possess current First Aid training.
  • Current CPR certification.
  • Valid Class 4 Unrestricted Driver’s License (successful candidate will be able to obtain License within probation period).
  • Strong conflict resolution, and relationship-building skills.
  • Exceptional ability to deal with resident in a caring and patient manner.
  • Capable of carrying out significant lifting, carrying, bending and reaching.
  • Clear Vulnerable Sector - Criminal Record Check.
  • Physician’s Waiver, negative TB Screening and Immunization record.
  • Able to provide proof of full and current COVID-19 vaccines.
What we offer you

At Golden Life Management Corporation, we are purpose-led. Our Philosophy is focused entirely upon providing the best possible quality of care to our residents and those we serve. We recognize that engaged employees are necessary to achieve our purpose and our Philosophy.

As a Golden Life Team member, you can expect to be treated with dignity and respect, to be challenged with your work, and to have the autonomy necessary to excel. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a voluntary retirement program with company contributions, for eligible employees.

Golden Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If this sounds attractive to you, please apply today!

description:
Why Crawford?:

Les gens qui prennent soin des gens. C'est si simple. Chez Crawford & Compagnie, nous traitons les assurÃ©s de nos clients comme les nÃ´tres, aidant Ã  restaurer et amÃ©liorer les vies, les entreprises et les communautÃ©s Ã  tous les stades du processus de gestion des sinistres. title: Construction Supervisor
description:
We know that we owe our success to our amazing team. This is why we offer top wages, excellent benefits, and a great work/life balance. Here at First Onsite, we work hard but also take the time to have fun. If you are as serious about your work as you are about enjoying the people you work with, we want to hear from you!


Position Summary:

The Site Supervisor will coordinate activities, resources, equipment and information and will keep the construction staff, and projects construction is working on and all related processes running smoothly. The Site Supervisor takes direction from the Construction Operations Manager and works toward optimizing Staff efficiency and completing projects within First Onsite acceptable levels. Focus on ensuring that the goals and needs of the Construction Department and First Onsite are being met and exceeded.

Responsibilities:

  • Reviews, schedules and oversees all In house Work from Project Managers.
  • Maintains a high level of Quality and Efficiency throughout the project i.e.
    • Ensures Demo Meets First Onsite Quality Standards
    • Produces Comprehensive Materials List for Repairs
    • Reviews and provides Revisions to Scope before work commences if required
    • Provides immediate direction and assistance to onsite crews
    • Meets scheduled completion timetables
  • Updates all parties involved on work progress and/or informing same of changes/additions to original work order or repair specifications.
  • Build, lead and deploy the best quality team to achieving the objectives of our corporate strategic plan.
  • Ensure that the company health and safety policies and procedures are followed for all First Onsite personnel and sub-contractors, including all branch personnel are up to date with all health and safety procedures and training and participates/conducts tail gate meetings relating to health and safety and work procedures when on site.
  • Maintains detailed project schedules which include administrative tasks for multiple sites.
  • Monitors Staff efficiency and effectiveness daily, review and authorise time sheets
  • Inspect progress and work quality during and post repairs assuring all Scope requirements are met; reports outcomes to the COM

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Xactimate Estimation / Awareness
  • Minimum 3 years experience with proven track record in construction Supervisor / foreman position with up to 25 reports, within the restoration/emergency (or a related) industry
  • Detailed understanding of reconstruction practices for property that has suffered water, wind, mould, fire and vandalism damages
  • Knowledge of building codes and electrical, or plumbing, or mechanical and related codes.
  • Knowledge of the laws and ordinances regulating building construction.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Computer skills required effectively use Word, Excel, and Outlook.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Service Specialist (Support Engineer) - 7286
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Role:

We are looking for a Service Specialist that will be involved in the current and future delivery support and maintenance of services. You will play a key role in assist customers both from technical and functional point of view.
The Service Management team is responsible for technical investigation, keeping customers updated and reporting potential software defects to Development teams. Technical Support also takes the lead in service restoration in the event of software or hardware failures, capacity planning and Business Continuity testing of the Hosted environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Responds to customers’ inquiries relating to technical and functional issues with our products through phone, email, and case management system. 
Track inquiry resolution progress. 
Communicates updates effectively and promptly to the client.
Builds up and maintains a knowledge of the software supported, including database structure and configuration files to assist in issue investigation.
Deals with unexpected events or failures which limit clients use of the supported systems.
Carries out application system checks, aiming to identify and resolve issues before they affect clients.
Develops strong working relationships with other departments and third party vendors to assist with the delivery of our service to clients.
Supports customers on testing new or changed products and services to ensure that they meet defined requirements.
Assists with releases and deployments of services components.
Participates in all the activities related to the IT security and cybersecurity with the aim of mitigating risk and supporting recovery programs for the area of responsibility. Runs system analysis to identify potential issues.
Adheres to "best practice" and department procedures for client communications, incident progression and investigation.
Participates in the team shift patterns and assists with weekend work and out of hours escalation when required.

Required skills, experience and qualifications:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical degree or equivalent work experience.
Have an enquiring mind with an analytical and proactive approach to problem solving, even when under pressure 
Good knowledge of Linux (and/or other Unix), and familiarity at the command line is preferred.
Good knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL language.
Knowledge of IT security and cybersecurity best practices.
Ability to troubleshoot and approach problem solving in a logical manner.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. 
A confident and professional manner.
Able to manage own time and a changing workload.
Co-operative approach to working with team members and other departments.
Able to view situations from a customer perspective and act accordingly. 
Willingness to work shifts.
Availability to work on weekends.

Preferred
Knowledge of financial industry is a plus.


About us:

We’re a diverse group of visionary innovators who provide trading and workflow automation software, high-value analytics, and strategic consulting to corporations, central banks, financial institutions, and governments. Founded in 1999, we’ve achieved tremendous growth by bringing together some of the best and most successful financial technology companies in the world.
•Over 2,000 of the world’s leading corporations, including 50% of the Fortune 500 and 30% of the world’s central banks, trust ION solutions to manage their cash, in-house banking, commodity supply chain, trading and risk.
•Over 800 of the world’s leading banks and broker-dealers use our electronic trading platforms to operate the world’s financial market infrastructure.
With over 10,000 employees and offices in more than 40 cities around the globe, ION is a rapidly expanding and dynamic group.
At ION, we offer careers that provide many opportunities: To invent. To design. To collaborate. To build. To transform businesses and empower people around the world to do more, faster and better than before. Imagine what you can do and experience. This is where you can do your best work.</section>

title: Network Design Lead
description:
Our client

One of the world's best pension investment funds undergoing major technology transformation and modernization

What's in it for you

Work on enterprise level IT team providing the most innovative, efficient, and secure solutions. Learn new technologies and tools as the area rapidly expands.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to create and maintain Network Infrastructure architecture and detailed designs (conceptual, logical, integration and physical).
  • Conduct needs assessments, identify future capabilities, and develop future state Network Infrastructure architecture with roadmaps.
  • Help to develop and business cases for identified needs, proposed roadmaps and future state Network infrastructure; define Network Infrastructure standards and; evaluate existing and proposed deviations from current standards and presents recommendations to stakeholders;
  • Proactively identify opportunities to convert manual Infrastructure and operations to automation; proactively identify, quantify and qualify risks in Network Infrastructure and identify strategies to address the risks and controls; ensure automation is designed and built into the Network Infrastructure solutions.
  • Provide hands-on implementation to validate designs and to assist with Network Infrastructure build and supports IT teams, operations and other stakeholders with expertise to develop, build, maintain and operate Network Infrastructure.
  • Actively participate in agile scrum practices, such as daily standups, backlog refinement, planning and sprint retrospectives
  • Provide guidance and knowledge to team members, and promote efficiency, productivity, innovations, and knowledge-sharing across multi-functional teams
  • Lead and contribute to design sessions, and support the community of network subject matter experts, write wiki articles and participate in issue and team retrospectives
  • Architect and design network and security improvements in public and private cloud
  • Develop standards, patterns, and practices to improve the network services
  • Manage technical operations spanning multiple systems and technologies, triage and drive speedy resolution of operational issues
  • Design and test network infrastructure connectivity failure and restoration architecture considering specific failures or network event scenario
  • Maintain and troubleshoot a large hybrid network infrastructure
·

Qualifications

  • 7-10+ years of experience on Hybrid Network (Cloud and on premise[routing/switching], UDR, Wi-Fi, network management)
  • Proven track record in Data Center Infrastructure Security, Networking, Identity and Access Management in a global environment
  • Azure and AWS cloud and private infrastructure, SD WAN (cisco or otherwise) Cisco based routing and switching, 5+ years of architecture/design
  • 5+ years' experience of network architecture and design and implementing complex network infrastructures
  • 5+ years' experience leading technology roadmap, facilitating innovation and adoption of next generation technologies in an architectural practice in Networking
  • Excellent knowledge of network design patterns
  • Extensive knowledge on security Infrastructure (NG Firewalls, IPS, Advanced Threat Protection, AV, AAA, Logging etc.)
  • Experience in leading delivery on major features in a complex environment
  • Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, with an ability to take end-to-end ownership and drive an outcome
  • A thought-leader in the networking space who can clearly express ideas, concepts and architecture to all levels in the team and to stakeholders
  • Experience with DevOps work would be considered an asset
  • Possess knowledge in Infrastructure as a Code using Ansible, Terraform, etc.
  • Skilled in scripting / automation practices
  • Understands the benefits of automation, has experience with automating repetitive work
Assets

  • (Software-defined Access / SDWAN (Silver Peak) / DC (ACI,F5,Infoblox,Fortinet,FirePower,NSX-T)/SASE/SWG-Zscaler) and UC (Cloud PBX/Hosted SBC/UCaaS/CPaaS)
  • Network Architect or Expert/Professional certification level
  • Microsoft Azure or AWS Solutions Architect or Expert certification level (Proficiency with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, GCP)
  • Technology Security Engineer certification level
  • Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) certification
  • Networking CCNP, CCIE (Routing Switching)
  • Azure Administrator Associate
  • DevOps Engineer Expert
  • AWS Certified Advanced Networking - Specialty

title: Team Lead, IT Operations
description:
Are you looking for a position to lead a collaborative, fast-paced, and fun team? Do you believe customer service is an essential part of IT? If you answered yes, our IT Operations Team Lead position could be the perfect role for you. Apply now!

As an Team Lead, IT Operations you: 

  • Implement technology solutions for Plan Group, ensuring consistency with overall technology standards, strategy, and operational requirements
  • Assists the team in prioritizing, researching, and resolving requests and incidents
  • Troubleshoots production issues by identifying the root cause, and implementing sound technical resolutions on time
  • Seeks to identify and implement measurable improvements to reduce the meantime to restore services and ensure operational resiliency
  • Develop, implement, and govern Key Performance Indicators (KPI) dashboards, report trends, and drive the effort to improve infrastructure services
  • Develops, updates, and recommends policies, standard operating procedures, and support documentation
  • Ensure technical solutions have core design principles of scalability, maintainability, and security before implementation
  • Document technical process flows and architectures with detailed technical specifications
  • Leverage continuous improvement methods to expand and improve upon automation efforts
  • Plan, organize, schedule, and supervise the day-to-day IT operations support activities, including troubleshooting, technical service issues, and installations
  • Help establish, measure, monitor, and maintain the team's ability to meet or exceed Service Level Agreements (SLA)
  • In partnership with Security, provide technical advice, counsel, and instruction in collecting and analyzing technical data associated with security requests
  • Embraces learning and development to improve technical skills of self and team yearly
  • Provide leadership and coaching to IT teams
  • Follow all security policies and procedures

Our ideal candidate has:

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience required
  • 5+ years of related experience in the implementation, management, and maintenance of information technology infrastructure and IT systems, including cloud architectures, server technologies, and network technologies (LANs, WANs, VOIP)
  • 5+ years of advanced Microsoft experience with Hyper-V, Server 2012 or higher
  • 2+ years of networking (TCP/IP, LDAP, DHCP, UDP, HTTP etc)
  • 1+ years of Microsoft O365 administration
  • Solid leadership capabilities and the ability to communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders across multiple disciplines
  • Strong technical understanding to identify opportunities and overcome any technical obstacles
  • An understanding of standard IT terms, processes, and procedures
  • Strong organizational skills, with particular emphasis on attention to detail
  • Experience architecting, securing, and operating Azure Cloud Services an asset
  • ITIL v3 or v4 Certification
  • Security+ Certification
  • Azure certifications an asset
