We have instituted the ability to flex hours that ensures team members get the time they need for personal matters while still being able to work full time.', 'Monthly cross-training opportunities to advance your career', 'Detail-oriented', 'Paid training', 'Referral program', 'Take pride when your team completes mitigation projects', 'Great culture and team dynamic', 'Self-managing and time management skills', 'Be part of a team of hardworking individuals serving others within your community', 'Maintain clean, properly stocked, and organized trucks along with all company equipment.', 'Have the ability to work nights/weekends and overtime, if needed', 'Assist other team members when needed and foster a positive working relationship with other departments.']

title: Sr. Systems and Network Administrator
description:
The IT Operations team at GS1 Canada is looking for a Senior Network Administrator to join the team. In this role, you will design, implement, support, and maintain the organization’s IT Infrastructure, including servers, operating systems, storage systems, data/voice systems, LAN, WAN, VPN, backup systems, business and productivity applications. You will also support cybersecurity remediation activities for the organization. This is a critical role for our team and you will collaborate with IT Support analysts, Cybersecurity Analysts and Engineers, Developers, and other cross-functional departments across GS1 Canada.

GS1 Canada is a neutral, not-for-profit organization that develops and maintains global standards for efficient business communication. At GS1 Canada, it is in our DNA to do the right thing. We believe in the power of standards to transform the way we live and work. We believe in the uniqueness, drive, and passion of our people to carry our values and vision forward. We are a team of friendly and passionate people, optimistic about our capabilities. Together with our people-centered culture and innovative solutions, our vision is to become a strategic partner that inspires, leads, and enables best-in-class supply chain standards.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Support the enterprise network infrastructure, LAN/WAN, SDWAN, Wireless, QoS, Routers and Switches, Windows Servers
  • Work closely with the Cyber Security Team to ensure devices are adequately configured, protected, and remediated
  • Administer Next Generation Firewall appliances, VPN, SIEM and anti-virus/antimalware systems
  • Installing, configuring, managing, and maintaining network monitoring and alerting tools
  • Support and maintenance of backup and restore infrastructure
  • Create technical documentation and training
  • Identify opportunities and recommend solutions and applications to enhance process efficiency
  • Plan, implement, operate, and optimize the IT infrastructure in local and remote environments following ITIL/ITSM best practices and methodologies
  • Lead technical discussions, work collaboratively with others, and communicate effectively with customers and team members
  • Work closely with network infrastructure vendors and solution providers for the delivery of their services to the GS1 organization along with costs/vendor management
  • Supports industry best practices; researches and recommends new technologies, standards, processes, policies, and procedures
  • Ensure projects have appropriate stakeholder involvement, include clear and attainable scopes, deliverables and timelines, and are well executed and managed
  • Provides on-site IT support for emergency response drills and incidents
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Information Technology or Computer Science.
  • 7-10 years technical knowledge with experience in system and network administration, and/or computer security in integrated computing environments
  • Strong understanding and practical experience with network and servers’ technologies: routing protocols, DHCP, DNS, LAN/WAN, Access Switches (wired and WIFI), FTP, SSH, IPSeC, SNMP, SCCM, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Intune, Next Generation Firewalls
  • Technical experience with Windows server operating systems, Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, OneDrive and Microsoft Office 365 technologies
  • CCNA, CCNP, MCSE, VCP designations an asset
  • Experience implementing and supporting Enterprise Infrastructure Technologies and Platforms including VMware Private Cloud, Cisco, SDWAN, Office 365.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and professionalism to develop and maintain collaborative working relationships and partnerships with stakeholders and colleagues at all levels.
  • Superior, proven oral and written communications skills, skilled at making presentations to internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong interpersonal and organizational skills that can be applied to a solution-oriented environment
  • Capacity to manage and deliver multiple priorities to competing and sometimes conflicting commitments quickly and effectively
  • Exhibited and proven leadership skills in motivating and educating other team members with a demonstrable track record in managing a high-performance team

GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team at humanresources@gs1ca.org if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

title: ServiceNow Developer (Remote Work)
description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.


About Infrastructure Services:

The Cloud Infrastructure Services Global Business Line is Capgemini's consulting and infrastructure build-and-run provisioning offering and supports the group's cloud-based services. As part of the integrated cloud offering from Capgemini, Cloud Infrastructure Services delivers a broad range of cloud services to build and support the hybrid cloud estate by encompassing the leading public cloud players and leading private cloud technologies. With EUR 1.5 billion annual revenue, Cloud Infra Services helps clients virtualize and optimize their IT estates through infrastructure outsourcing services such as data center, helpdesk, network support, and service integration and service maintenance support. Our other services also include infrastructure transformation services-helping clients consolidate and migrate entire workloads and data centers.


Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.


Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini


Activities

• Create or Update ServiceNow Discovery design documentation if required

• Create agile stores for SN Discovery or CMDB development.

• ServiceNow Development services with focus on ServiceNow Discovery to ServiceNow CMDB tables, which may include one of the following,


Required Experience

• Experience in working to restore OOTB Functionality from Customized ServiceNow instances


Nice to Have Experience

• Experience or Micro Certification in ServiceNow Flow Designer

• Experience doing ServiceNow Development in a Financial Service Organization


Job: _Infrastructure_


Organization: _CIS CAN P&C_


Title: _ServiceNow Developer (Remote Work)_


Location: _CAN-NS-Dartmouth_


Requisition ID: _058855_


Other Locations: _CA-Nova Scotia, CA-Quebec, CA-British Columbia, CA-New Brunswick, CA-Ontario_

title: Accounts Payable Clerk
description:
At First Onsite our passion for what we do starts with our people and who we hire. People are our "Superpower". We are more than just a property restoration and reconstruction powerhouse; we are a team of people who do good in the world and make a difference every day.

Amazing careers happen here.

So, if you are ready to make a career move and you want to make a difference in our ability to serve our clients, you may become our new Accounts Payable Specialist!

A DAY IN THE LIFE AS THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SPECIALIST

Every day our Accounts Payable specialist will work closely as part of the National Finance team and provide timely and accurate clerical support in accounts payable.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • A passion for customer service and willing to support and collaborate with team members in a timely and professional manner
  • Experience coding and processing of accounts payable invoices
  • Experience with WSIB and HST payments, investigation and responding to calls, holdbacks, and releases
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, Excel and Word
  • Proficient computer skills with an ERP / OCR software
  • Capable of taking initiative and can work independently with minimal direction

We appreciate that experience and qualifications come in many forms, and we are committed to adding new ideas to our team - so if you have a passion for customer service and numbers, please consider applying. Our recruitment process centres around getting to know you better, so we can gather and grow the best talent in the industry.

title: Specialist, Technology Operations
description:
Specialist, Technology Operations

Purpose of the Role
Reporting to the Director IT Technology Operations, the Specialist, Technology Operations will be expected to execute the ongoing activities and procedures required to manage and maintain the Firm’s messaging infrastructure to deliver and support IT services at the agreed service levels.

The focus of the role is on the support of Exchange Online, Office 365, Microsoft Exchange Messaging legacy platforms, Microsoft InTune, Mimecast email protection platform and a hybrid Microsoft Active Directory environment. The Technology Operations Specialist will actively consult and routinely participate in the technology projects and initiatives from concept through to implementation and operation.

Working closely with the IT Support Team, Director of Cyber Security and Infrastructure Operations and the Senior Specialist, the Technology Operations Specialist will ensure that the performance of the infrastructure consistently meets or exceeds the expectations of our professionals and their clients.

The Technology Operations Specialist supports the Firm’s initiatives through the delivery of services, tracking KPIs, managing vendor relationship and maintaining the required level of confidentiality, integrity and availability of our systems.

Key Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of this role are:
  • Assist in the design, management, implementation, administration, architectural design, development, customization and integration of email and mobile solutions utilizing a variety of vendor platforms.
  • Troubleshooting and optimization of email performance
  • Provide email maintenance, backup, restore and recovery as needed
  • End to end support of the Mimecast email security gateway
  • Support and monitor of the Exchange Online and Office 365 services including OneDrive, Team and other related services
  • Secure the messaging environment through implementation and support of security features including, the management of encryption certificates, security policies and email gateway protection services.
  • Support the Cyber Security team in the management of all Data Loss Prevention (DLP) messaging components to minimize the risk of data leakage through the email platform.
  • Manage other third party mail integration platforms such as Rightfax, Cisco services and any other integrated APIs.
  • Maintain the high availability services of the messaging environment to the Firm’s expectation
  • Install, configure and maintain messaging and related software in production and non- production environment to meet the requirements of projects and other initiatives
  • Document and maintain final system configurations and installation procedures for all related environments to maintain system and configuration currency
  • Performs regular technology currency updates, maintenance fixes, vendor supplied patches and other maintenance activities based on established procedures and standards required to support the IT infrastructure
  • Assist in the analysis and resolution of customer or project issues and inquiries
  • Provide troubleshooting on hardware/software/network problems
  • Work interactively with Help Desk and User Support team members to expedite the resolution messaging and mobile related issues.
  • Respond to Help Desk tickets as appropriate (e.g. 2nd level support).
  • Manage and execute daily service and support tickets as assigned.
  • Perform operating system patches and software upgrades, and routine platform configurations
  • Obtain and maintain business relationships with key vendors to support the IT Infrastructure
  • Proactively research and maintain knowledge of a range of products and processes within the supported environments and the industry.
  • Continuously improve the delivery and support of the services in scope
  • Support the related ISO 27001 messaging and mobile platform requirements
  • Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation when required
  • Create and distribute management reports, KPIs and KRI as required
  • Maintain consistent, quality documentation to meet ongoing operations and business continuity requirements.
Leadership:
  • Manage or act as a technical resource for infrastructure related tasks, for security related tasks, for projects and to assist with solving complex issues as requested
  • Develop and maintain a positive team culture among team members and peers
  • Plans daily work routine to ensure that the team and Firm’s objectives and met
  • Ensure proper escalations processes are followed for operations and projects
  • Provide recommendations on process and technology changes to benefit the Business Practices and the IT departments.
  • Recommend technical solutions to meet current and future business needs
  • Support infrastructure upgrades and implementations related to relevant infrastructure
  • Provide technical guidance and training to IT Support and Help Desk on related services
  • Develop future strategies for Exchange online and Office 365 products and services
  • Collaborate with the training team to evaluate and drive adoption of new capabilities for Exchange online, Office 365 and related tools, services and systems.
  • Support the Firm’s strategic plans

Required Skills
  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
  • A minimum of 3 years relevant work
  • Enterprise certifications such as:
    • Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS) + Exchange/Exchange Online and Office 365
  • Enterprise Mobility Management Certificate (such as InTune)
  • Significant Experience managing Exchange in a hybrid environment (Exchange on premise, Exchange online /Office 365)
  • Experience migrating to Office 365 and implementing/operating a hybrid environment.
  • Experience with the following technologies: SharePoint, SharePoint Online, Azure, Azure Active Directory, Mimecast
  • Complete knowledge of mail flow and its related component across Microsoft Exchange and Exchange online
  • Excellent PowerShell and scripting skills to manage a hybrid Exchange environment
  • Experience with mail archiving integrated tools
  • Experience managing Enterprise Backup (cloud and on premise) in a messaging environment using tools such as CommVault Enterprise Backup
  • Strong skills managing RightFax
  • Experience with a broad scope of infrastructure, technology, tools, processes and procedures, as well as broader IT and relevant business issues.
  • Ability to work with other technologists on complex, highly visible and diverse infrastructure projects or issues.
  • Experience in building and managing infrastructures and platforms that support systems/solutions which are highly secure, highly available and high performing
  • Experience working in an ORION SolarWinds platform or similar NoC alerting platform
  • Deploying and managing high-availability solutions (clustering, load balancing, auto-failover designs) in an onsite and cloud messaging environment
  • Experience working with Enterprise Data Loss Prevention platform and features in a messaging environment
  • Fluent in Active Directory and AD Cloud environment
  • Fluent managing all Windows Server platforms and associated services such as DNS
  • Fluent managing security updates through SCCM/WSUS
  • Solid IT Service Management experience

title: Administrateur de systèmes
description:
Administrateur de systèmes


Systems Administrator

Certifications
Hold a VMWare Certified Professional certification
Microsoft certification: Windows Server Hybrid Administrator Associate
Experience
"5 years of relevant experience as a Systems Administrator with Microsoft Windows and VMWare and have participated in at least 2 projects deploying and optimizing VMWare virtualized environments or Microsoft enterprise tools with WSUS and SCCM
- Project involving the deployment and optimization of VMWare virtualized environments (3 points);
- Project dealing with the deployment of patches and updates via Microsoft WSUS and SCCM environment tools (3 points);
- Project dealing with the migration of Windows servers (2 points);
- Project with a value of at least $50,000 (2 points)."
Key Tasks
"Component 3:
- Systems Administrator

These services include the duties required to perform operations related to the management of the City's servers and computer systems; ensure the quality, performance and continuity of service of the infrastructure
infrastructure.

Specifically, the main tasks to be performed will be as follows:
1. Participate in project level deliverables of the three-year capital plan (ITP) for server and storage infrastructure replacement and upgrades;
2. Server maintenance (system upgrades and Windows server migration);
3. Participate in the monitoring and resolution of technology infrastructure incidents;
4. Administration of mostly Windows servers and some Linux servers;
5. Documentation of existing and newly implemented processes;
6. Backup and restore management;
7. Management of active directory and its components (GPO, DNS, etc.);
8. Operation of the VMWare virtualization environment and solution;
9. Deploying patches via the existing tools WSUS, SCCM and/or others;
10. Monitoring of the computer systems and the computer environment.

The contractor will also be required to perform server migrations, patching, backups and restores with Windows servers in a VMWare environment. He will be required to use enterprise tools such as WSUS, SCCM and PowerShell. He/she will have to work with Active Directory and its components (DHCP, DNS, Domain Services Replication, user attributes, etc.).

The contractor will also have to participate in the implementation of the rules required to control applications, manage IPS, anti-virus, URL filtering and threat emulation. The majority of firewalls will need to be configured in clustered mode. Site-to-site VPN configuration setup and optimization tasks will also be required."


Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.




Administrateur de systèmes


Certifications
Détenir une certification « VMWare Certified Professional »
Détenir une certification Microsoft : Windows Server Hybrid Administrator Associate
Expérience
"5 années dexpérience pertinente en tant quadministrateur(-trice) de système avec Microsoft Windows et VMWare et avoir participé à au moins 2 projets de déploiement et doptimisation des environnements virtualisés VMWare ou des outils dentreprise de Microsoft avec WSUS et SCCM
Projet portant le déploiement et loptimisation des environnements virtualisés VMWare (3 points);
Projet portant sur le déploiement de correctifs et de mises à jour via les outils de lenvironnement Microsoft WSUS et SCCM (3 points);
Projet portant sur la migration de serveurs Windows (2 points);
Projet ayant une valeur dau moins 50 000 $ (2 points)."
Principales tâcches
"Volet 3:
Administrateur de systèmes

Ces services comprennent les tâches requises pour assumer les opérations relatives à la gestion des serveurs et des systèmes informatiques de la ville; voir à la qualité, la performance et la continuité de service des infrastructures
technologiques.

Plus spécifiquement, les principales tâches à accomplir seront les suivantes :
1. Participation à des livrables au niveau des projets du plan triennal d'immobilisation (PTI) pour le remplacement et la mise à niveau des infrastructures de serveurs et de stockage;
2. Maintenance des serveurs (mises à jour des systèmes et migration de serveurs Windows);
3. Participer au monitoring et à la résolution des incidents dinfrastructure technologiques;
4. Administration de serveurs Windows en grande majorité et de quelques serveurs Linux;
5. Documentation des processus existants et nouvellement mis en uvre;
6. Gestion des sauvegardes et des restaurations;
7. Gestion dactive directory et ses composantes (GPO, DNS, etc.);
8. Exploitation de l'environnement et la solution de virtualisation VMWare;
9. Déploiement de correctif via les outils en place WSUS, SCCM et/ou autres;
10. Surveillance des systèmes informatiques et de l'environnement informatique.

Le cocontractant devra également faire des migrations de serveurs, mettre en place des correctifs, faire des sauvegardes et des restaurations avec des serveurs Windows dans un environnement VMWare. Il devra utiliser des outils d'entreprise tels que WSUS, SCCM et PowerShell. Il devra travailler avec Active Directory et ses composantes (DHCP, DNS, Réplication des services domaines, attributs utilisateurs, etc.).

Le cocontractant devra également participer à la mise en place des règles requise pour contrôler les applications, gérer ce qui touche lIPS, les anti-virus, le filtrage des URL et lémulation de menaces. La majorité des pares-feux devront être configurés en mode « clusters ». Des tâches de mise en place et doptimisation de configuration VPN sites à sites seront également demandées"










Donnez un élan à votre carrière.

Le secteur des technologies de linformation (TI) connaît une période extraordinaire. La transformation numérique des organisations continue de saccélérer, et CGI est au premier plan de ce changement. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leur démarche numérique et offrons à nos professionnels des opportunités de carrière stimulantes.

La réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et lengagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture dactionnaire-propriétaire ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.

Joignez-vous à nous pour prendre part à la croissance de lune des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de services en technologies de linformation (TI) et en gestion des processus daffaires au monde.

Pour en savoir davantage à propos de CGI : www.cgi.com.

Les candidatures non sollicitées provenant de cabinets de recrutement ne seront pas retenues.

CGI favorise léquité en matière demploi. De plus, CGI sengage à offrir des accommodements aux personnes handicapées, conformément à la législation provinciale. Veuillez nous indiquer si vous vivez avec un handicap nécessitant la mise en place daccommodements raisonnables dans le cadre de notre processus de recrutement, nous collaborerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

title: Intermediate Hydrogeologist - (Job Number: CAL00YR)
description:
Intermediate Hydrogeologist

Company: Advisian
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Calgary
Job: Environmental<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: Apr 11, 2022
Unposting Date: May 12, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Principal Hydrogeologist

Intermediate Hydrogeologist


Advisian, Worley Group


Calgary, Cold Lake, Edmonton, Alberta


Advisian is the independent consulting business line of the Worley Group with more than 2,000 people in 19 countries. We provide solutions for clients across a range of industries, including ports and marine terminals, renewable energy, mining, and onshore and offshore oil and gas. As part of one of the worldrsquo;s largest engineering firms, we continue to push boundaries and extend our capabilities globally. Worley is a company that prides itself on providing safe and high-quality services that exceed our customerrsquo;s expectations, which is why we manage some of the world#39;s leading projects.


This is a full-time position located in one of our Alberta offices. Our Groundwater Practice within the Water Service Line is seeking an energetic, dynamic and motivated mid-level hydrogeologist with strong technical and communication skills who is eager to join a growing group of professional hydrogeologists. The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 yearsrsquo; experience in consulting hydrogeology, excellent time management and priority setting skills, flexibility, and sound interpersonal skills. The successful candidate will carry out varied hydrogeologic field and office assignments requiring a familiarity of a range of groundwater projects, including participating in project planning, as well as field execution and coordination, data analysis, and reporting, under the guidance of Senior and Principal Hydrogeologists.


Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities

      • Record, evaluate and interpret geologic/hydrogeologic (environmental) data, prepare technical reports, work plans, and conduct analysis and interpretation of findings for hydrogeological characterization and assessment.
      • Task mangement and safe execution of groundwater field programs, including groundwater monitoring; supervision of contractors on site; drilling, borehole logging and monitoring well installations; and tracking and reporting on field activities.
      • Coordinate and manage subcontractors to ensure safe completion of site activities.
      • Provide technical support for a variety of projects by working with subject matter experts to apply and develop knowledge and skills in areas that focus on groundwater resources, including physical and chemical hydrogeology, groundwater permitting, groundwater remediation and restoration, hydrogeological assessments, groundwater resources and sustainability, and environmental impact assessment.
      • The preferred candidate will take initiative and possess excellent communication and writing skills, with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with excellent time-management skills.
      • Have a strong desire to develop as a consultant (team player, eagerness to learn and grow, self-starter that takes initiative, is adaptable, and provides a high quality of work).
      • Be detail-oriented, able to follow instructions, and communicate with staff to understand assignments or seek clarification as necessary.
      • Able/keen to build and main strong relationships with key clients with respect to their technical area and the broader business objectives in their regions.
      • Endeavor to understand client needs and how the project relates to other elements of the client#39;s organization and to other projects.
      • Contribute to identify and develop new business opportunities.

Qualifications

      • Diploma or Bachelorrsquo;s degree (preferred) in hydrogeology, geology, or related discipline
      • Minimum 5 years of demontrated experience in environmental/engineering/water resources consulting.
      • Experience in the design and execution of drilling projects (mud rotary, sonic, auger, direct push), including planning, coordination, logging, and well design.
      • Experience in the field executing well sampling programs utilizing traditional and alternative sampling methods (i.e. no-purge, low flow, and dissolved gas sampling).
      • Ability to work primarily in a rugged, physically demanding field environment.
      • Demonstrated experience in aquifer testing programs, including planning and execution of pumping tests.
      • Experience with in-situ operations and thermal mobilization regulation would be considered an asset.
      • Excellent organizational skills and be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously, and under pressure.
      • Strong commitment to safety, including following established Health and Safety protocols.
      • Demonstrated focus on continual improvement, including identification of areas for improvement and implementation of actions.
      • Practical knowledge of working outdoors and mechanical aptitude are considered assets.
      • Experience with project management and client liason would be considered an asset.
      • Candidates must pocess a valid Class 5 full driverrsquo;s licence with a clean driving record.

Advisian (a part of Worley) offers an excellent remuneration amp; benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic, and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within the US, Canada, and overseas.


We strive to be an industry leader in health, safety and environmental performance. Our vision is to achieve zero harm to people and assets, and zero environmental incidents. We select people who share our values, beliefs and commitment to this vision and who demonstrate the expected behaviours, competencies and performance associated with their prospective roles within the company.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Worley operating as Advisian is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Vision Software Engineer (Product Development)
description:
LMI Technologies, recognized as one of Canadaâ€™s Best Workplaces, is a medium-sized technology company built on a culture of openness, respect and professional excellence. At LMI our staff work passionately toward the common goal of designing and delivering innovative 3D machine vision solutions to OEMs and System Integrators working in industrial factory automation around the world. The result of this teamwork is high-performance, easy-to-implement and cost-effective 3D sensor technologies that deliver the best results in even the most challenging 3D inline inspection applications.

What will you do as a Vision Software Engineer (Product Development)?

LMI is seeking a software engineering or computer science graduate with 5 years of proven developer experience who has the desire and skill set to design machine vision sensors. You will work in a multi-disciplinary, multi-platform, engineering team (software, electrical, mechanical/optical) that develops new sensor products and supporting infrastructure (manufacturing and test equipment). The ideal candidate will have a passion for leading edge technology, out of the box thinking, and can work well autonomously yet still communicate effectively with a close-knit group of about 10 engineers. 

The Sensor Software Engineer will work in the R&D team and report to the Software Engineering Manager.

  • Design and develop 3D acquisition algorithms for our sensors to produce 3D data from images.
  • Develop components of the sensor calibration pipeline.
  • Characterize and validate prototype sensor performance and integrate final designs with customers. 
  • Design and develop manufacturing software tools required to build the sensors and control key component performance (e.g. software tasks for focusing and aligning cameras/lasers/projectors, quantifying and adjusting sensor sensitivity, etc.).
  • Perform frequent peer code reviews.
  • Demonstrate ownership and leadership  - use your experience and skill to help others in the team to grow, and help drive projects to completion.
  • Potential in becoming a scrum master overseeing an Agile team within the Sensor Software group
  • Proactively contribute to and implement continuous improvement initiatives. 

What do you need to be successful?

  • Degree / Diploma in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent.
  • 5 years work experience in a disciplined software development environment producing deliverable code.
  • Solid knowledge of C/C and C# programming using Microsoft Visual Studio
  • Experience with 3D metrology or computer vision (object detection, image restoration, scene reconstruction, etc., but excluding machine learning)is required.
  • Excellent understanding of object oriented programming
  • Excellent understanding of commonly used data structures and algorithms (lists, trees, sorting, binning, etc.).
  • Excellent understanding of math and statistics.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication. 
  • Solid understanding of memory management, threading/synchronization, networking.
  • Proficient with commonly used scripting languages.
  • Previous leadership experience (as part of a project or team) is an asset
  • Experience developing for a manufacturing automation environment is an asset.

How to submit your interest?

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity and working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, please submit your application to our Human Resources team in confidence by clicking the â€œApply Nowâ€ button.

While we appreciate your interest in LMI very much, we are only able to respond to candidates selected for further consideration. We look forward to talking to you about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career!

Why being inclusive is important to us?

At LMI Technologies, we are an Equal Opportunity employer and we value the diversity of the people we hire and serve. We strive to build and grow our team that fosters variety in backgrounds, perspectives, experiences and skills. We embrace inclusiveness in our workplace, so we can utilize each personâ€™s talents and strengths.

If you are interested in working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, we invite you to apply and talk about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career. 

#LMISJ

We ensure you, once you complete your application, your information is safe with us. To learn more about how we use your personal data, please review our Privacy Policy (https://lmi3d.com/privacy-policy).

title: Manager, CSC, Incident and Problem Management
description:
Overview:

We currently searching for an experienced Manager of CSC, Incident and Problem Management to join the KUBRA IT team. â€‹As the Managerof CSC, Incident and Problem Management, you will be responsible for evolving our current processes to the next level by identifying opportunities in our existing ones. At KUBRA, we genuinely believe in working with teams. You will be collaborating with various parts of the organization in defining, documenting and enhancing processes, and drive adoption of the overall Incident and Problem Management processes. You will have a chance to work with various internal teams including Network Infrastructure, Information Security, and Client Solutions just to name a few. Great interpersonal skills are crucial to achieve this. The Client Services Centre team (CSC) will report directly to into this role to maximize the success of the implementation of the Incident and Problem Management strategiesset forth.

What you get to do every day:
  • Lead the team in achieving established goals and departmental objectives.
  • Accomplish staff results by communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results; coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; developing, coordinating, and enforcing systems, policies, procedures, and productivity standards.
  • Foster an environment that emphasizes trust, open communication, creative thinking, and cohesive team effort.
  • Front line support during incidents, ensuring incident process is followed, external communications are completed and available to address clientconcerns during any outage.
  • Review and participate in the Daily Status Review ensuring appropriate root cause, business impact and next steps are documentedfollowing a Major Incident.
  • Oversee the day-to-day activities within the Problem Management Processes.  
  • Lead the team in achieving established goals and departmental objectives.
  • Review and participate in the Daily Status Review ensuring appropriate root cause, business impact and next steps are documented following a Major Incident.  
  • Responsible for governing and leading problems throughout the Problem lifecycle per the Problem Management process.  
  • Produce accurate reporting of business impacts, service restoration actions, ownership of high business impacting incidents, problem trends and risks, both operationally and against capability Key Performance Indicators. Develop and maintain process and procedures for consumption of the Incident & Problem Management capability, for all Key Work Partners.    
What kind of person should you be?:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and working knowledge in the various stages of ITIL  
  • Excellent interpersonal skills  
  • Excellent organizational skills    
What skills do you need?:
  • University degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field and /or Proven technical experiences
  • 8-10 years of experience in IT and business/industry with strong I&O and process experience (ITSM, IT PMO and ITIL)
  • 7+ years of Problem Management / leadership responsibilities  
  • 7+ years of experience in managing Incidents, Major Incidents and Problems within an ITIL framework  
  • Experience with ITIL (Incident, Problem, Change / Release Management, ITAM, CMDB)  
  • Proven and demonstrated track record in progressive and higher roles with a strong potential to progress in career into senior management organizational roles.  
  • Considered an asset - Understanding or experience with technical aspects of ITSM implementations ServiceNow such as JavaScript, XML, HTML, LDAP, and MS Active Directory
What can you expect from us?:
  • Award-winning culture that fosters growth, diversity and inclusion for all
  • Paid day off for your birthday
  • Access to LinkedIn learning courses
  • Continued education with our education reimbursement program
  • Flexible schedules
  • Free unlimited access to our refreshment stations (fully stocked with tea, coffee and other beverages)
  • Two paid days for volunteer opportunities

 

We are a fast-growing and dynamic company offering customer experience management solutions to some of the largest utility, insurance and government entities across North America. Our portfolio of meter-to-cash and outage communication solutions includes billing and payment, mapping, mobile apps and proactive customer communications solutions for customers. With more than 1 billion customer experiences annually, we have the ability to provide performance-driven value to more than 550 clients every day.

 

Our office is small enough to allow creative individuals to flourish, yet large enough to provide long-term stability. We place a tremendous amount of responsibility on our team members to be productive, focused and self-motivated. We offer a casual work environment, competitive compensation and a stellar benefits program.

 

KUBRA is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. We will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: Healthcare Research Writer
description:
Who We Are

Prenuvo is a fast growing health tech company specializing in whole body MRI screening.

At Prenuvo, we believe that everyone should have the insights and information they need to make informed decisions about their health. Our goal is to help people live happier, healthier, and longer lives through early detection and unparalleled clarity into their health. To us, success means that our members and their families can spend more time focusing on what truly matters: enjoying life.

We are transforming the medical paradigm from reactive to proactive. Early detection is more than the key to a better outcome and greater life expectancy, itâ€™s a pathway to overall peace of mind. When it comes to health, knowledge is power and Prenuvo wants to put that powerâ€”in its most innovative and in-depth formâ€”in your hands.

Help reshape the world through proactive healthcare while working with cutting-edge technology and high performing teams with deep expertise - join us to make a difference in peopleâ€™s lives!

We are looking for an energetic & scrupulous Healthcare Researcher to report to our Vancouver team! Our ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Healthcare and Technology, allowing them to take ownership of research paper writing. If you are a strong researcher who can absorb technical information quickly and produce papers please apply for this contractor position!


As a part of the application process, please review our website and submit a short form (up to 500 words) that expresses the importance of proactive healthcare and early detection of cancer.

 

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Create research reports, project case studies, and white paper 
  • Write case studies of internal findings
  • Collaborate with our subject matter experts; conduct literature reviews & background research

What youâ€™ll bring:

  • Solid content writing experience in the healthcare and technology domains
  • Knowledge of medical and statistical terminology
  • Ability to conduct research in the healthcare and technology domains
  • Strong time and organizational management - able to handle multiple projects at once and meet deadlines with ease

What we offer:

  • An avenue to make a positive impact on people's lives and their health
  • We believe in preventative healthcare for everyone, including our team - Prenuvo provides free, whole-body scans to each team member 
  • Growth opportunities are at the heart of our people journey, weâ€™re doing big things with bright minds - there is no single path to success, it can be shaped along the way
  • Building strong relationships is at the core of everything we do - our team gets together each week to connect, share, and socialize 
  • Daily health at Prenuvo means having space to take a break and refuel - at our office locations, we keep our break room stocked with good coffee and healthy snacks
  • Recognizing time away to restore is vital to our wellbeing - we have a flexible vacation policy and we will encourage you to use it
  • We offer a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, vision, including Mental Health coverage, and an Employee and Family Assistance Program to support you and your family

Our Values 

  • We empower - We are all agents for change in transforming healthcare and in transforming our health
  • We work together - We work together to support and deliver the best for our members and ourselves
  • We bring transparency - Positive change comes from transparency in where we stand as a company, as colleagues and as Prenuvo members

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Recreational Programming and Volunteer Coordinator, Full-time, Corporate Services - Tri-County Mennonite Homes
description:
Recreational Programming and Volunteer Coordinator

Status: Permanent

Type: Full-time

JOB SUMMARY:

The position of Recreational Programming and Volunteer Coordinator is accountable for the management of the Recreation Department including wellness, spiritual, volunteer, physiotherapy, and restorative care. The ideal candidate delivers optimal service to residents and families based on quality management, legislative requirements, and organization standards.

As a valued member of the team, the Coordinator demonstrates a commitment to the quality of resident care by providing services in accordance with the organization’s mission, vision, and values. The Coordinator’s role is to provide Senior’s programming for both Nithview Community and Greenwood Court, however the position reports directly to the Executive Director at GWC.

Wage - $23.35 - $27.08

RESPONSIBILITIES – RECREATIONAL PROGRAMMING:

  • Direct, co-ordinate, approve/plan, schedule, implement, and evaluate resident activities, while ensuring a wide range of activity and leisure programs that meet the residents’ physical, social, emotional, intellectual, and spiritual needs.
  • On-going assessment of individual resident activity and leisure requirements, interests, and abilities in order to identify needs, develop appropriate supports to optimize resident involvement, and introduce new and/or modified activities/programs/services as applicable.
  • Works with the Executive Directors in budget development and maintains the approved budget. Facilitates department budgets by ensuring sufficient resources/equipment are available through budget preparation, maintenance, and the hiring of appropriate and adequate staffing levels.
  • Ensure that the Recreation Department operates in compliance with the relevant provincial standards and legislation, as well as the organization policies and procedures.
  • Promote a multidisciplinary approach to resident care by ongoing liaison with other departments in relation to individual resident’s needs and participation in the care planning process.
  • Facilitate departmental meetings and participate in home specific committees.
  • Participate in multidisciplinary care conferences and corporate conferences as required.
  • Act as a resource and support for the Recreation Department by implementing, as well as educating and presenting on best practices to team members.
  • Administer a quality assurance program for the Recreation Department in keeping with the “Continuous Quality Improvement” program for the facility. This includes but is not limited to monthly audits and program evaluation.
  • Seek opportunities to collaborate with other therapy programs i.e., pet therapy, music therapy, art therapy, and to connect the home with the community.
  • Knowledgeable of the Residents’ Bill of Rights.
  • Recruits, hires, trains, evaluates, performance manages, promotes, transfers, and dismisses department team members in consultation with the Executive Director/ Administrator and Human Resources.
  • Schedules work required for all department team members.
  • Handles labour relation issues, including disciplining team members, according to the union contract and Human Resources guidelines. Engages Executive Directors for advice as needed.
  • Provides in-service opportunities for all team members to enhance team members’ performance.
  • Ensures orientation is provided for all new team members of the department.
  • Ensures documentation is on file for all disciplinary action and in-services held for department team members.
  • Attends all pertinent in-services offered at the home affecting the provision of resident care.
  • Managing WSIB claims and minimize negative impact to NEER statement.
  • Manages the Return-to-Work process and/or arranges modified work programs for department team members.
  • Plans, co-ordinates, directs and monitors the effectiveness of all operational activities within the Recreation Department.
  • Develops and sustains operational plans for the effective operation of the department.
  • Delegates responsibility to team members based on clearly defined lines of authority and communication.
  • Establishes and maintains an effective quality and risk management system to ensure legislative regulations and standards are met.
  • Ensures that all required programs and therapy committees are functioning within their terms of reference and areas of responsibility.
  • Establishes, monitors, and evaluates staffing patterns and work schedules in accordance with the program envelope budget and with Collective Bargaining Agreements, as applicable.
  • Manages and monitors all program envelope expenditures, explains monthly variances, and works with the Administrator to identity corrective action.
  • Ensures effective and efficient procurement and supply control procedures within the Recreation Department.
  • Oversees processes to ensure that all documentation is completed in a manner that utilizes base funding and ensures access to other available funding initiatives.
  • Establishes and sustains care in a manner that is resident centred and fosters evidence based best practice.

RESPONSIBLITIES – VOLUNTEERS

  • Recruiting, orientation, and training of new volunteers
  • Maintain database of volunteer information
  • Work with the Recreation Department to identify volunteer skills and match to volunteer opportunities within the organization
  • Work with all departments to identify opportunities to engage volunteers in meeting needs of residents
  • Evaluate volunteer program to ensure legislative regulations and standards are met.
  • Manages, orientates, directs, co-ordinates, implements, and evaluates the Volunteer Program and actively promotes the recruitment of new volunteers.
  • Ensures orientation of volunteers meets legislative requirements as identified in LTCHA and RHA.
  • Works with Executive Director on Volunteer appreciation and annual volunteer training

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 3 years equivalent experience in management, program planning, implementation, and evaluation.
  • 3-5 years’ experience in Long Term Care with specialized knowledge of Gerontology.
  • At least 1 year of experience in a health care setting.
  • Membership with TRO/APO and/or registration with Therapeutic Recreation for Ontario (R/TRO).
  • Experience or knowledge in recruitment, selection, orientation, placement, and supervision of volunteers.
  • Knowledge of resident-centered approach to programs and techniques in recreation, leisure, and restoration.
  • Knowledge of community resources.
  • Demonstrated competency in MS Office.
  • Must be proficient with email, internet use, and computerized documentation.
  • Effective verbal and written English communication skills required.

EDUCATION:

  • A post-secondary diploma or degree in recreation and leisure studies, therapeutic recreation, kinesiology or other related field from a community college or university.
  • Current Standard and/or Emergency First Aid and CPR Certification.
  • Food Handlers Certificate required.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • Providing full care to male and female residents of all ethnic and cultural backgrounds, including but not limited to, personal hygiene;
  • Some disruption of lifestyle resulting from extra hours spent dealing with prospective clients, attending meetings and dealing with residents and families and responding to emergencies;
  • Stress resulting from constant interruptions, managing within legislative, budgetary and time constraints on a consistent basis and dealing with people who are under emotional pressure;
  • Combination of natural light and fluorescent lighting;
  • Sitting for meetings and computer work often;
  • Crouching, kneeling, stooping/bending for short periods of time;
  • Walking and climbing stairs frequently;
  • Exposure to bio medical waste;
  • Engagement and/or exposure to various therapy programs focused on providing residents with the highest quality of life in our Homes including but not limited to pet therapy, spiritual events, and musical therapy.

title: Building Science Specialist
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is currently seeking a Building Science Engineer  to join our Canada Infrastructure Built Environment group. This position can be located in either our Burlington, Cambridge or Richmond Hill, ON offices.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Review building envelope systems on new construction of municipal, healthcare, commercial, transit, and industrial projects
  • Perform Building Condition Assessments (BCA) for existing  buildings
  • Carry out building envelope, field inspection, testing, and reporting
  • Perform site investigations, evaluations and retrofit and restoration of designs of existing building envelope systems
  • Prepare proposals, cost estimates and tender documents
  • Administer contracts and manage projects
  • Effectively communicate with clients, team staff and management
  • Initiate in the development of new business
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Bachelor of Applied Science in Civil / Structural Engineering, Building Science, Architectural Science or Applied Science;
  • A minimum of  7 years of relevant experience
  • Currently registered as a P.Eng. with the Professional Engineers of Ontario
  • Building Science Specialist (BSS) professional is considered a plus
  • Knowledgeable in the field of building sciences and thermal performance analysis
  • Knowledgeable of CAD tools
  • Experienced with building envelope design, construction methods and materials
  • Strong written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Knowledgeable with the Ontario Building Code and other relevant building envelope standards
  • Experienced in design for retrofit construction
  • Experienced in preparation of tender document plans and specifications
  • Experienced in site reviews and contracts administration
  • Knowledgeable with service life analysis and costing for structural and building envelope component repairs and/or replacement
  • Sound project management skills in areas of cost control, administration, planning and client relationships
  • Proven business development success
  • Experience with structural systems, including steel, concrete, wood and masonry
  • Certified as welding inspector with the Canadian Welding Bureau an asset
  • Must be able to legally work in Canada at time of application
  • Valid driver license  
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Developer – Java
description:
Story Behind The Need:

• Business group – Commercial Global Engineering
• Project – The main function of a Developer is to design, develop, and implement applications using general languages and technologies (e.g. Java, JSP) to support business requirements.
• Reason for request – Resource needed for new business initiative

Candidate Value Proposition:

• The successful candidate will be able to work closely with the cash management product onboarding team, get an insight into how cash management products are managed within client.
• This opportunity will be challenging for any developers who is interested in full stack development using spring mvc

Typical Day In Role:

• Actively participates in customer discovery and solution discovery sessions
• Engineers software solutions that meet the needs of stakeholders while focusing on continually reducing technical debt
• Sets up development environments necessary to build the entire solution
• Participates in merging, integrating, versioning, promoting, code through environments and version control
• Triaging and problem solving necessary to restore service to production and with follow on root cause / fix efforts
• Collaborates to provide estimation and break down of work to enable small and frequent releases to production
• Proactively provide guidance and recommendation for the software design
• Create, socialize and implement on technical roadmaps
• Provides expertise in the technologies and frameworks used to deliver on business objectives
• Stays ahead of latest technologies, tools, patterns, etc. and brings them to the team for consideration
• Actively participates in knowledge exchange forums (i.e. Architectural Communities of Practice, Industry Forums, Open Source Communities, Universities, etc.)

Candidate Requirements/Must Have skills:

• 7-10+ years of experience as a Java Developer Enterprise Setting
• Working knowledge of Spring and Hibernate framework
• Working knowledge of how to develop and consume SOAP and RESTful webservices
• Working knowledge with one of the UI technologies such as JSP, Thymeleaf, JSF, React, Angular, Coffee, Backbone, etc. (Thymeleaf, JSP, React is preferred)
• Working knowledge of one of SQL databases such as MySQL, DB2, Oracle, etc. (DB2 is preferred)
• Good knowledge of core web principals (HTTP, the DOM, SSL, web servers)
• Working knowledge of version control software such as Git
• Working knowledge of build tools such as Gradle and Maven
• Working knowledge of development tools such as Eclipse IDE or similar (we use Eclipse)

Nice To Have Skills:

• Experience developing process heavy applications such as customer product onboarding applications for an enterprise
• Experience working with BIRT reporting
• Experience working with Microsoft Azure
• Experience with payment products
• Experience working with large enterprise applications within a bank is a plus

Soft Skills:

• Excellent communication and organizational skills
• Strong mixture of teamwork and independent working skills
• Proactive and able to complete tasks in an efficient manner

Education/Experience:

• Bachelor’s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required

Candidate Review & Selection

• 1 round panel interview – with hiring manager and senior developers
• 2nd round of interviews in special cases only

title: Systems Engineer (DOCSIS) - Canada
description:
Casa Systems, Inc. (Nasdaq: CASA) is 5G, delivering physical, virtual and cloud-native 5G infrastructure and customer premise networking for high-speed data and multi-service communications networks. Our core and edge convergence technology enables public and private networks for both communications service providers and enterprises. Casa Systems™ products deliver higher performance, improved network flexibility and scalability, increased operational efficiency and lower total cost of ownership (TCO). Commercially deployed in more than 70 countries, Casa serves over 475 Tier 1 and regional service providers worldwide. At Casa Systems, our mission is to deliver ultra-broadband solutions that keep families, communities and the world connected. We harness our passion for innovation to drive technological solutions that allow service providers to do amazing things that improve the way we live.

Casa Systems Canada Ltd., a subsidiary of Casa Systems, Inc., seeks to hire aSystems Engineer (DOCSIS) (mid to senior level)to join its team based remotely in either Ontario or Toronto.

TheSystems Engineerwill impact the organization by providing technical pre- and post-sales support including design, development, testing, installation, integration, configuration & commissioning, troubleshooting and on-site support; technical/commercial/marketing presentations; and driving high/low level designs in a pre-sales environment in support of the organizations sales initiatives for the Canadian region.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide customers with key Casa Systems, Inc. technical, solution and commercial (capex/opex) benefits in a pre-sales environment.
  • Respond to Customer RFIs and RFPs with the highest standards of quality.
  • Ensure that field trials are executed flawlessly.
  • Conduct problem analysis, problem reproduction, and resolution of customer issues.
  • Troubleshoot and triage service restoration.
  • Conduct root cause analysis to field reported software issues.
  • Prepare root cause analysis (RCA) for communication to customers.
  • Resolve technical problems over the telephone and via email.
  • Configure customer systems.
  • Replicate customer problems in lab environment.
  • Enter commands and observe system response to verify correct operation and detect errors.
  • Update technical documentation.
  • Provide the highest level of quality pre-sales technical support.
  • Create relationships with key technical customer personnel.
  • Provide post-sales assistance in case of product issues supporting the Casa Support team.
  • Drive customer technical staff in line with Casa product strategy.
  • Position Casa product and solutions in favor of competitive products/solutions.
  • Create content for different architectures and product solutions (internal and external).
  • Drive customer requirements in Casa Systems, Inc. Product Management and Engineering.
  • Coordinate with other staff across functions, i.e., Product Management, Customer Support and Engineering, to resolve problems and manage customer requirements and projects.
  • Support regional Professional Service engagements as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Undergraduate degree from an accredited university or college in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent technical discipline.
  • 5+ years of related experience providing technical pre- and post-sales support, technical/commercial/marketing presentations and driving high/low level designs in a pre-sales environment supporting sales initiatives.
  • Able and willing to travel throughout Canada to support sales objectives for region on short notice to complete assigned projects for varying lengths of time.
  • Must be able to speak French and English.
  • DOCSIS 1.x/2.0/3.0 required
  • Able to diagnose and correct IP routing or RF signaling issues in a live network required.
  • CATV/IPTV systems experience.
  • Virtualization experience.
  • Server administration, application and process installation and troubleshooting.
  • Able to draw from a wide range of skills and a broad technology base to complete tasks.
  • Familiar with technical product, standard and solution specifications and be able to point out the specific technical merits of one product/solution over another, and do so convincingly.
  • Advanced communication and interpersonal skills in order to interact with customers.
  • RF parameters and signal flows (frequency, power-level, modulation methods, etc.).
  • Configuration scripting via industry standard CLI interfaces.
  • CPE device configuration files, service flows.
  • Strong understanding of IP switching and routing.
  • Self-starter capable of working independently or as part of a larger deployment team.
  • Prior knowledge and experience providing pre/post-sales support for competitor CMTS products is highly desirable.
  • Able to live Casa’s core values: fun work environment, innovation & risk taking; passion, dedication & perseverance; and honesty & loyalty.

Casa Systems, Inc. offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive benefits and compensation package. In addition to a competitive base salary, this position provides an incentive compensation plan that rewards the individual based upon sales and defined objectives assigned.

Casa Systems is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment free from unlawful employment discrimination and without barriers to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO).

#LI-EB1

#LI-REMOTE



Required Skills


Required Experience

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Overview

WildBrain is looking for an experienced Systems Administrator to join our team!  In this role, you will maintain core systems critical to the business needs of our Vancouver Production Studio. This will include the support of the applications and hardware maintenance of the infrastructure at the site. The ideal candidate will be a intermediate level administrator with a diversified skill set that caters to both systems and network administrator tasks. This position is with our corporate team – we offer excellent benefits, employee equity incentives, generous RRSP matching offerings and an amazing work environment.  Find a job that let’s your imagination run wild!  WildBrain Studios produces fan-favorite animation and award-winning content that kids and families love in every corner of the globe. We love what we do and it shows in the quality content we produce! Our custom-built Vancouver studio in beautiful British Columbia is a wonderful backdrop for our artists, but it doesn’t end there, we have employees working remotely across BC, Canada, and the world!  Our artist-centric culture means we invest in our people, we provide training and growth opportunities, a healthy work-life balance, and fun activities throughout the year to meet, mingle and get creative with your team. If you like what you are reading so far, well buckle up, we’re just getting started!  

 

Responsibilities

What You’ll Do:

 

  • Daily manage, troubleshoot, and support of network, server, storage, hardware and software; adhering to standard operating practices
  • Analyze systems logs and identifiy potential issues in the system, and plan for proactive remediation as required
  • Act as Tier 2 support for any end user related queries; Updates and maintains IT ticketing system, manages to Service Level Agreements
  • Ensure all technology implementations adhere to globally-defined architecture standards  
  • Network Switch Configuration and Management
  • Firewall maintenance and support Plans and execute patching requirements
  • Monitor all backups, maintaining data on-site and off-site as determined by business requirements; amend plans as required; and perform regular tests of the restore process from backups
  • Develop and adhere to IT standards, and standard operating procedures in order to maintain IT and corporate compliance requirements 
  • Participate in IT projects by understanding project objectives and scope, following project milestones, phases and elements, sharing technical expertise, and providing recommendations
  • Contribute to capacity planning and inventory management.  Any other duties or projects assigned by the Manager

 

Qualifications

What You’ll Bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Technology or Engineering, or other relevant area of study and/or equivalent job experience
  • Working knowledge of with administration of network services (DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP, LAN, WAN, WLAN, VPN, switching, routing)
  • Experienced enterprise System Administrator (Windows servers 2008-2019, Active directory, Exchange Server, VMWare, Veeam, MS SQL server); HPE Comware \ Aruba Network Certification 
  • Fortinet NextGen FW experience configuration and management Experience with Enterprise Storage Systems Isilon \ Pure \ HPE 
  • Experience in preparing technical documents in Visio
  • Highly organized and motivated with strong attention to detail; Must be customer-centric with excellent oral and written communication skills  
  • Certifications: ITIL Foundations, MCSE MCSA, vmWare 6 & 6.5

Nice to Have: 

  • 3+ years of experience in animation and/or film industry
  • Degree/Diploma in accredited post-secondary institution or equivalent
  • Certifications: ITIL Foundations, MCSE MCSA, vmWare 6 & 6.5; Prior working experience within a Broadcast/Media organization
  • O365 experience
  • Red Hat: RHCSA and RHCE CompTIA Server+ VMware Certified Professional – Data Center Virtualization ServiceNow Certified System Administrator 

 

Why WildBrain?

 

We make sure to take care of all our hard-working Wild Brains by offering a comprehensive benefits package and a workplace culture that values our employees’ wellbeing. Our staff enjoy RRSP matching, multi-tiered benefits so you can pick the coverage that’s best for you, free mental health resources, and additional perks like half-days in the summer, extra holidays in the winter and regular events to connect our teams virtually, and in-person.

In short – life is good on the Wild side!

Visit wildbrain.com/studios to learn more!

___

" WildBrain Studio provides an atmosphere free from barriers to promote inclusion, equity and diversity. We demonstrate our commitment to this by providing a supportive work environment and a culture that welcomes and encourages equal opportunities for all employees. WildBrain Studio also accommodates people with disabilities throughout the selection process. Should you require accommodation, please let us know your requirements when contacted.”

title: Senior Devops Engineer / SRE - Mostly Remote
description:
Are you looking for a stimulating and dynamic job? Would you like to be part of a team that believes in your potential and of a great company that will help you advance in your career? This is the job for you! We are currently looking for one Senior Devops Engineer for one of our clients.


What is in it for you:
• Company Type: Learning Technology firm
• Full time permanent, daytime hours
• Dynamic and professional environment
• Health and Disability insurance, RRSP, employee stock option purchase plan
• Mostly remote : 1 Day/week in Montreal Office. 

The Company’s Technical Infrastructure:
• AWS EC2, Terraform Enterprise, Docker, Aurora, Mesos, Kubernetes, ELK (Elastic Search, Logstash & Kibana).
• Grafana, Prometheus, Datadog, Telegraf, Runscope, Apollo, GraphQL.
• Microservices Architecture, Spring, Java & NodeJS, React, Koa, Express.js.
• Amazon RDS, Dynamo DB, Postgres, Oracle, MySQL, Influx DB, Linux, Jenkins. GitHub

Responsibilities:
• Apply deep technical knowledge, taking a broad look at the company’s technology infrastructure
• Help identify common and systematic issues and validate these, prioritizing which to strategically address first
• Partner with the SRE/DevOps team, discussing and refining ideas while preparing proof of concepts
• Present and validate these across technology teams, figuring out the best solution
• Implementing Canary, designing a new automated pipeline solution, extension of Kubernetes capabilities, implementation of machine learning to build load testing, ensuring mutability of containerization etc.
• Evaluate existing technologies and design the future state and regularly review existing infrastructure, looking for opportunities to improve
• Automate everything necessary, combining reliability with a pragmatic approach
• Work with the Agile development teams, to troubleshoot server, application, and performance issues

What you need to succeed:
• Significant hands-on SRE/DevOps experience in an Agile environment
• Able to collaborate effectively with both engineers and operations, and be comfortable recommending best practices
• Substantial experience navigating and using AWS in a production environment
• Able to quickly diagnose issues and been instrumental in restoring normal service levels
• Intellectual curiosity, and an appetite to learn more
• Significant experience and/or an interest in managing cloud infrastructure as code and Container Management
• Expertise with an RDBMS and working with Linux
• Experience with management of Messaging Queues and event driven systems
• Experience working with security, firewalls, network, application load balancing, and secret management
• Experience working with CI/CD tools and using scripting languages
• A strong and informed point of view with respect to monitoring tools and how best to use them

Why Recruit Action?
We give you the opportunity to accelerate your career. Recrute Action provides recruitment services through quality support and a personalized approach to job seekers and businesses. Thank you for your interest in this position. Only qualified candidates who match hiring criteria will be contacted.


--------


Vous cherchez un emploi stimulant et dynamique dans les environs de Montréal? Vous aimeriez faire partie d’une équipe qui croit en votre potentiel et d’une entreprise qui permettra de faire avancer votre carrière ? Ce poste est pour vous ! Nous recherchons actuellement un(e) Ingénieur Devops/ Ingénieur de fiabilité de site pour lun de nos clients.

Avantages:
• Firme orientée vers les technologies de l’apprentissage
• Poste à temps plein de jour permanent
• Environnement dynamique et professionnel
• Assurance santé et invalidité, plan de retraite, plan dactionnariat salarié

L’infrastructure technique de la compagnie:
• AWS EC2, Terraform Enterprise, Docker, Aurora, Mesos, Kubernetes, ELK (Elastic Search, Logstash & Kibana).
• Grafana, Prometheus, Datadog, Telegraf, Runscope, Apollo, GraphQL.
• Microservices Architecture, Spring, Java & NodeJS, React, Koa, Express.js.
• Amazon RDS, Dynamo DB, Postgres, Oracle, MySQL, Influx DB, Linux, Jenkins. GitHub

Tâches et responsabilités:
• Appliquer une connaissance technique approfondie, apporter un regard d’ensemble sur la technologie d’infrastructure
• Aider à identifier des problèmes communs et liés aux systèmes, puis les valider en sachant lesquels prioriser
• Travailler en partenariat avec l’équipe SRE/Devops, discuter et raffiner les idées tout en préparant des preuves pour appuyer les concepts
• Présenter et valider les idées et concepts avec les équipes technologiques afin de trouver la meilleure solution
• Implémenter Canary, designer une nouvelle solution de pipeline automatisée, étendre les capacités de Kubernetes, implémenter de l’apprentissage de machine afin d’effectuer des tests, s’assurer de la mutabilité des conteneurs, etc…
• Évaluer les technologies existantes et en désigner l’état futur en examinant régulièrement les infrastructures existantes afin de trouver des opportunités d’amélioration
• AAutomatiser tout ce qui est nécessaire en combinant la fiabilité et une approche pragmatique
• Travailler avec l’équipe de développement Agile afin de dépanner des problèmes relatifs au serveur, à l’application et à la performance

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir:
• Expérience significative en développement SRE/DevOps dans un environnement Agile
• Être capable de collaborer de manière efficace avec des ingénieurs et des opérateurs, savoir recommander les meilleures pratiques
• Expérience substantielle en navigation utilisant AWS dans un environnement de production
• Être en mesure de diagnostiquer rapidement les problèmes afin de restaurer le niveau de service habituel
• Curiosité intellectuelle et avoir envie de toujours en apprendre plus
• Expérience significative ou intérêt dans la gestion d’infrastructures Cloud en tant que codes et gestion de conteneurs
• Expertise avec un RDBMS et avec Linux
• Expérience en gestion de file dattente de messagerie et de systèmes événementiels
• Expérience de travail en sécurité, pare-feu, réseaux, équilibrage de la charge des applications et gestion des secrets
• Expérience de travail avec des outils CI/CD et des langages de scriptage
• Point de vue informé et solide qui respecte les outils de monitoring et leurs utilisations

Pourquoi Recrute Action?
Recrute Action (permis dagence : AP-2000003) fournit des services de qualité en matière de recrutement en offrant un soutien et une approche personnalisée autant pour les chercheurs d’emploi que pour les entreprises. Seuls les candidats qualifiés qui répondent aux critères dembauche seront contactés.
