title: Fiber System Planner-142261
description:
Remote until further notice (should be GTA)

ROLE: Fiber System Planner

Key Responsibilities/Job Functions:
•Management of the Rogers Fibre Network. Fibre circuit assignments, fibre records management and fibre network documentation including fibre IRU records, splice logs, fiber counts and availability, loopback, splice and coupler locations, termination cabinets and panel locations,
•OTDR/CD/PMD traces, loss measurements and other fibre characterization specifications.
•Provide fibre network design alternatives and assist in optimizing fibre network capital and operating costs.
•Perform analysis of and recommendations for different fibre network technical options.
•Prepare fibre cost estimates (FERs) and produce CAs, BOM and POs for fibre national or inter regional projects. Coordinate spending and timelines. Ensure projected overruns are escalated in timely fashion.
•Joint Fibre planning and provides liaison to fiber users with Rogers Wireless and other 3rd parties for fiber allocation and IRUs.
•Provide input to engineering plans for fibre network expansions/upgrades in a timely manner to allow implementation to be within specification, on time and within budget.
•Assist in ensuring engineering plans meet fibre network needs in terms of reliability and capacity, and ensure the Fibre Network is built for ease of use from an operations perspective.•Assist in providing documents that assist other departments eg RFQ for implementation
•Provide engineering support for the Rogers Fibre Network and the implementation of new engineering plans.
•Provide engineering support for the selection of routes to ensure optimum cost effectiveness and performance, and in the preparation of construction and permit drawings and bill of materials for new plant and forced projects.
•Provide engineering support for the operation, maintenance and restoration of the fibre network.
•Accurately document details of Rogers Fibre Network topology.
•Participate as lead for certain phases of complex fibre network projects.
•Provide input for the preparation for technical presentations and proposals on the Rogers Fibre Network.
•May provide input or advice related to fibre network technical issues.

MUST HAVE SKILLS:
•3-5+ years as a Fiber System Planner with Network engineering and Planning experience.
•Experience with a major Telecom Service Provider or Cable Operator and direct involvement in building large fibre networks.
•Communicates effectively with both technical and operations management
•Ability to prepare information and advise internal and external customers on proposed ideas, products or solutions.

NICE TO HAVE SKILLS:
•Education experience should include undergraduate university degree or College Diploma in electrical engineering, Telecoms Engineering or equivalent PE, CET , SCTE, BCE, BCT, or BTS certification/designation is definitely and asset.

ADDITIONAL SKILLS:
•Excellent organizational, written and verbal skills.
•Ability to work within a dynamic team and organize time among multiple tasks.
•Customer Service Orientation, Teamwork and Collaboration, Adaptability and Initiative.

title: Building Science Project Manager
description:
Overview:

Job Title: Building Science Project Manager

 

Remote Location Options: Moncton, Fredericton, or Saint John Regions

 

IRC Building Sciences Group â€“ a Rimkus Company is hiring!

We are seeking a qualified Building Science Project Manager to work in New Brunswick. In return for your talent and effort, Rimkus offers a dynamic organization with a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible work schedule and opportunities for advancement.

 

Overview:

 

In this position you will apply your technical knowledge to evaluate existing buildings and design solutions for the complex and unique problems of our clients. Projects will include a mix of residential, multi-family, and commercial projects, with an emphasis on repair of damage from fire, wind, flood, and impacts, as well as adaptive reuse of older buildings, and enhancements to existing facilities to accommodate changes in use and implementation of equipment and machinery. You must be able to balance several projects simultaneously and be detail orientated. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written are essential.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in performing condition assessments of multi-residential, commercial, and institutional facilities and preparation of reports and reserve fund studies
  • Perform field investigation work and the diagnosis of building problems required to design exterior envelope remediation including exterior wall, fenestration, roof and/or structural remediation
  • Assist in performing leak investigations of all aspects of building envelope, roofs, walls, windows and foundations
  • Assist in carrying out field review of construction work in progress on both new and restoration projects and report on progress and the contractorâ€™s adherence to contract documentation
  • Light AutoCAD support and specification writing
  • Project management and contract administration
Qualifications:
  • Completion of a degree in an engineering or technology program with a focus on Building Science, Architectural, or Civil / Structural Engineering
  • Minimum of 4 years of engineering experience, with a focus on projects related to building sciences
  • Knowledge in areas related to building science such as thermodynamics, heat transfer and psychometrics
  • Understanding of building construction including methods, materials and systems is required
  • Exceptional attention to detail, specifically in accuracy of calculations and completeness of data collection and notation
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
  • Self-motivating and multi-tasking ability
  • Able to work individually and in a team setting

Duties will Include:

  • Work setting in both the office or field environment
  • Travel within the province of New Brunswick
  • Measuring of building dimensions and quantifying on site and from drawings
  • Interpretation and hand drawing of in-situ construction details
  • Working at heights including accessing buildings by ladders, swing stages and mechanical lifts
  • Typical duties associated with working in a professional engineering office
  • Co-ordinate all input for time billing and job costing
  • Other tasks may be required to ensure timely completion of deadlines

In this position you will apply your technical knowledge to evaluate existing buildings and design solutions for the complex and unique problems of our clients. Projects will include a mix of residential, multi-family, and commercial projects, with an emphasis on repair of damage from fire, wind, flood, and impacts, as well as adaptive reuse of older buildings, and enhancements to existing facilities to accommodate changes in use and implementation of equipment and machinery. You must be able to balance several projects simultaneously and be detail orientated. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written are essential.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in performing condition assessments of multi-residential, commercial, and institutional facilities and preparation of reports and reserve fund studies
  • Perform field investigation work and the diagnosis of building problems required to design exterior envelope remediation including exterior wall, fenestration, roof and/or structural remediation
  • Assist in performing leak investigations of all aspects of building envelope, roofs, walls, windows and foundations
  • Assist in carrying out field review of construction work in progress on both new and restoration projects and report on progress and the contractorâ€™s adherence to contract documentation
  • Light AutoCAD support and specification writing
  • Project management and contract administration
Qualifications:
  • Completion of a degree in an engineering or technology program with a focus on Building Science, Architectural, or Civil / Structural Engineering
  • Minimum of 4 years of engineering experience, with a focus on projects related to building sciences
  • Knowledge in areas related to building science such as thermodynamics, heat transfer and psychometrics
  • Understanding of building construction including methods, materials and systems is required
  • Exceptional attention to detail, specifically in accuracy of calculations and completeness of data collection and notation
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
  • Self-motivating and multi-tasking ability
  • Able to work individually and in a team setting

Duties will Include:

  • Work setting in both the office or field environment
  • Travel within the province of New Brunswick
  • Measuring of building dimensions and quantifying on site and from drawings
  • Interpretation and hand drawing of in-situ construction details
  • Working at heights including accessing buildings by ladders, swing stages and mechanical lifts
  • Typical duties associated with working in a professional engineering office
  • Co-ordinate all input for time billing and job costing
  • Other tasks may be required to ensure timely completion of deadlines

title: Professionnel ou technologue en ingénierie de liaison Airbus Canada / Liaison Engineering Professional or Technologist Airbus Canada
description:
**ENGLISH POSTING FOLLOWS**


Airbus est un pionnier international de l'industrie aérospatiale. Nous sommes un leader dans la conception, la fabrication et la livraison de produits, services et solutions aérospatiaux à des clients à l'échelle mondiale. Nous visons un monde mieux connecté, plus sûr et plus prospère.


Constructeur d'avions commerciaux, avec des divisions Espace et Défense ainsi que des Hélicoptères, Airbus est la plus grande entreprise aéronautique et spatiale en Europe et un leader mondial.


Chez Airbus Canada, nos collaborateurs travaillent ensemble à faire évoluer la mobilité partout dans le monde, une bonne idée après l'autre. Si vous avez une bonne idée, nous avons l'environnement pour qu'elle devienne un produit unique ou une expérience client exceptionnelle. Vos idées sont notre énergie.


Dans votre rôle, vous devrez :

  • Soutenir les opérations de production, de finitions et de livraison dans nos zones de fabrication et d'assemblage (ex : suivi des rapports de non-conformité (NCR), indicateurs clés de performance (KPI), etc.)
  • Concevoir, analyser et éliminer les réparations pour les non-conformités structurelles en temps opportun afin de restaurer l'intégrité de la conception dans les sous-ensembles, la ligne finale et les zones de pré-vol de l'avion A220
  • Concevoir rapidement des réparations sur la base d'une résistance/rigidité équivalente de la structure environnante dans un environnement piloté par un calendrier de production
  • Interpréter les dessins techniques, les spécifications et fournir des conseils aux employés des méthodes et de la production
  • Adhérer aux procédures du comité d'examen du matériel (MRB) et d'assurance qualité (AQ) de l'A220
  • Diriger des audits internes selon les normes ISO ISO, Transport Canada, NADCAP et six sigma
  • Maintenir une connaissance actuelle et à jour des développements dans les structures d'avions afin de recommander des innovations pour améliorer la qualité, l'économie et l'efficacité des produits de l'entreprise
  • Participer à des projets qui visent à augmenter la productivité, réduire les déchets et améliorer la performance financière
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec d'autres disciplines d'ingénierie telles que les systèmes, les contraintes, les matériaux et les processus, la propulsion et les groupes de soutien tels que la logistique, les méthodes et la qualité afin d'atteindre les objectifs commerciaux de l'entreprise.

En tant que candidat idéal,

  • Vous avez un diplôme universitaire ou collégial en génie aérospatial ou mécanique ou dans un domaine connexe
  • Vous avez 3 ans d'expérience dans le Material Review Board (MRB) ou la conception de cellules en aérospatiale, un atout important
  • Vous avez une connaissance approfondie des structures d'aéronefs et des exigences techniques d'installation de systèmes
  • Vous avez un sens élevé de l'engagement et une volonté d'accepter des responsabilités tout en agissant de manière indépendante dans un environnement de production à haute pression et en montée en charge
  • Vous avez une expérience de travail pratique en utilisant V5
  • Vous êtes bilingue (français et anglais).

Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae en français et en anglais.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Airbus Canadasouscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.


Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in the design, manufacture and delivery of aerospace products, services and solutions to customers worldwide. We aim for a better connected, safer and more prosperous world.

Manufacturer of commercial aircraft, with Space and Defense divisions as well as Helicopters, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and Space Company in Europe and a world leader.

At Airbus Canada, our people work together to make mobility evolve around the world, one good idea after another. If you have a great idea, we have the environment for it to become a unique product or a great customer experience. Your ideas are our energy.

In your role, you will:

  • Support production, completions and delivery operations in our manufacturing and assembly areas (ex: follow up on non-conformity reports (NCRs), key performance indicators (KPIs), etc)
  • Design, analyze and disposition repairs for structural non-conformances in a timely manner to restore design integrity in sub-assembly, final line and preflight areas of the A220 Aircraft
  • Rapidly design repairs based on equivalent strength / stiffness of surrounding structure while in a production schedule-driven environment
  • Interpret engineering drawings, specifications & provide guidance to Methods and Production employees
  • Adhere to the A220 Materiel Review Board (MRB) and Quality Assurance (QA) procedures
  • Lead internal audits according to the ISO standards ISO, Transport Canada, NADCAP and six sigma
  • Maintain a current and up-to-date knowledge of developments in aircraft structures in order to recommend innovations to improve the quality, economy, and effectiveness of company products
  • Participate in projects that aim to increase productivity, reduce waste and improve financial performance
  • Work in close cooperation with other Engineering disciplines such as Systems, Stress, Materials & Processes, Propulsion, and Support Groups such as Logistics, Methods & Quality in order to achieve the company's business objectives

As our ideal candidate,

  • You have a University or a College degree in Aerospace or Mechanical engineering or in a related field
  • You have 3 years of Material Review Board (MRB) or airframe design experience in aerospace, an important asset
  • You have an in-depth knowledge of aircraft structures & system installation technical requirements
  • You have a high sense of commitment, and a willingness to accept responsibilities while acting independently in a high-pressure and in a ramp-up production environment
  • You have a practical working experience using V5

Please upload your resume in French and English.

The use of the masculine gender has been adopted for ease of reading and has no discriminatory intent.

Airbus Canada subscribes to the principle of employment equity and encourages women, aboriginals, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

title: Service Delivery Management (3 positions) (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Service Delivery Management (3 positions)-MON18504

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will:

- Interface with local business units/functions. Act as escalation point for support or delivery issues, driving operational performance and stable operations.

- Ensure regional service delivery based on global standards, identify issues and gaps, drive their resolution (KPI: service quality at site level, availability and restoration time). Also provide support for regional deployment projects, interface to the sites (e.g., PC refreshes, network refresh and extensions, application deployments, etc.)

- Evaluate non-standard service requests and monitor consumption of BIS standard services (steering the level of standardization and reuse)

- Have a solid understanding of the services that BIS supports and that our supplier is contracted to deliver. Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with our suppliers.

- Oversee the definition, design and delivery of enterprise IT Service Management processes to effectively maintain technology operations and delivery, and ultimate business outcomes. Specific accountabilities include: Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Knowledge Management, Configuration Management

- Be responsible for quality of services, adherence to service level agreement (SLA) of all operations services delivered under the SLA.

- Have working knowledge of ServiceNow and reporting capabilities to monitor defined KPIs and SLAs.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

- You have a university degree or college diploma in a relevant field- Technology/Computer Science/Project management.

- You must have 5+ or more years of IT Client Service Management and/or IT Service Delivery Management experience.

- You have well-developed organizational and time management skills including the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously with attention to details, in a fast-paced environment.

- You have a minimum of 5 to 8 years of relevant working experience in the manufacturing or transportation/aerospace industry.

- You have IS / IT generalist skills.

- You have strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work effectively with a wide range of individuals in a diverse community.

- You have excellent customer service with a focus on driving standardization and results.

- You have the ability to manage relationships and deliverables remotely

- You have the ability to evolve in a matrix organization

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: IT Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Job Details
Job Title: IT Infrastructure Engineer
Job Location: Ottawa, ON
Job Duration: 12+ Months
 
  • Responsible for the successful delivery of infrastructure services to America.
  • Responsible for ensuring all production servers and system resources are at their optimal levels for performance and availability through proactive management of the environment and if required instigate appropriate action to maintain these service levels.
  • Champion service restoration through proper prioritization and escalation to appropriate 3rd party vendor and or internal support groups.
 
Essential Functions:
 
  • Infrastructure support including - VMWare hypervisors, Windows and Linux servers, Active Directory
  • Ensure that all systems meet security standards and escalate violations through appropriate internal processes.
  • Define and review Operation Acceptance Tests and procedures and facilitate migration of the new / modified server and network-based services into the production environment.
  • Develop and conduct skills transfer processes through individual and team training and procedures.
  • Weekly preparation of Systems service availability report for department.
  • Monitoring of customer Service Level Agreements, with respect to availability.
  • Maintain service level of systems and network by proactive monitoring and performing maintenance of the production environment.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
 
Skills:
 
  • Post-secondary degree in computer science, or equivalent work experience
  • 5-10 years of enterprise IT infrastructure related experience
  • Excellent interpersonal & leadership skills
  • Strong knowledge and experience in administering Windows Server 2012+, Active Directory, Microsoft SCCM and VMware vSphere
  • Excellent oral & written communication, people skills, planning, implementation and troubleshooting skills.
  • Possess effective coaching and mentoring skills
  • Be able to carry out multiple assignments
  • Be detailed oriented and able to work on own initiative
 
Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong knowledge and experience in administering VMware VSAN and NSX
  • Knowledge and experience with Linux – REDHAT preferred
  • Knowledge and experience with configuring SAN – Dell/EMC, NetApp
  • Knowledge and experience with Dell Avamar
  • Knowledge and experience with EMC Data Domain
  • Strong knowledge of Citrix

title: Truck Equipment Installer
description:
LOCATION:                  Innisfil, Ontario

POSITION TYPE:          Full Time

POSITION SUMMARY:

Joe Johnson Equipment offers a great opportunity to join our team of mechanics.  We offer a friendly, safe, fast paced environment that provides plenty of opportunity to work on a variety of heavy equipment, career development and advancement opportunities and a stable environment to development or expand your trade skills. 

The Truck Equipment Installer will be responsible for completing installations and product enhancement on a variety of equipment and will work with Technicians on maintenance and repairs to trucks and heavy equipment as required. The Truck Equipment Installer will be expected to read build diagrams and/or oral and written specifications while trouble shooting and diagnosing problems. You will be responsible for achieving a high-quality finished build, including final testing of equipment performance.

WHY WORK AT JJE?

  • Competitive compensation package with annual increase opportunities
  • Robust Group Benefits 100% paid for by the Company – inclusive of Health, Dental, Life, Disability and Travel coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Employer Matching Retirement Savings Plan
  • Profit sharing opportunities paid quarterly
  • Opportunity to grow professionally
  • Work boot, tool and prescription safety glasses reimbursement
  • Tuition & Professional Development paid
  • Factory training opportunities and Technician training bonus up to $3,000.00
  • Ongoing safety training and safe work environment
  • Federally recognized as certified Employment Equity organization

POSITION REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Valid driver’s license with a clean driver’s abstract
  • Forklift license or willing to obtain
  • 1 years’ experience as a Shop Assistant or Mechanic, preferably working with heavy duty equipment
  • Combined general mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic assembly skills
  • Hydraulic hose routing and system installation
  • Welding and fabricating an asset
  • Mechanical aptitude or Previous truck equipment and body installation experience required is an asset 
  • Experience operating machinery and using a variety of tools
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a safe manner
  • Demonstrated team player and willing to assist others when required
  • Attention to detail and commitment to customer satisfaction
  • Ability to plan and execute aspects of work independently and with a positive attitude
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Independent problem solver and decision maker

SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES/DUTIES:

  • Complete installation and product enhancements on HEAVY duty equipment and new Unit PDI’s
  • Welding as required
  • Install and/or remove equipment vehicles using air, power and hand tools, along with technical information and shop service procedures.
  • Build special components to accommodate the installation of necessary equipment in vehicles
  • Troubleshoot malfunctions of electronic equipment and installations in order to diagnose and correct operational problems.
  • Repair electronic equipment and installations restore equipment installations to optimal operating conditions.
  • Operate installed equipment in order to test or demonstrate equipment.
  • Perform regularly scheduled maintenance and repairs on installed equipment to ensure maximum reliability and performance
  • Assist Technicians with minor maintenance and mechanical repairs of trucks and heavy equipment
  • Assist in the completion of body modifications and installations
  • Assist with the inspection and diagnosis of equipment for minor repairs and maintenance
  • Document all equipment installations and repairs performed, recording work completed on appropriate work orders.
  • Deliver and pick up parts as needed
  • Completion of work in a timely manner
  • Keep the work area clean, organized, and safe
  • Assist in some general facility maintenance
  • Perform any other duties as required

_____________________________________________________________________________

If you are looking for a new opportunity, then we at Joe Johnson Equipment welcome your application. We encourage applications from all qualified persons, however only those who are being considered for the position will be contacted.

If you are contacted for an interview and require any accommodation, please notify HR in advance and we will provide applicable accommodation.

Joe Johnson Equipment is an Essential Business due to the products and services we provide to our customers. We continue to fully operate during these challenging times while remaining steadfastly committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of our employees.

title: Intermediate Risk Assessor
description:
Your Employer:

Terraprobe Inc. (an Englobe Company)

At Terraprobe, we adopt innovative, human-centered management. We welcome new ideas and are open to continuous Improvement. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

We offer:

  • Health and Dental Benefits;
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • Personal days after one year;
  • Compensation for vehicle expense and travel;
  • Personal Protective Equipment;
  • Professional Development, skills certifications.
Your Contribution:

Terraprobe Inc. is looking for an Intermediate Risk Assessor  to join our team in providing consulting services to a variety of clients including, private, industry and government sectors.

Reporting to the Senior Risk Assessor, this candidate will support a wide variety of projects on the Environmental - Risk Assessment Team. Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Prepare / Lead the development of HHRAs and ERAs in accordance with federal and provincial guidance.
  • Provide technical leadership and oversight support in environmental consulting or regulatory environment with a focus on site investigation/remediation, applied toxicology, and/or ecological risk assessment.
  • Review and interpret environmental and toxicological studies and reports.
  • Support remedial strategy development for contaminated sites, including evaluating environmental sensitivities and mitigation/restoration techniques for remedial actions.
  • Prepare written documents such as letters, memoranda, proposals, workplans and investigative reports.
Your Profile:
  • Minimum Bachelor Degree in Environmental Science, Toxicology or related field.
  • 5-8 years of related risk assessment experience
  • Registered, or eligible for registration within two years, with the Ontario Ministry of the Environment and Climate Change as a Qualified Person for Risk Assessment (QPRA) per Section 6 of O. Reg. 153/04
  • Must have or be able to readily produce an Excel-based ecological exposure model for both federal and Ontario-based ERAs
  • Experience with water quality issues and soil/sediment contamination concerns
  • Familiarity with Federal (CCME, FCSAP) and Ontario Environmental Regulation, and Risk Assessment models
  • Excellent computer application and spreadsheet skill
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and technical report writing skill
  • Working knowledge of statistics, knowledge of and experience with industry-specific software (e.g., MS Office) and knowledge of ProUCL would be an asset

title: Rough Carpenter - Framing
description:
Responsibilities:
  • Mostly Insurance Restoration.  
  • Fabricate, construct, and repair structural woodwork and wood products by following blueprints, drawings, and oral instructions; using carpentry tools and equipment.  
  • Produce carpentry products and services by following standards and procedures.  
  • Making necessary adjustments.  
  • Determine material requirements and dimensions of structure or fixture to be fabricated by studying blueprints, sketches, or building plans.  
  • Anticipating needed supplies; placing and expediting orders for supplies. 
  • Prepare layout by following carpentry procedures   
  • Construct, repair, and install structure or fixture by marking cutting and assembly lines on materials.  
  • Shaping materials to measurements.  
  • Assembling and fastening cut and shaped materials.  
  • Using carpenter's hand tools, power tools, and woodworking machinery.  
  • Ensure construction quality by verifying the trueness of structure with a plumb bob, carpenter's level, and other measurements.  
  • Comply with federal, provincial, and local building codes by adhering to requirements.  
  • Advising management on needed actions.  
  • Maintain a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.  
  • Conserve carpentry resources by using equipment and supplies as needed to accomplish job results.  
  • Ensures operation of carpentry equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements.

title: Technical Support Analyst, Toronto - 4363
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Who Are We?

Fidessa (part of the ION Group) offers exceptional trading, investment and information solutions for the world's financial community. New technology, new regulation, new challenges: making money in today's financial markets is all about staying ahead of the curve. Having the capability to spot new trends and act fast turns change into opportunity. That's why 85% of the world's premier financial institutions trust Fidessa to provide them with their multi-asset trading and investment infrastructure, their market data and analysis, and their decision making and workflow technology. It's also why $10 trillion worth of transactions flow across our global network each year. Because we're the market leader, we can also offer unique access to the world's largest and most valuable trading community of buy-side and sell-side professionals, from global institutions and investment banks to boutique brokers and niche hedge funds.

The Americas Technical Support team provides technical application support to equities and derivatives customers and forms part of ION Markets global support team. The team is responsible for technical investigation, keeping customers updated and reporting potential software defects to Development teams. Technical Support also takes the lead in service restoration in the event of software or hardware failures, capacity planning and Business Continuity testing of the Hosted environment. Our team is faced-paced, keeping up with regulations and changes in technology. 

Role

We are looking for a Technical Support Analyst to assist in the support of the Fidessa applications (first level and second level application support). We work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Members of the team will provide hands-on support in a production environment, and will be challenged to use their technical knowledge and out-of-the-box thinking to solve complex problems. Ideal candidates will need to demonstrate their technical skillset and must have a desire to work in the financial industry, with a focus on equities and futures & options asset classes. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent grad or someone with up to 3 years of experience. We have a growth culture from within and this role provides a career track for anyone who has an interest in technology, financial products, trading, client support, product management, or technical account management.

About ION

We’re a diverse group of visionary innovators who provide trading and workflow automation software, high-value analytics, and strategic consulting to corporations, central banks, financial institutions, and governments. More than 40% of the world’s largest companies use our solutions. Founded in 1999, we’ve achieved tremendous growth by bringing together some of the best and most successful financial technology companies in the world. 

Over 2,000 of the world’s leading corporations, including 50% of the Fortune 500 and 30% of the world’s central banks, trust ION solutions to manage their cash, in-house banking, commodity supply chain, trading and risk.

Over 800 of the world’s leading banks and broker-dealers use our electronic trading platforms to operate the world’s financial market infrastructure.

With 10,000 employees and offices in more than 40 cities around the globe, ION is a rapidly expanding and dynamic group.

At ION, we offer careers that provide many opportunities: To invent. To design. To collaborate. To build. To transform businesses and empower people around the world to do more, faster and better than before. Imagine what you can do and experience. This is where you can do your best work.
Learn more at iongroup.com.</section>

title: Business Development Manager (Remediation/Construction) - Vancouver
description:
The Opportunity:

Our client is an innovative industry Environmental Services leader, having defined their success by delivering results where others have not, or could not. Their reputation for excellence in Environmental Remediation, Decommissioning, Reclamation and Restoration is supported by numerous industry accreditations and accolades, and they continue to work on some of Canada's largest and most complex remediation projects. 

Our client provides best-in-class solutions and their approach to excellence and service delivery has earned them recognition as one of Canada's Top 500 Fastest Growing Companies.

As a result of continued growth, we're looking for a Business Development Manager to support the Regional Manager and reporting team in achieving the region's annual revenue and growth targets.

You'll work closely with Project Managers and the Regional Manager to identify, manage, and develop new business as well as maintain and strengthen relationships with existing clients. A Team based approach to Business Development.

This position would report to the Western Regional Manager.

Key Responsibilities

- Identify new prospects and maintain existing relationships 

- Work closely with Senior leadership and the Project Management group to manage the BD process for the region

- Monitor and develop new KPIs for effectively tracking and managing BD efforts

- Work closely with the communications and marketing team to integrate annual company marketing strategy.

- Research targeted markets, pursue leads and follow up through to successful agreements

- Lead and report on monthly sales funnel activities 

- Coordination of CRM (Pipedrive) data and input as well as corrective action planning

Education/Qualifications/Experience:

- Recognized University/College degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or related field

- Strong grasp of business ethics and principles 

- 5+ years Business Development experience in Environmental, and Civil Construction industries

- Experience in Bidding and securing large contracts

- Skilled at identifying opportunities and developing business strategies

- Ability to handle multiple responsibilities and projects against timelines

Desired Personal Traits 

  • Driven and Collaborative Leader
  • Excellent written/verbal communication skills 
  • Strongly Achievement-oriented
  • Well-honed problem-solving, decision-making, and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to build strong relationships and interact with multiple clients
  • Strong business-acumen, extremely resourceful and quick thinker
  • Innovative and growth-driven

About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We're focused on helping companies build and develop world class teams and assisting jobseekers find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continual care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible. 

Peeple Inc and our clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

title: Sr. IP Engineer-135526- 1
description:
Job Description:       

Senior IP Network Engineer x 4 Roles

Scope:

Reporting to the Manager - Engineering IP Core Network, Senior IP Network Engineer will be involved in projects which will have a focus on Rogers IP networks supporting Rogers Wireline, Wireless and enterprise services. The successful incumbent will perform the role of a leading designers in area of engineering which includes LAN/WAN, L2 Switching, L3 IP Routing (OSPF, EIGRP, ISIS, BGP and Multicast), MPLS-VPN, Network Security/Firewall technology and other IP services.

Responsibilities:
•       Plan, design and engineer changes on Rogers IP core networks as required by network or product driven initiatives.
•       Develop and produce suitable Network Design, Provisioning Plan, Capacity Model/Plan, and Facilities. Plan and support the defined services and products within the established architecture and security policies.
•       Produce clear, well-crafted design project plans with specified tasks, milestones, and effort required against the desired service introduction and/or modifications to existing services.
•       Develop, execute and document the necessary testing requirements to evaluate the proposed designs and to validate the technology platform or systems, as well as any new software versions (laboratory, network verification, operational readiness), and provide direction / support to Network Operations for Production deployment.
•       Develop plans and criteria for a variety of engineering activities and seek opportunities to optimize networks
•       Identify and devise new and novel approaches and methodologies relative to established guidelines to effectively manage technical, product, or business risks.
•       Capacity management of one or more of the network components that constitute Rogers IP core networks.
•       Support operation teams in troubleshooting and restoration, root cause analysis. Participate in complex implementation activities as required by Operations
•       Provide regular project status and issues for escalation.

Qualifications
•      8+ years of experience in an Enterprise IP Network Engineering or Service Provider
•       5+ years of network design and support experience with a major Internet Service Provider (MSO or Telco).
•       Education - undergraduate university degree.
•       Minimum - Cisco CCNP/CCIE certification or equivalent.
•       Previous experience in design/build and support of:
•       L2 Switching, Spanning-Tree, Data Center,
•       L3 Routing including OSPF, IS-IS and BGP,
•       MPLS and MPLS L2/L3 VPN,
•       Traffic Engineering,
•       QoS,
•       IPv6,
•       Multicast
•       Network Security and Firewall (Cisco ASA, Juniper SRX),
•       IPSEC VPN,
•       AAA, Syslog, DNS,
•       Be familiar with Cisco and Juniper network equipment.
•       Be familiar with IP network automation framework. Including (but not limit to) ansible, python, netconf, xml etc.
•       Excellent organizational, written and verbal skills.
•       Highly adaptive and flexible to changing environments and priorities. Multitasking.
•       Implement IP network changes via scripting and automation

Nice to Have:
•       Knowledge of network management tools.
•       Experience within Network Operations would be an asset.

Mandatory Skills:       
FIREWALL (5), ROUTER (8), TCP/IP (8), IP ADDRESSING (8), IPV6 (6), IP SECURITY (8), CCIE (5)   

Nice-to-Have Skills:   
SCRIPTS (2), PYTHON (2)

title: Emergency Response Engineer - Junior
description:
Why GHD? Being the best we can be is in our culture. We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come. Our commitment to you Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business. Who we are We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Due to continuing growth, we are seeking a Junior Emergency Response Engineer to join our Spill Response Group in our Waterloo office.

GHD’s Waterloo Spill Response Group offers a wide variety of multi-discipline engineering experience and opportunities for the successful candidate. Our Team offers 24/7/365 response services to our clients in the transportation, insurance, and industrial industries (among others) within Ontario and occasionally across Canada and the US and provide engineering support for various emergency incidents including: train derailments, pipeline releases, industrial fires, trucking accidents, chemical spills, residential heating oil release, etc. Some of these incidents require immediate response and quickly turn into short to long term environmental remediation projects for GHD.

Your role will include:

  • Conduct field work including groundwater/soil sampling, water level monitoring, investigative drilling, monitor well installation, soil and groundwater remediation (excavation, in-situ, etc.), contractor oversight, air monitoring, stream and river rehabilitation, site restoration, and construction inspections for both emergency spill response and long-term environmental investigation and remediation projects
  • Assist Project Managers with preparing proposals, work plans, cost estimates, memorandums, letters, tables, figures, presentations, etc.
  • Perform data compilation, interpretation, and evaluation of environmental regulations to assist in the preparation of engineering reports
  • Assist with coordination of field activities including coordinating field personnel, analytical laboratory project set up, and procuring subcontractors and equipment
  • Support the coordination of internal GHD technical resources and support staff including drafting, database, chemists, and other personnel
  • Review, understand, and interpret provincial and federal acts and regulations
  • Travel to sites throughout southern Ontario with occasional travel throughout northern Ontario and across Canada

Desired Skills, Proficiencies and Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Engineering or other equivalent engineering program
  • 0 to 2 years’ engineering experience; co-op or full-time experience working in the consulting field with experience conducting field work is considered an asset
  • Willingness to travel to various sites is required including working extended hours, working in inclement weather conditions, and heavy lifting (a 70/30 field to office ratio is expected initially, the percent of field work would decrease over-time with experience)
  • Flexibility to assist with emergency spill response work, including weekends and nights for clients as required
  • Excellent prioritization and time management skills
  • Experience handling multiple tasks while maintaining a high degree of attention to detail in a consulting environment preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively express technical information to multiple audiences including subcontractors, field staff, clients, colleagues, etc.
  • Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Office
  • Motivated self-starter with the ability to work optimally in both an individual and team environment
  • Valid G driver’s license and access to a vehicle

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Pivotal Platform Operator
description:
Pivotal Platform Operator (level 8 or 9)


 


Candidates must be familiar with:



  • Elastic Runtime architecture and how it impacts developers

  • Installing, backing up, restoring, and upgrading Pivotal Platform

  • Creating users and assigning roles

  • Managing org and space quotas

  • Monitoring Pivotal Platform with component logs and metrics

  • Using BOSH to troubleshoot Pivotal Platform installation

  • Using BOSH to create and deploy a release

  • Capacity planning and multi-site deployments

  • Pivotal Platform performance optimization


 


Experienced with the following Pivotal components:



  • Concourse

  • Platform Automation

  • BOSH

  • Operations manager

  • Platform as a Product

  • Monitoring/Logging

  • Blobstore for offline resources

  • Agile/XP/Product management

  • Apps Manager



Why Mentor Tech Source?

Mentor Tech Source is the result of 25 plus years of extensive experience in providing Hybrid Model Staffing and Engineering Services in the ever evolving Software Economy.

  • We have a unique hybrid contingent staffing service composed of domestic and international sourcing
  • We have a 24/7 recruitment cycle due to the fact that Mentor has offices in many different time zones
  • We work day and night to provide our consultants and employees with best working environment

title: Senior Electronics and Mechanical Maintenance Technician
description:
Location: Burlington, Canada

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

The Senior Electronics and Mechanical Maintenance Technician will be part of the Engineering & Maintenance team located in Burlington, Ontario, and will extend support and machine maintenance to the Production environment, minimizing downtime and supporting Machine Operators through technical problems they encounter on the machines related to quality, downtime or performance.

The Senior Electronics & Mechanical Maintenance Technician will also fix mechanical, electrical, computer and firmware related problems in a high-paced, time-critical production environment and coach operators on problem solving at their level. Acting as the lead technician in charge of the Electronic and IT diagnostics of all equipment cells, this role will play a critical part in new product and technology introduction projects in roles varying from design, to integration, to testing by collaborating with other technical teams.

The Senior Electronics and Mechanical Maintenance Technician will be an ambassador representing the Engineering & Maintenance team to other teams and external parties, working on assignments and leading critical projects, discussions, and activities within the plant.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Providing direct support with the integration of new equipment and technology introduced in the plant related to the production and packaging processes

  • Performing advanced electronic work, such as circuit board diagnostics and repair, creating circuits, repair circuits, deciphering circuit and ladder diagrams, understanding and manipulating PLC, creating and maintaining manufacturing solutions, diagnosing internal network problems, diagnosing machines and technology with network elements.

  • Diagnosing equipment issues rooted in electronics failure (failed sensor, faulty cables, short on board, misaligned motor, misfiring actuator, slipping servo, etc.)

  • Helping to improve diagnostic and repair time by implementing continuous improvement solutions

  • Developing and implementing new customized electronic and mechanical solutions to solve manufacturing problems

  • Integrating new assigned machines into the production floor by planning their arrival, coordinating with the manufacturer, following up with support departments, electrical work, the pre-start work, the actual implementation, and post implementation services

  • Studying and learning equipment vendors electronics system and training other technicians and operators on them.

  • Creating customized electronic solutions and working with software developers to make a manufacturing 4.0 solution for data collection and automation in the production lines

  • Implementing and maintaining an inventory management system

  • Implementing and maintaining a technology backup (BCP) process to ensure business continuity

  • Developing the Repair Training program for equipment repair using your experience with the equipment

  • Creating and maintaining VB programming, as well as MS Access Database of Downtime Data

  • Integrating assigned machines into the production floor by planning their arrival, coordinating with the manufacturer, following up with support departments, electrical work, the pre-start work, the actual implementation, and post implementation services

  • Analyzing downtime data, making graphs using Excel, and presenting downtime and assessment for reasons of downtime to support continuous improvement initiatives

  • Maintaining manufacturing machinery systems in proper working order to ensure business continuity and minimize production downtime

  • Providing daily reports, weekly, monthly KPI (key performance indices) reports

  • Maintaining a log of all work done during the shift that relates to machines and items related to ongoing developments or projects

  • Maintaining the inventory system that serves as the foundation for parts usage tracking, machines parts usage tracking, parts reordering process, and parts reception process

  • Communicating technical information and concepts to different audiences in a variety of formats, internally and externally

  • Attending weekly Engineering team meetings and updating the team on assigned projects, tasks, and ongoing problems, utilizing the forum to discuss road blocks and improving overall manufacturing performance

  • Focusing on quality and working towards a goal of being World Class by continuously practicing Six Sigma-Lean manufacturing approach to monitoring, controlling and improving the department’s key performance indicators

  • Covering other shifts as needed with short notice to assist with coverage needs

  • Creating purchase requests, following up with Purchasing and Finance to ensure orders are placed and executed, to their final reception and audit. Manage & resolve procurement issues.

  • Leading the Quality Improvement Program in maintenance (Quality focused project work)

  • Leading the Procurement Processes for Maintenance of parts, consumables, and equipment

  • Supporting and working on Facilities work around the plan with Facilities dept.

  • Coordinating projects directly within production floor assigned to you by management

  • Maintaining a clean work environment and practicing the principles of 5S daily

  • Attend trainings abroad for equipment training when required

  • Train others as needed and informally supervise more junior technicians

Required Skills and Experience:

  • At least 4 years’ working in IT Electronics Engineering

  • At least 4 years’ experience working in any capacity of electro-mechanical automation, or Internet of Things, or programming basic code to control, read, manipulate electro-mechanical devices/computer systems, or hardware integration experience integrating electro-mechanical devices/computer systems

  • At least 2 years’ experience working with mechanical and electrical tools to troubleshoot and do basic repairs of equipment.

  • Be able to demonstrate a history of positive attitude

  • Prior Experience working as either one of manufacturing technician/engineer, aircraft mechanic, hands-on repairman, IT specialist, Automation Expert, mechanical technician, electrician, etc.

  • Experience with taking backups of computer systems, restoring computers

  • Must have experience with troubleshooting electrical and basic mechanical issues (beginner level)

  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook emailing, Calendar, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.

  • Experience with reading and deciphering technical documentation, parts diagrams, etc.

  • Knowledge of task management and ability to prioritize your work.

  • Professional attitude, able to work well in a fast-paced environment, self-motivated, a quick-learner, with ability to receive direction and feedback positively

  • Excellent Team player with proven ability to accomplish goals through collaboration

  • Ability to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity leveraging problem solving skills and a willingness to learn with only high-level direction

  • Organized with strong attention to detail, time management skills and a problem-solver

  • Ability to learn to understand the mechanical flow of material through equipment to understand the overall workings of the equipment.

  • Ability to work with team mates for a collected approach on complex evolving problems

Schedule: 8 hours shifts, which may lead to overtime for some shifts / weeks. Schedule can vary depending on job needs. Hours will be between 1pm-9:30pm. May be required to change shifts occasionally to cover other shifts. Shifts are normally planned a week in advance, and regular start and stop times of shift are preferred to allow for stability in planning both for the employee and for the company.

Physical Environment: Manufacturing environment, concrete floors, HVAC controlled indoor climate, manufacturing machinery noise, forklifts and logistics machinery may be present in some locations in the site.

Travel: Travel is required in rare circumstances out of country for trainings or work at other sites, which are planned in advance

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree or post-secondary Diploma with either a Mechanical or Electrical or IT or Engineering focus

  • 4 or more years of experience in electro-mechanical equipment in a manufacturing environment

  • Possess an understanding of the philosophy and application of Total Preventive Maintenance

  • Prior experience working with other departments (Quality Assurance, New Product Introduction NPI, IT, and Logistics) to administer quality validations, ensure NPI processes followed, fulfill communication with logistics for shipping and receiving of engineering products.

  • Experience repairing mailing and packaging equipment (Bell & Howell or Pitney Bowes)

  • Experience or training with embossing machinery (Datacard/Matica equipment)

  • Knowledge of industrial and safety regulations related to machinery such as OHSA regulations and electrical, building and fire codes

  • Experience with inventory management and control

  • Prior experience communicating pertinent and technical information to external customers and other stakeholders on a regular basis

  • Prior experience managing complex projects involving multiple stakeholders/ technologies and requirements autonomously

  • Experience working in Card Personalization Center and it’s regulatory requirements

  • Experience with Kaizen, Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma continuous improvement processes like DMAIC

  • Experience capturing and reporting on Key Performance Indices related to Maintenance

  • Experience using Oracle or Other Inventory Management ERP system for order placing and inventory control

  • Experience coordinating work and project actions with vendors to their completion through follow-ups

  • Knowledge being able to read and review PLC, circuit logic, electrical repairs and assessments

  • Experience with mechanical repairs, machine shop tools, key mechanical concepts and pneumatic systems

  • A+ Certification or N+ Certification is an asset

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Water Engineer - Junior
description:
Why GHD? Being the best we can be is in our culture. We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come. Our commitment to you Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business. Who we are We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Due to continuing growth, we are seeking a Junior Engineer/Scientist with experience and interest in surface water resources and water distribution for our Calgary, AB office.

This position will provide the opportunity to join our innovative, supportive, and dynamic water group. You will be working on a variety of infrastructure projects for both public and private clients within the field of surface water resources which includes hydrologic and hydraulic assessments, water quality assessments, site level stormwater management, green infrastructure, environmental monitoring, asset management and assessments, and construction administration and inspection.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in developing detailed design documents including technical drawings, specifications, calculations and contract documents for multi-discipline projects
  • Assist in development, coordination and implementation of field investigation programs performed by subcontractors or internal technicians and other field personnel
  • Technical report development including inspections and assessments, asset management, health and safety, environmental assessments, and detailed design reports
  • Summarize and interpret data collected as part of the field investigations and monitoring studies with guidance from senior design team members
  • Communicate and coordinate with equipment vendors and contractors
  • On-site inspection and assessment activities of various client infrastructure
  • Construction management activities including on-site inspections, construction oversight, and construction contract administration

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Applied Science in Engineering (Civil or Environmental) or Environmental Science
  • 0-2 years of relatable experience, ideally on design or construction of stormwater management infrastructure or watercourse restoration
  • Strong technical report writing and communication skills
  • Strong computer skills including experience with the Microsoft suite, and familiarity with AutoCAD
  • Experience and interest in infrastructure projects with a focus on water and wastewater systems
  • Class G Driver’s License

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Junior Certified Arborist
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Our Waterloo office is looking to fill an Arborist / Field Technician position in our growing Canadian Operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Carrying out accurate and complete tree inventories in support of a range of projects according to applicable guidelines, by-laws, and best management practices (BMPs);
  • Assisting with the preparation of Arborist Reports, Tree Protection and Preservation Plans, and Restoration/Compensation Tree Planting Plans;
  • Providing accurate and complete field notes;
  • Data entry and data management;
  • Working with CAD and/or GIS teams to produce figures;
  • Collect point and topographic survey data to support tree inventory and arborist activities;
  • Providing field and office support to other members of the group as required (e.g., botanical inventories, Ecological Land Classification, amphibian calling surveys, benthic surveys, erosion and sediment control inspections, water quality sampling and flow measurements, sanitary and storm sewer monitoring, statistical analyses, data entry and table preparation, etc.);
  • Providing support to other groups or initiatives as required (e.g., construction oversite);
  • Travel (generally within the province) will be required – an estimated 70% of time will be out of the office (dependent on project and seasonal requirements);
  • Handling and disposing of samples and sampling equipment weighing up to 50 lbs;

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 0-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in a consulting environment;
  • Degree, Diploma or Certificate in Ecology, Biology, Forestry, Horticulture, Landscape Architecture, Arboriculture or related fields an asset;
  • Credentials as an International Society of Arboriculture (ISA) Certified Arborist or ability to acquire ISA certification within 3 months of employment;
  • Strong vegetation identification skills
  • ISA Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ) an asset
  • Canadian Inspector of Sediment and Erosion and Control (CISEC) certification an asset;
  • Experience completing Site surveys using traditional survey methods and real-time kinematic (RTK) global positioning system (GPS) units
  • Detail-oriented, ability to provide accurate field and data records;
  • Familiar and proficient with electronic data collection;
  • Ability to read and understand engineering drawings/plans;
  • Ability to exercise good judgment;
  • Self-motivated and able to balance multiple tasks;
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Great teammate, collaborative with other staff;
  • Ability to meet challenging deadlines;
  • Comfortable working for extended durations throughout all seasons and during inclement/adverse weather conditions;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; and
  • Must own a reliable vehicle and hold a valid driver’s license;

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process..

title: IT Support Analyst
description:
60% Computing Systems Analysis & Design

* Exercise independent judgement and logic in prioritization of tasks and developing solutions to technical problems

* Systems analysis, including consulting with users, and application of industry knowledge to determine functional requirements for

new computer systems and system enhancements

* Design, develop, document, and test computer systems or programs relating to user or system design specifications

* Research commercially available software to identify products that might meet departmental requirements; investigates products'

ability to meet user, functional, and technical requirements

* Evaluates impact of solution alternatives and assesses risk to support decision-making

* Adhere to and identify potential shortcomings related to SOX and PCI requirements and inform staff on established Company

policy

* Document and share knowledge with staff and other team members

* Remain abreast on industry changes and advancements in technology

40% Systems Support & Administration

* Resolve technical issues while providing excellent Customer Service by effectively communicating with user during support

process

* End user equipment ordering, imaging, configuration, delivery, relocation and repair

* Configure corporate smartphones for email and access to vital business applications

* Microsoft Teams and Office 365 support and deployments

* File restoration, file and folder permission, & Active Directory management

* Printer troubleshooting and Print Server administration

* Assist and Manage Cisco Video Conferencing equipment, scheduling, and execution

* Asset management and tracking

* Provide 24/7 on-call system support and after-hours maintenance


Keyword: IT Support Analyst
Required Experience:

* Bachelor’s Degree or 1+ years of equivalent experience in a Desktop Support or similar role

* Knowledge of Acrobat, Microsoft Office, Anti-Virus, Cisco VPN, Mobile Device Management, Data Encryption

* Ability to troubleshoot issues related to Java, Internet browsers, and Citrix to support web-based Enterprise applications

* Familiarity with Microsoft server management tools including Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, File and Folder permissions

management and others

* Understanding of a hybrid Windows 7/10 and Mac Enterprise environment

* Troubleshoot and configure Distribution Center technologies: thin clients, mobile computing devices, label printers

* Familiarity with Distribution Center applications: WMOS, BarTender, Sterling, Jesta, DemandWare

* Strong communication skills required for face-to-face client interaction and intra-team collaboration

* Must be able to travel between multiple sites within Ontario

* Maintain updated knowledge of new technology

* Handle multiple assignments simultaneously

* Ability to troubleshoot unfamiliar and bespoke software applications

* Ability to communicate and function as a thought leader in the Technology Services team

* Must be able to lift 50 lbs

* Primarily support the afternoon shift at Carter’s Distribution Center

* Typical hours will be from 3 PM to 11 PM with some flexibility

* Some travel and support to our Mississauga head office may be required

title: Dev Ops Engineer I - Daily
description:
The DevOps production support engineer will be part of a multi-disciplined team defining and building solutions to automate day-to-day processes with a view of providing platforms that are more efficient for users.
The candidate must help drive improvements to processes and help design automated enhancements with a view of continual improvement.
The role focuses on an agile DevOps mind-set and requires a wide range of technical skills: 

  • Have appreciation of production readiness and work with teams to understand user requirements 
  • Define strategies on monitoring and capacity management 
  • Work to a set of prioritized tasks ensuring regular updates ensuring the target solution remains the key focus 
  • Understand phased delivery to ensure work is completed to a defined specification and schedule 
  • Rollout new releases and patches to the platform 
  • Help identify efficiencies in processes and contribute to their automation 
  • Thoroughly test automated processes ensuring they are robust and meet requirements 
  • Provide feedback and propose solutions to management on performance, capacity and design issues 
  • Document designs and architectures and distribute minutes and meeting actions 

The candidate will also work with other teams to respond to incidents and resolve issues promptly, often under pressure, to restore normal services to the users. Candidates must possess the aptitude and desire to learn new technologies and contribute ideas to technologies researched that may be of benefit to the department. 

Skills and Qualifications:
Candidates must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in a production support or similar role.
He/she must be experienced in providing multi-disciplined technical support as part of a team, and have practical knowledge of performance and capacity management from an application, database and network perspective as well as strong aptitude for automation. They must have a strong DevOps mind-set and be prepared to work across both dev and production teams with a view of automation and self-service platforms. 

Role Specific Technical Skills:
Production experience across the following:

  • System administration – In-depth knowledge in Linux/Unix and good knowledge on Windows systems 
  • Good general understanding of global infrastructure, firewalls and networking, and considerations in these areas. 
  • Networks: Good understanding of network principals and practical knowledge of load balancing 
  • technologies 
  • Monitoring – Experience in managing monitoring tools (such as ITRS Geneos, Promoteus) and 
  • performance profiling 
  • Automation – Experience of automated test and release cycles and server automation tools such as Ansible, Bladelogic, Jenkins, Artifactory, Bitbucket, Git and integration with security vaults 
  • Experience in migrations from legacy platforms to new solutions ensuring technology evolution is maintained 
  • Knowledge of programming and scripting methodologies and demonstrable proficiency in writing code in one or more of the following languages; Python, Perl 
  • Understanding of user and server authentication enabling end to end automated release cycles whilst ensuring security is a primary consideration 
  • Understand of cloud based platforms and solutions and delivery of PAAS solutions 
  • Experience in Jira, Confluence and Service Now 

Desirable IT Skills: 

  • Containers – exposure to Docker and Kubernetes 
  • Scripting – strong skills in Ansible, desirable skills in Python 
  • Security - Knowledge of and API interaction with CyberArk or Vault 
  • Databases – exposure to or skills in SQL Server, Oracle and noSQL DBs 
  • Understanding of application lifecycle and Agile methodology 
  • Good tasks management, prioritization, risk management 
  • Appreciation of production processes, including change and release management, incident and problem management 

Personal Attributes: 

  • Strong problem solving skills 
  • Good interpersonal skills and team player 
  • Ability to consider multiple ideas and work to agree on best fit solution 
  • Client focused 
  • Attention to detail 
  • Strong aptitude and interest in technology 
  • High energy level coupled with a desire to take on responsibility 
  • Able to multi-task

title: Maintenance Technician I - WorldMark Whistler Sundance
description:
Put the World on Vacation At Wyndham Destinations our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a spirit of caring, creativity and fun, our teams help families and friends create memories that last a lifetime. As the world’s largest va...

Put the World on Vacation

 

At Wyndham Destinations our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a spirit of caring, creativity and fun, our teams help families and friends create memories that last a lifetime. As the world’s largest vacation ownership company and part of Travel + Leisure Co., we’re shaping the future of the travel industry.

As a Maintenance Technician I, you’ll keep vacations running smoothly by ensuring lighting, electronics, appliances, plumbing, and the general appearance of room interiors are ready for guests before they arrive.  

Though no two days are the same at Wyndham Destinations, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Conduct an inspection “blitz” on unit interiors, looking for deficiencies in lighting, electronics, basic plumbing, and appliances
  • Inspect the appearance and workability of all hard goods (walls, doors, furniture, window fixings, etc.)
  • Perform basic-to-advanced repairs to restore units to “like new” condition
  • Complete work orders and customer requests
  • Do basic janitorial work inside units and in the common areas of the resort
  • Maintain building exteriors and common areas, possibly including the pool and spa
  • Perform basic landscaping

How You’ll Be Rewarded

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Discounted Hotel & Resort Stays
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • 401K Retirement Savings with Company Match

What You’ll Bring

  • Basic electrical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, A/C, drywall and appliance repair skills
  • Attention to detail and strong organizing skills
  • Ability to read and comprehend routine instructions
  • A professional appearance and positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to work well independently or with others as needed
  • CPO Certification may be required
  • High school diploma or equivalent (Unless there is a legal requirement, experience will be accepted for the education requirement.)
  • Six months of maintenance experience preferred

A Place for Everyone

Hospitality is at the heart of all we do at Travel + Leisure Co., including how we treat each member of our growing community. Here, you’ll find a team that’s inclusive, values diversity, and is built on a foundational respect for people from all over the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to mycareer@wyn.com, including the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.
