title: Restoration Project Manager
description:
Reports To: General Manager or Owner"A mind built for excellence. A spirit built for service." What does a Project Manager with Paul Davis do?

  • Make a difference in the lives of people as you triage, scope and manage restoration of homes and businesses.
  • Celebrate completion of projects with a team of skilled tradespeople, homeowners grateful to be back in their homes, and your Paul Davis team members.
  • Improve your community by serving others.
  • Continuously learn about improving results and setting proper expectations of others.
  • Have fun and be part of a growing business!
Project Managers work with owners and sub-contractors after traumatic events such as a fire or flood to clean up and repair damage to residential and commercial property.  You will manage the renovation, as well as control and communicate the budget effectively.  This means you will spend a good deal of time in the field to see your projects get completed properly.

Why The Team Needs You? 

Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We will need you to build foundational relationships based on trust, actively listen, and find ways to manage a team to complete projects successfully. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results.

Why Join The Team? 

We are an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada.  Built upon principles of customer service, dynamic decision-making and leadership, we have the tools to continue our rapid growth.  Our team puts emphasis into living our Vision, Mission and Values to be more than just a service provider – our Restoration Project Managers are on the front lines of restoring their communities by leading others to complete construction projects on budget and up to the industry standard.  You will have the autonomy after training to control your schedule and continually seek learning opportunities that will improve your skill set.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results. Team Compensation and Benefits:

  • Ongoing Leadership Development Program and industry events
  • One on One mentorship
  • Three months of structured training to learn the Paul Davis Way
  • Access to Paul Davis University and regular training opportunities
  • Cell phone allowance; computer provided by company
  • Company vehicle or vehicle allowance
  • Benefits and sick days with flexible schedule
  • Base commission on projects completed. Our Project Managers yearly pay ranges from $60,000 to $120,000 depending on their production. No limit to earning potential.
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):

  • Ability to lead and develop team
  • Career emphasis on learning and continuing education
  • Sound planning and organizational skills
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience
Construction project management experience is welcomed if willing to learn a new process.  If limited experience but you meet all qualifications, we will invest in your training. Role on the Team (Job Functions):

  • Meet operational objectives of: Sales, Gross Margin, Brand Experience
  • Confirm budget and work orders before start of project.
  • Ensure compliance with standards and regulations.
  • Build relationships with key customers – direct and B2B.
  • Seek partnerships to improve performance with vendors and tradesman.
 Skills Desired of Team Member:

  • Self-motivated to get results
  • Loves working with clients and tradesman
  • Effectively schedules ahead while maintaining flexibility
  • Thrives under high performance environments
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Is succinct and professional with written communication
  • Loves to work hard
  • Enjoys taking care of others
 Paul Davis is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Gallery Support Associate
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
RH at its core is about taste, and we believe the idea of scaling taste is large and far reaching.

The RH brand attracts the best designers, artisans, manufacturers and talent in our industry, scaling and rendering their work more valuable across our integrated platform, enabling us to curate the most compelling collection of luxury home furnishings in the world. We are moving the brand beyond curating and selling products to conceptualizing and selling spaces by building an ecosystem of products, places, services and spaces that elevates and establishes the RH brand as a global thought leader, taste and place maker.

At RH we believe deeply that the \"right\" people are our greatest asset. We value people with high energy, who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart, creative and have a point of view. People who see the answer in every problem, versus those who see the problem in every answer. People who are driven, determined and won't take \"no\" for an answer. We value team players, people who are more concerned with what's right, rather than who's right.

RH is seeking a Gallery Support Associate to join our team in providing world-class service to guests while taking great care of our equipment and facilities.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Live Our Vision, Values and Beliefs every day
  • Ensure all client ship-outs are sent within 24 hours of purchase
  • Ticket all merchandise in preparation to be displayed on the Gallery sales floor
  • Organize the movement of furniture on the sales floor and in the stockroom
  • Receive and process shipments in a timely manner to maximize productivity and minimize costs, managing inventory preparation and execution

OUR REQUIREMENTS
  • 2+ years experience in a similar field
  • Enthusiastic team player who is high-energy and results-driven
  • Commitment to Quality with exceptional attention to detail
  • Superior organization and time-management skills
  • Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
  • Ability to lift and mobilize small to medium items up to 50 lbs. while utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques
  • Ability to maneuver effectively around Gallery floor, stock room and office
  • Position entails prolonged standing, twisting, stooping, kneeling, squatting, bending and climbing
ABOUT US
RH is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by federal or state law or local ordinance.

title: Cleaning/Content Technician
description:
ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg remediates properties damaged by water, fire, mould, etc.  We are looking for individuals with cleaning experience to join our team and assist with cleaning properties and customer contents, often damaged by smoke or water. We offer a competitive salary, a company-paid benefits package to qualifying employees, and the opportunity for ongoing professional training.
 
JOB DESCRIPTION:
  • Packing of contents from damaged properties
  • Clean, sanitize and deodorize contents damaged by water, smoke, etc.
  • Clean residential and commercial properties damaged by water and fire
  • Assist with recording, tracking, and warehousing customer contents
  • Assist with remediation & restoration of damaged properties
  • Participate in on-call rotation
 
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Cleaning experience
  • Strong attention to detail 
  • Ability to work with a team
  • Criminal record search upon hire
  • Current valid driver’s license with clean driving record
 
ASSETS:
  • Experience in the restoration industry
  • IICRC certifications such as: FSRT, CPT, UFT, CCT
  • Experience with contents tracking software such as Encircle or Assured Packout
  • Experience cleaning and sanitizing restoration equipment
  • Remediation and rebuild experience
  • First Aid Certification
  
Pay based on experience.  Please attach resume when responding to ad.





    About ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg:

    As a top Emergency Restoration company in Manitoba, we specialize in the remediation and rebuild of properties damaged by water, fire, title claims, mould, plus much more.

title: Drywaller / Carpenter
description:
Reports To: Operations Manager

"A mind built for excellence. A spirit built for service."
 What does a Carpenter / Drywaller with Paul Davis do?
  • Serve others within your community in their time of need
  • Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property
  • Work hard and take pride in completing projects 
  • Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency. 
Why Join The Team? Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We love creating an opportunity for our team members, providing industry training, and giving technicians the opportunity to become experts in the field of restoration.

Values: Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.Vision: To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.Mission: To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.
 
 Why The Team Needs You? Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. It is challenging to make customers happy when faced with a traumatic event but you enjoy helping them get back to their lives through your skill. Team Compensation and Benefits:
  • Leadership Development - our company grows from the inside. If you are determined and motivated enough, ask about participation in our leadership development initiative to grow your career and explore new opportunities
  • Cross-training opportunities to advance your career
  • Flex schedule - at Paul Davis we are committed to our team and their well-being. We have instituted the ability for flex hours that ensures team members get the time they need for personal matters while still being able to work full time.
  • Paid training
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Great culture and team dynamic
  • Hourly pay is based on experience and certifications
 Team Qualifications (Requirements):
  • Desire to join a world-class team and contribute a positive attitude
  • Dedication to customer service
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record
  • Have the ability to work on rotation with an on-call schedule for emergencies
  • Ability to lift 75 LBS frequently
  • Desire to continually learn new things
 Role on the Team (Job Responsibilities):
  • High-level performance of drywall, texture, and paint repairs
  • Carpentry - framing, cabinetry, roof construction, decks, and fences.
  • Focus and dedication to providing excellent customer service.
  • Maintain a clean, properly stocked, and organized truck and maintain all company equipment.
  • Be accessible by phone and participate, as necessary, in the on-call schedule as emergencies occur
  • Assist in warehousing and facility-related tasks when necessary.
  • You will assist other team members as you see opportunities arise and be a leader for the team when needed.
 Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.We support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

title: Lead Remediation Technician
description:
ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg remediates properties damaged by water, fire, mould, etc. We are looking for experienced Remediation Technicians who can lead crews independently to join our team. We offer a competitive salary, a company-paid benefits package to qualifying employees, and the opportunity for ongoing professional training.
 
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Lead a team to complete the tasks set out on work orders including but not limited to:
  •  Stabilize damaged properties in emergency situations. 
  • Clean up and demolition of affected building materials.
  • Remediation of mould &/or asbestos containing materials. 
  • Packing out contents as needed.  
  • Clean residential and commercial properties damaged by water and fire, etc. 
  • Read and record daily psychrometric readings.
  • Participate in on-call rotation.

REQUIREMENTS:
  • 3+ years’ experience in the restoration industry.
  • Experience leading a team.
  • Experience working with mould & asbestos.
  • Construction & demolition knowledge.
  • Capable of carrying at least 50lbs.
  • Willing to travel out of town for work when required.
  • Criminal record search upon hire. 
  • Current valid driver’s license.
  • Current IICRC – WRT certificate.
  • Ownership of basic hand tools and cordless power tools. 

ASSETS:
  • IICRC certifications such as: AMRT, ASD, FSRT, OCT, CCT.
  • Experience with contents tracking software such as Encircle or Assured Pack-out.
  • Construction experience.
  • First Aid Certification.
Pay based on experience.  Please attach resume when responding to ad.




    About ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg:

    As a top Emergency Restoration company in Manitoba, we specialize in the remediation and rebuild of properties damaged by water, fire, title claims, mould, plus much more.

title: Powerline Technician - Storm Restoration - Ontario (Casual)
description:
Powerline Technician – Storm Restoration (Casual)

Ontario

Spark Power is actively searching for multiplePowerline Technicians (Journeyperson Certified) to join our growing Storm Restoration team. Spark Power offers some of the most competitive rates in the industry, as well as multiple incentives to the employees of the Storm Restoration team. This role is a casual,on-call, as-needed role that requires travel throughout Ontario.

What you will be doing as a Powerline Technician on our Storm Restoration Team:

As part of the Storm Restoration team, you will perform a variety of tasks associated with installation, operation, repair and troubleshooting of distribution overhead, underground and/or transmission lines in accordance with IHSA standards and rules, across North America.

Spark Power has a fleet of uncommitted bucket trucks and RBDs fully stocked with the best and most advanced tooling available. Our storm restoration division is managed by our own Powerline Technicians, and we believe in outfitting our trucks and equipment with the best tooling available. Our fleet is meticulously maintained, and our trucks go through our internal fabrication shop to insure they are set up correctly, with proper storage for tooling and personal gear.

Do you have the Spark?

Here's what we're looking for:

  • Certification as a Powerline Technician Journeyperson, including successful completion of MEARIE or IHSA Powerline Technician Training Program or equivalent
  • Be able to operate bucket trucks, radial boom derricks, hydraulic equipment and all other tools used in line maintenance and construction
  • Be familiar with and carry out live line work practices and techniques on the systems including stick work, and rubber glove techniques
  • Be able to respond to major power outages across Ontario. Ability to travel across Canada and the US is a bonus!

Other requirements:

  • Must have a valid Driver's License (DZ, AZ)
  • Must be able to provide a certificate of Powerline Technician qualification
  • Must have prior training in the following: Working at Heights, Pole Top and Bucket Rescue, Bucket Evacuation


Who is Spark Power?

  • We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.
  • We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.
  • We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US.

Here are some of the perks Spark employees enjoy:

  • Diverse and exciting industrial and commercial customer base
  • Continuous training and skills improvement
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Competitive wages plus incentive plan
  • Profit sharing
  • Meals, travel and accommodations paid for Storm Restoration employees
  • Uniforms and PPE provided
  • Excellent benefit package including wellness plan options
  • RRSP match program
  • Employee Share Ownership Program

….and much more

title: Stream Restoration Scientist - Junior
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

We have a specialized geomorphology team that uses a science-based, interdisciplinary approach based on detailed knowledge of riverine and coastal geomorphology, process sedimentology, hydraulics and geomatics. Our tailored services include geomorphological characterization, creek and shoreline restoration, geomatics, fluvial and coastal hazard assessments, and hydraulic and morphological modelling, to protect, maintain, restore, and improve fluvial and coastal systems.

We are currently seeking a Junior level Geomorphologist/Restoration Technician or EIT to join this dynamic and growing group. The successful candidate will be a self-motivating individual with strong analytical, computational, and problem solving abilities. The candidate will have excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Analysis and presentation of technical information and reports
  • Undertake corridor and crossing studies in order to identify risk from natural hazards
  • Provide support to stream restoration projects based on channel processes
  • Undertake field data collection exercises, as required; including data synthesis
  • Work with various forms of spatial information, including digital topographic data and aerial imagery
  • Assist in the completion of monitoring studies
  • Coordinate construction implementation of channel restoration designs
  • Travel as required for various field programs
  • Other duties as assigned

Skills, Proficiencies and Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant discipline (physical geography, geomorphology, river engineering, fluid mechanics) and be able to work towards obtaining a Professional Geoscientist (P.Geo.) accreditation in Geomorphology or Professional Engineering (P.Eng.) license in the Province of Ontario
  • Scientific skills in a range of areas including field data collection, river mechanics, sediment transport, geomorphic processes, and hydraulics
  • Knowledge of, and experience in, related aspects of water resources including environmental geoscience, biogeography, aquatic and ecological sciences will be an asset
  • Knowledge of/experience in digital cartography (GIS), airphoto interpretation/manipulation, and field surveys (total station, RTK) will be considered an asset
  • Strong communication skills with the proven ability to present clearly, and promote understanding through effective verbal, written and listening skills
  • Possess strong digital literacy: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
  • AutoCAD or hydraulic model software experience would be an asset
  • Valid G driver’s license

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Alberici subsidiary, BRC Group, is seeking an Office Administrator to provide administrative office support on a full time,  basis. This position is office based out of the Uxbridge office with occasional travel to the Burlington office 

BRC Group provides masonry, historic rehabilitation, and concrete formwork construction services throughout Ontario.

The Office Administrator is responsible for receiving all visitors and callers to the main office, coordinating all mail and deliveries and provide Safety and Operational support. Confidentiality, professionalism, diplomacy, and strong communication skills  are required. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following, however, other duties may be assigned.  Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

General Office and Administrative Support to include but not limited to:

  • Performs all administrative duties
  • Manages incoming calls
  • Answers or directs general inquiries from employees and the public relating to the organization in a helpful and courteous manner.
  • Manages sorting and delivery of incoming mail and courier packages.
  • Prepares outgoing mail, parcels and courier deliveries; track shipments as required.
  • Provides meeting services (such as video equipment, audio equipment, projectors, catering, clean up, etc.) as requested.
  • Ensures office equipment is maintained and in working order
  • Ensures kitchen is tidy and stocked.
  • Ensures reception area and meeting rooms are organized with a professional appearance.
  • Assist IT with requests as needed.
  • Oversight and management of project documentation.
  • Setup credit accounts with new vendors/ suppliers.
  • Order miscellaneous tools/material for projects.
  • Prints drawings and specifications for project sites
  • Coordinate travel bookings for employees.
  • Submit employee expense reports as required
  • Provide Safety administrative support (i.e. documentation, coordinate training, update training logs, etc.)
  • Collect and submit requalification documentation as required.
  • Submit “Form1000” or “Notice of Project” forms
  • Travel to sites within Southern Ontario as required.
  • Maintains office inventory.

Cost/Accounting/ Payroll Support to include but not limited to:

  • Process (code, forward, approve) invoices via Workflow
  • Payroll support – complete and submit weekly payroll time sheets
  • Submit monthly corporate card expense reports

Education, Experience, and Skills

Post- secondary status or post-secondary school education in Business Administration or Communications and a minimum of 1 to 3 years related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

 

 

**Accommodations will be made upon request throughout the Recruitment process**

*We thank all applicants, however only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview*

See job description

title: Property Filed Adjuster
description:
Property Filed Adjuster
Vernon, BC, Canada Req #512

Wednesday, April 20, 2022

Westland Insurance Group Ltd has an exciting opportunity for a Property Field Adjuster working remotely and covering claims primarily in Kelowna, Vernon, and surrounding areas. This is a great opportunity and will be a home based position with daily travel required.

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Vehicle Allowance
  • Comprehensive medical and dental benefits
  • Diverse mix of staff and demonstrated work/life balance
  • Career growth opportunities and continuing education programs

The Opportunity:

As a Property Field Adjuster with Westland, you will be contributing to our goal of delivering an exceptional claims experience to our clients by meeting with them and assisting them through the claims process.

In this role you'll:

• Investigate commercial lines and personal lines property insurance claims with insureds, third parties and other related parties in order to obtain facts and information

• Review facts, policy coverages, expert reports and case law to make decisions on coverage, claim value and settlement

• Manage and direct Restoration Contractors to ensure best practices are being followed for property restoration, and that costs are in line with work required

• Responsible for data accuracy, issuance of payments to insureds, vendors and other related parties to a claim

• Manage and direct other claim related experts such as Engineers and Legal Counsel

• Responsible for providing exemplary client service and keeping all related parties informed of the claims process and status

Here's what you bring:

• 5+ years of multi-line adjusting experience, with 2+ years of field work in property claims adjudication

• Insurance Broker Level 2 license and/or CIP designation

• Valid Driver's License

• Community College or University Degree

• Strong background in residential and commercial property insurance

• Ability to work independently with excellent time management and organizational skills

• Effective written and verbal communication abilities

• Good knowledge of building construction and restoration practices

• Computer proficiency with an ability to adapt easily to new computer programs

Westland Insurance Group is one of the largest and fastest-growing independent property and casualty insurance brokers in Canada. With a national network of 195 locations and over 2,100 employees, the company continues to expand coast to coast. Westland's brokers provide expert advice to home, business, farm, life, and auto insurance clients. Since its founding in 1980, Westland has remained a family-owned company that is committed to supporting its local communities.

Westland Insurance Ltd. is an inclusive organization that values diversity in its workforce. We listen, champion equality and diversity, and create safe welcoming spaces where everyone has a voice and is free to be themselves. Westland Insurance Ltd. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@westlandinsurance.ca

Apply Now

title: Outside Sales Rep - Flooring Solutions
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As an Outside Sales Rep - Flooring and Facility Solutions (FFS) at United Rentals, you will target customers, build relationships, and drive revenue, focusing on the rental of floor care and surface preparation product across the facility maintenance and restoration customer verticals.  You will be the voice and initial point of contact for our industry leading company. We will rely on you to use your exceptional sales and consultative skills to understand the needs of interested parties and turn them into loyal customers.  You must be ambitious and outgoing, with a love for calling on customers, building relationships and selling our equipment and services.  

Your advantage? We are the world's largest equipment rental provider and we will support your efforts 100%. This is an exciting opportunity to grow your career and earnings potential with the leader who has set the industry's standard for excellence.
 

Additional Responsibilities Include:

  • Maximize revenue from facilities and construction sites in a defined geographical territory

  • Prospect, qualify and acquire new accounts in the facility maintenance and restoration customer segments, including competitor accounts

  • Maintain and develop relationships with existing customers and their subsidiary companies, acting as a single point of contact for such customers

  • Partner with General Rental Sales Reps, providing expertise to develop leads and close deals

  • Liaise with Facility Maintenance & Restoration National Account vertical teams to ensure full account coverage

  • Prepare sales action plans and strategies

  • Develop and make presentations of company products and services to current and potential clients

  • Utilize Sales Force.com and other CRM Tools to develop pipeline of opportunities

  • Monitor competitors, market conditions and product development

  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

  • 3 years experience in the rental industry is a must

  • 3 years prior experience in flooring and surface prep is strongly recommended

  • Exceptional relationship-building and communication skills

  • Strong planning, problem-solving and negotiation abilities

  • Knowledge of construction or related equipment preferred  

  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record 

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: System and Network Support Analyst
description: Looking for your next opportunity?! Our valued client is currently looking for a System and Network Support Analyst to join their Human Resources and Information Managementteam! If you are looking for a new challenge, professional growth and fulfil the following qualifications, this is a role for you! RESPONSIBILITIES: Be responsible for the installation, configuration, administration and maintenance of the Unified Communications (VOIP, Wireless Devices, etc). Manage network enterprise storage, servers, network services and applications and operating systems in a virtualized and secured environment as well as Office 365 and other online services. Review, assesses and evaluates new information technology developments in the field of Unified Communications, storage and virtualization for network to improve disaster / recovery and backup / restore services, as well as anti-virus and security services. Research and tests new and upcoming networking technologies as required and provides guidance, support, technical assistance and training to other IT staff and the user community as required.QUALIFICATIONS: Computer Science degree or a combination of education and relevant technical experience with Microsoft Certified Solution Associate (MCSA) certification or in progress. Minimum five years extensive working experience administering and supporting Microsoft Windows servers and directory services in a large enterprise network environment. Windows Network administration or engineering knowledge supported by certification or adequate proof. In-depth experience administrating, managing and supporting VMware virtual environments. In-depth experience in administrating and configuring Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Clustering services, Windows Security, Deployment services, WSUS, Microsoft Azure and other Microsoft Infrastructure Services. Demonstrated experience working with networking equipment (hubs, switches, routers, firewall, cabling, print servers, (VoIP equipment, etc.) and network management tools. In-depth experience in complex network analysis, problem troubleshooting and resolution. Working experience setting up and administering Unified Communications, VLANs and VPNs. Working experience administering backup and restore processes using Symantec Backup Exec an asset. Working experience managing virus protection using Symantec End Point, a definite asset.  DURATION:  PermanentNewFound Recruiting is a Canadian professional services company, headquartered in Ottawa, Ontario and is one of Canada’s leaders in Professional Staffing and Recruiting.  Currently, NewFound Recruiting is servicing clients across Canada, having established relationships in Ontario (Toronto and Ottawa), Alberta, British Columbia, Quebec, and Newfoundland.  By applying innovative techniques, we match the right candidate with the right position.  Our 20 years of industry experience gives you the assurance that we will provide the right answers to your difficult questions.

title: Conservation Program Manager Canada
description:
Conservation Program Manager

Location : Toronto, Canada

Travels: 20% of the time

Beginning : As soon as possible

Full time position


PUR PROJET

PUR Projet is a global leader in Nature Based Solutions . We bring Nature back to Agriculture and beyond, by developing global carbon sequestration projects with agricultural communities. PUR Projet implements activities that restore ecosystems, empower local communities & strengthen supply chains, such as regenerative agriculture, agroforestry, forest conservation and landscape restoration. We perform in North America, Latin America, Asia, Africa, and Europe.

PUR Projet is an environmental & social impact driven business and B Corp certified, based in Paris, France, with design offices in our main countries of operations.

More information on PUR Projet and our work can be found on our website at www.purprojet.com


PUR Projet is seeking an ambitious, creative and engaging, impact driven individual for a role in workingwith PUR Projet’s new and existing Clients in the development and management of positive impactprograms within their agricultural supply chains and to offset their carbon footprints.
The successful candidate will coordinate with Clients, Partners, and the Projects Team in countriesaround the world on the development of new programs and strategy, administration and management ofthese programs, the implementation of underlying projects; and support the ongoing relationshipmanagement, monitoring and communication of the projects and programs over time.


SUMMARY OFRESPONSIBILITIES :
Interface with Clients, Partners, and prospects on the design,development, implementation, management & monitoring ofecosystem-based positive impact strategy and programs on a globalbasis.

INDIVIDUALRESPONSIBILITIES:
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
- Engage existing and potential Clients on strategy related to their social and environmental impact, and develop practicaland implementable solutions to ‘inset’ their impacts within theirown sphere of influence or ‘offset’ their carbon footprints;
- Design impactful proposals and presentations to tell storiesand inspire prospects to invest in positive impact projects
- Create budgets using PUR Projet tools
- Coordinate within PUR Projet’s Team, and collaboratingPartners, on the design and implementation of new programson behalf of these Clients or potential investors.
- Provide strong interface between field realities and Clientneeds
- Model inputs and outputs for program implementation,developing and managing program budgets.
- Create and negotiate contracts with potential Clients, with thesupport of Senior Program Managers.
PROGRAM & PARTNERSHIPS MANAGEMENT
- Coordinate with Clients and Partners on the evolution,governance, administration and coordination of Programactivities; including but not limited to strategy, accounting andmeasurement of environmental/social impacts, providingannual reports and support for public storytelling, developing
project portfolios and long-term coordination of projects teams.
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT
- Manage 1-2 Project Officers in their daily work, ensuringdeliverables are executed on time and at the highest level ofquality to support the relationship management and businessdevelopment executed by the Program Manager and largerteam, and to support these employees to flourish with theirunique skills and experience
- Complete annual objectives and annual reviews with eachProject Officer
- Act as a mentor and guide to ensure they are constantlylearning and building their skills
TEAM SUPPORT
- Support North American team on key initiatives and businessdevelopment opportunities including but not limited to:
- supply chain, social development, environmental andagronomic research;
- the development of internal and external communicationmaterial;
- development of formal proposals, contracts & programbudgets.
- Sharing your own knowledge and insights accumulated fromprevious education/work experience

TEAM REPONSIBILITIES

EXTERNAL COMMUNICATION & REPRESENTATION
- Represent PUR Projet publicly at conferences, in meetingswith existing and potential Clients, and with beneficiaries in thefield; &
- Support the development of marketing and communicationmaterials related to PUR Projet’s work in general, and in withspecific reference to projects, to support Clients’ externalcommunications.
SUPPORT INNOVATION
- Work with the international team to continually improve PURProjet’s project, management and communications tools andprocedures, to ensure PUR Projet continue to offer industryleading services and opportunities to its Clients and Partners;&
- Be creative, and bring forward opportunities and concepts thatcan improve the impact and sustainability of PUR Projet’sprojects.
CULTURE & COMMUNITY
- Support a healthy, fun and effective work environment as partof the PUR Projet Team;
- Participate in internal workshops, seminars & social events tohelp carry PUR Projet’s strong sense of community; &
- Demonstrate your individual character, nature and ideologywithin the Company and support others to do the same.

The successful Candidate will report to the Senior ProgramManager, North America for PUR Projet. The successful Candidate will
also be expected to closely collaborate with a number of colleaguesbased in the Paris and other Global Offices.

Recruitment Process :

First interview - Case study - References - Director call


Education :
>A Masters-level (or equivalent) degree in Business Management,Sustainability, CommunityDevelopment, or a similar, related, or relevant field, and/or an MBA/MPAis considered a strong asset.
Degrees in other fields will be considered if relevant additionalprofessional experience in the field of corporate sustainability,environmental conservation/restoration, and/or agriculture is present.

Experience :

Minimum of 5 years experience in business-to-business sales/businessdevelopment, Client management, corporate sustainability, or community
development
Any experience related to social and environmental policy, innovativebusiness development or carbon frameworks will be seen as an asset.

Skills :

Business Development and Client Management:Managing long-term B2B Client relationships, holding conversations with new potential Clients and pitching ideas, representing an organization atconferences, developing attractive and compelling presentations, creatingand managing budgets are all necessary skills to be successful in thisrole.
Science & Ecology:Proficiency in the topics of environmental impact measurement/monitoringecosystem services, sustainable/regenerative agriculture, climate change,water resources, biodiversity, &/or related international policy frameworks,considered a strong asset.
Social:Specific knowledge & experience in topics related to gender, workerrights, child labour, & beneficiary accounting, seen as a strong asset.
Comfort with topics related to the Sustainable Development Goals, Global reporting Framework, Carbon Accounting, Fair Trade or Organic
Certifications, Nationally Determined Commitments (NDCs) and/or theParis Agreement, considered very valuable.
Digital Tools:Proficient in the use Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint; and comfortwith cloud-based data storage applications such as Dropbox or GoogleDrive.General competence in the use graphic design tools such as AdobePhotoshop and Illustrator, as well as GIS and Remote Sensing Softwareseen as an asset but not necessary.

Languages :

Candidates must be fluent in English. Proficiency in French, Spanishand/or Portuguese is seen as a strong asset. Proficiency in otherlanguages a welcome asset.


Candidates must have a valid passport, legal right to work in Canada and a valid driver’s license.
Candidates must have the ability to travel in the USA, UK and EU at minimum.

Why Crawford?

 

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

title: CA- Transportation Claims Adjuster
description:
Why Crawford?:

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are Empowered to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote Sustainability through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize Training and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently recruiting for a Transportation Claims Adjuster to join our team in  Edmonton, AB.

The successful candidate will investigate, evaluate, negotiate and settle commercial lines claims by telephone and correspondence. The candidate will direct field adjusters on a task basis. The candidate will participate in ensuring accurate recording, reporting, and presentation of files.

Requirements:
  • 2 years of technical experience in an insurance claims environment, knowledge of commercial lines will be considered an asset
  • Post-secondary education in an insurance related field working towards full license and CIP designation
  • Ability to conduct telephone investigations, evaluate, negotiate and settle first and third party commercial lines claims
  • Proficient in CMS, including maintaining accurate and detailed activity, transaction and reserve records
  • Advanced computer skills including Office 365
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Must be a team player with a strong commitment to quality and customer  service
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

title: Branch Manager
description:
At First Onsite our passion for what we do starts with our people and who we hire. People are our "Superpower". We are more than just a property restoration and reconstruction powerhouse; we are a team of people who do good in the world and make a difference every day.

Amazing careers happen here.

So, if you are ready to make a career move, and you want to make a difference in our ability to serve our clients, you may become our next Branch Manager.

A DAY IN THE LIFE AS THE BRANCH MANAGER (BM)

Every day, the Branch Manager is responsible for leading, managing and overseeing the branch operations and business development. The BM positively impacts branch operations, estimating, sales, rebuilding and administration while maintaining adequate Gross Profit (GP) levels.

The BM promotes the operational systems, processes, and policies in support of the organization's brand and vision. The BM also takes part in and demonstrates an understanding of the First Onsite safety principles and practices; follows all safety policies and procedures to support a safe working environment.

Sales and Marketing:

  • Works closely with the Project Managers to ensure that sales activities, targets and Gross Margin targets are being met.
  • Works closely with the Construction Managers to ensure that GP goals are being met.

Employee Engagement/Leadership:

  • Builds, leads, and employs the best quality team to achieve First Onsite's Strategic plans and objectives.
  • Manages and increases the value and efficiency of the supporting departments (Human Resources, Marketing, Sales and Finance), through the coordination and communication between the different business units.
  • Ensures a correctly established Branch Joint Health and Safety Committee and that all branch personnel are up to date with all health and safety procedures and training.
  • Develops a performance culture through a robust performance management process that ensures all associates receive regular feedback and specific development plans.
  • Develops a culture of 'employer of choice' to recruit, retain and motivate the best talent in the industry.

Customer Service Excellence:

  • Conducts daily sales and operation assessments and monitors processes for compliance in the branch.
  • Ensures First Onsite standards for customer satisfaction are being met.
  • Ensures that the PMs and CMs complete reports to ClaimTrak, Xactimate and other reporting platforms to meet corporate timelines and quality/safety standards.

Education and Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years' experience in the restoration industry.
  • Proven job-related success in a construction management role.
  • Effectively use Word, Excel, Outlook, ClaimTrak and XactAnalysis.
  • Basic understanding of finance and accounting.
  • Relevant insurance industry work experience i.e. claims, operations etc.
  • College Diploma or certification in a recognized trade or a combination of relevant training courses in related fields and relevant experience may be acceptable in lieu of the academic requirements.
  • IICRC or equivalent certifications an asset but will train.

We appreciate that experience and qualifications come in many forms, and we are committed to adding new ideas to our team - so if you are able to effectively manage a branch in a company that is fast-paced and growing, please consider applying. Our recruitment process centres around getting to know you better, so we can gather and grow the best talent in the industry. We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Inside Sales / Customer Service Rep
description:
We’re Durabond, and for over the last 50 years, we’ve developed a reputation for quality. When it comes to wall systems, EIFS, plasters, paints, stuccos, epoxy, and coatings, our brand is synonymous with outstanding products and excellent customer service.

We’re looking for someone who is excited to work in a fast-paced environment while providing excellent customer support. If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

Customer Service Rep.

Your goal in this position is to provide outstanding customer service while managing the ins and outs of our contractor order desk. You’ll be taking orders in person, online, and by phone, while managing our store inventory. Most of the time you’ll be working independently, making sure that every order is processed accurately.

We want someone who is dedicated to helping customers find the right product for them. That’s why you’ll need to be knowledgeable about the kinds of products we sell.

Here are some of the qualities we’re looking for:
  • Self-motivated – you don’t need someone standing over your shoulder telling you what to do, and you’re always ready to take initiative when helping customers.
  • Good communication – you like talking to people and genuinely want to help them out. You’re always thinking of a product or strategy that will make their project easier.
  • Good learner – you’re interested in learning more about our products and customers. You pick up things easily and can master our ordering system and product line quickly.
  • Multi-task – you enjoy the challenge of being everywhere at once. You can keep track of different tasks simultaneously, and have a talent for starting right where you left off.

Above all, we’re looking for someone who wants to start a career with us. With 3 locations, we’re hoping that you’ll want to join our many employees who’ve thrived at Durabond for years.

The Details:
For parts of the year you’ll be working Monday to Friday, 7am – 4pm. But things can get a little hectic in the spring, summer and fall so that means more hours: when the weather gets nice, you’ll start staying until 5pm and working alternating Saturdays. The position is at our Scarborough, ON facility.

We offer an attractive starting hourly rate, commensurate with experience, as well as comprehensive benefits and potential for performance bonuses.

Working at Durabond:
Despite our successes, we’re still a family company at heart. That’s why we like to host events for employees, like BBQs and an annual Christmas party. It’s just one of the ways we foster a positive, fun environment for everyone.

Qualifications:
  • Experience working in a fast-paced customer service role.
  • Experience working in a retail sales role (eg. Home Hardware, Rona, Sherwin Williams).
  • Experience working in the construction industry.
  • Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office and internet research.
  • Experience with inventory/accounting software would be considered an asset.
  • High school diploma or equivalent.

How to Apply:
Please send your resumes to info@durabond.com

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process let us know.

About Durabond Products Limited:
We are a leading manufacturer and developer of Exterior Insulated Cladding Systems, Specialized Architectural Coatings, Concrete Restoration Products, Protective Coatings, and a wide range of other related construction products. Whether a high-rise building or a single-family dwelling, new construction or a restoration project, we understand the critical importance of getting it right the first time.

The successful candidate will perform quality assurance review of network contractor estimates.   The review team is responsible to audit estimates and make recommendations based on program instructions provided by individual clients.   Frequent interaction with adjusters, contractors, and District Managers to exchange information, answer inquiries, and escalate quality trends identified.

 

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Reviews network contractor repair estimates to ensure estimates are technically accurate and meet appropriate industry guidelines and standards for repairs
  • Compiles specific estimate revision requests and interacts with network contractors (verbal and written) to obtain appropriate estimate corrections.
  • Manage multiple assignments and tasks within each assignment in XactAnalysis Estimate Review queue
  • Understands and comprehends multiple network programs, guidelines and requirements.
  • Interacts with clients (verbal and written) for specific discussions relating to assignment activity
  • Participates in special projects or performs duties in other areas as requested
  • Upholds the Crawford Code of Business Conduct and Ethics at all times.
Requirements:
  • Intermediate understanding of construction materials and installation methods
  • Intermediate understanding of Xactware suite of products
  • Intermediate understanding on water mitigation standards (IICRC S500)
  • Intermediate proficiency in evaluating roof damage i.e. wind and hail
  • Intermediate understanding of construction order of operations
  • Highly proficient and advanced computer skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Good time management abilities.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving ability.
  • Excellent written, verbal and oral communication skills.  
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • English/French Bilingual an asset
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

 

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

 

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

 

In accordance with the Human Rights Code and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

 

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

title: CA - Desk Adjuster Level 3
description:
Why Crawford?:

People taking care of people. Itâ€™s that simple. At Crawford & Company, we treat our clientsâ€™ policyholders like our own, helping to restore and enhance lives, businesses and communities at all points of the claims management process. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

We are guided by our collective value system: RESTORE.

At Crawford, we:

  • Respect our culture of integrity and ethical behavior, while embracing the unique talents of the individual and encouraging an ownership mentality among everyone.
  • Are Empowered to advance the company mission and take ownership of our individual career progression.
  • Promote Sustainability through a corporate culture in which employees are good stewards of their communities.
  • Emphasize Training and an environment where employees continually seek and share knowledge and are engaged and satisfied with their work.    
  • Are One Crawford, embracing a global mindset thatâ€™s inclusive, agile, mission-focused, and customer-focused.
  • Give Recognition, participating in an environment where people are rewarded for jobs well done.
  • Embody an Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently recruiting for a Desk Adjuster Level 3 to join our inside claims team in Quebec.

Job Description:


The qualified candidate will be responsible for evaluating casualty claims through loss investigation and negotiates settlements in accordance with provincial licensing requirements, while maintaining adequate production levels and customer relationships.

 

Responsibilities:  

  • Investigation, collection, and analysis of claims information
  • Evaluates coverage, liability, and quantum
  • Negotiates, settles, and finalizes claims
  • Accurate recording, reporting and presentation of files
  • Maintenance of accurate billing, and time and expense records
  • Work with manager to maintain client relations
Requirements:
  • Minimum 5 years of technical experience in casualty claims handling
  • AMF License required
  • CIP designation is an asset  
  • Post Secondary education in an insurance related field will be considered an asset
  • Strong computer and reporting skills including Office 365 and Windows 10
  • A team player with outstanding customer service skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and mathematical ability
  • Able to manage multiple priorities
  • Strong PC skills including application based skills
  • Complete continuing education courses as required by Crawford and Company, province, or professional trade association
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.

Train, coach, guide, support, and mentor our Team Leaders with daily operational tasks including service level adherence, staff performance, and administrative tasks. title: Carpenter (FT)
description:
As a Carpenter, you will be responsible for reading blueprints and working with lumber, plywood, wallboard, and other materials to help within the scope of our Building Envelope projects. You may build and repair wooden structures and use a variety of tools such as hammers, power saws, tape measures, drills, etc. depending on the needs of our Building Envelope project.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team! 

Responsibilities:
  • Installing wooden structures such as roofing frames, rafters, partitions, joists, and stud work
  • Selecting lumber by size and strength to suit each job, sourcing wood to suit the customer’s budget and style
  • Calculating the number of fasteners required for each job
  • Reading blueprints and designs to work to specifications prepared by other construction professionals, architects, and building code recommendations
  • Liaising with clients, suppliers, and other construction professionals
  • Other duties assigned.

Requirements:
  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Carpenter or equivalent.
  • A certificate in the relevant area is preferred.
  • Experience in using hand and power tools such as drills, chisels, sanders, saws, and nail guns.
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills
  • Experience using construction machinery is an asset

Benefits:   
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work-life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more! 
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment. 




About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Construction Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Construction Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible.  

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!
 
Responsibilities:
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Operating equipment like drills, saw, shovels, and other heavy machinery.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Attending meetings and workshops.
  • Completing on-the-job training.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.

Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!

We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. title: Project Manager (FT)
description:
The Project Manager is responsible for all aspects of project management, including, but not limited to: procurement, scope, schedule, cost, quality, communications, risk, and stakeholders. The Project Manager will work closely with the production team and stakeholders and maintain an excellent relationship with subcontractors and clients. The Project Manager must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and position-relevant bonding and certifications. 

Responsibilities: 
  • Manage project activities throughout the life cycle of the project. 
  • Achieve the project budget and complete accurate monthly forecasts; 
  • Act as primary liaison with clients, site superintendents, sub-trades, and other project stakeholders 
  • Organize project teams into suitable workgroups and guide the teams through their efforts to produce deliverables according to specification 
  • Manage internal and/or external contractors or trades 
  • Manage trade contractor site meetings, RFIs, submittal, invoices, and control document process 
  • Plan all project timelines, milestones, deliverables, and micro-deliverables using the appropriate software tools and/or project management methods 
  • Monitor project quality, Issue start-up notices, and assist site superintendent with project start-up. 
  • Create and issue a “New City” warranty if required. 
  • Complete accurate monthly forecasts for all assigned projects 
  • Schedule closeout meetings with customers or consultants to ensure customer satisfaction. 
  • Manage mockups and record-keeping of mockups for each major component. 
  • Identify internal deficiencies; track and record the progress of deficiencies. 
  
Requirements: 
  • Degree or diploma in a related field 
  • Three years of experience in a management role and/or five years of experience in residential, commercial, or high-rise construction. 
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills 
  • Ability to manage coordination efforts in construction maintenance projects with various parties, such as architects, project engineers, and landscaping installers 
  • Strong knowledge of health and safety regulations 
  • Proven experience preparing and conducting post-implementation evaluations 
  • Ability to create realistic schedules to support the timely completion of construction maintenance projects 
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise necessary cost control measures 
  • Demonstrated project management skills 
  • Ability to prioritize and manage conflicting demands 
 
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.


About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently.   • Embody an  Entrepreneurial Spirit, sharing a passion to succeed, innovate, and outpace our competitors.

We believe in leading by example â€“ at work and in our communities. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve.  Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in mission, vision and values. Learn more at  www.crawfordandcompany.com.

In addition to a competitive salary, Crawford offers you:

  • Career advancement potential locally, nationally and internationally. Crawford & Company has more than 700 locations in 70 countries
  • On-going training opportunities through every stage of your career
  • Strong benefits package including Registered Pension Plan; health, dental, and life insurance; employee stock purchase plans; tuition reimbursement and so much more.
Position Summary:

We are currently recruiting for an  Senior Application Developer  to join our team to work remotely in British Columbia, Canada

 

The successful candidate will be responsible for being the key provider of solutions in a team of application developers.   The tasks include developing high quality code to produce functional software applications to fulfill the specific requirements. Working in a team and individually to troubleshoot, and provide technical expertise to develop and maintain various systems.   The ideal candidates will be able to help embed agile processes and mentor the team members, introducing new processes and standards.

 

Responsibilities

  • Define, design, write, and maintain programs of a complex nature
  • Implements research, development and design activities
  • Test coordination and debug upgrades
  • Consults with and advises users concerning problem areas of data processing applications in operations.
  • Contribute to software delivery within an Agile environment.
  • Special projects on own initiative and as directed by Manager
Requirements:
  • Minimum 4-year college degree, preferably in a technical field, from an accredited college/university
  • 5+ years demonstrable development experience on Microsoft tech stack within a variety of software environments (small, enterprise and complex) primarily for web-based solutions. A minimum of 2-3 years of Canadian expereince is required.  
  • Proven delivery of complex commercial systems, preferably including integrations with third party systems
  • Ability to independently conceive and communicate technical details both verbally and in writing
  • Coding capabilities in several of: .NET Framework standards and technologies: C#, .NET, .NET Core, SOA, Angular 8+, Typescript, Telerik, WebAPI, Swagger, Postman, Kendo UI
  • Dependency Injection, ORM, HTML5, CSS (Sass, Less, SCSS), Bootstrap, SQL Server, SQL/T-SQL, JSON, REST
  • Strong understanding of good secure coding practices, principles & patterns (DRY, SOLID, TDD (MSTest/Nunit), Code Coverage Analysis)
  • Strong experience of working in an agile development team
  • Strong experience with GIT and Azure DevOps cloud services
  • Experience with Azure or AWS an asset
  • Strong experience within CI / CD environment
  • XP / Pair Programming
  • Able to manage multiple priorities
  • Team Player
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Strategic & systematic thinker
  • Proven delivery of complex commercial systems, preferably including integrations with third party systems
Additional Information:

We thank all applicants for their interest in Crawford & Company however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Crawford is an Employment Equity employer.

 

Crawford is strongly committed to diversity within its community. We welcome applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. We encourage freedom of association, fair compensation and labour practices and avoid child labour.

 

Crawford is committed to identify and remove any discriminatory policies and practices found in the recruitment, selection and hiring, promotion, training, retention and termination of employees in all levels and categories of employment.

 

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Crawfordâ€™s own policies, a request for accommodation will be considered throughout the hiring process.

 

Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. If you have an accommodation need, please email resumes@crawco.ca as soon as possible to make appropriate arrangements.
